story:
Here's how it normally goes.

You're young. You want to live somewhere cool.

You pack up your stuff ... say goodbye to your family and friends ... and move to some city that by your standards has what you want.

Change your perspective. Create what you want.

In our last election, 10% of 18-29 year-olds voted in Tulsa. That's one of the lowest turnouts in the nation.

Why should our city officials listen to us? We aren't turning up. We aren't giving them a reason to listen. 

We didn't put them there to make the changes we want. We need to change that.

Let's change our city. Let's represent ourselves. It's much easier than you'd expect.

We don't have some politician or wealthy CEO telling us what to do. They're just like you.

Help fund artists, writers, musicians, and designers to create a campaign to get people's attention. Then vote.

IF YOU WANT TO GET YOUR NAME PRINTED IN THE BOOK, DONATE BY THIS SUNDAY, MAY 19th! I DIDN'T KNOW MY PRINT DEADLINE WHEN I FIRST SET UP THE CAMPAIGN!

Hello! This is my second book printing campaign to help me with my final push. An amazing community already helped me raise $3000 (after fees) last August to help me self-publish copies of my book, and now that I'm working around the clock to reach a REAL DEADLINE of May 20th, I'm hoping that those of you who didn't get the chance to donate last time still want to!!

(And a big huge oh my gosh I love you so much thank you AGAIN to all of the first time donors!!!!!! Please don't think that this second campaign in anyway detracts from your amazing support!!!)

Not Your Mother’s Playground: A realistic guide to honest, happy and healthy open relationships (NYMP) is a book on modern open relationships aimed at a new generation, discussing everything from swinging to polyamory (multiple loves). It includes personal triumphs and challenges mixed in to give it a relatable, intimate feel. When my husband Steph and I looked to the stores to find material on the topic, the majority of the books we found were directed to an older, more “free-love” focused crowd.

The idea behind Not Your Mother’s Playground is to walk the reader through everything they will encounter should they choose to open up their relationship. It will show all sides from the good to the bad, not ignoring the reality that these relationships come with complications that can put even the strongest couples to the test.

NYMP is written from a first person point of view as I offer advice and guidance in a light-hearted, relatable and easy to understand tone. It’s important to me that readers feel as if they are engaged in a conversation while reading instead of having to understand self-help jargon. In addition to my advice and personal anecdotes, I will also include stories from other non-monogamous people and experts.

NYMP presents the steps readers need to take to succeed in their own open relationship in a way that’s not overwhelming for even relationship traditionalists to read.

Thank you so much from the ENTIRE cavern of my heart for your contributions to funding this project. Words cannot express how much your support means to me!!! ~ Samantha (@nympsam)
Where does the funding go?

A successful campaign would help me by;

    Covering the cost of printing the book
    Assistance with shipping the book (hopefully worldwide!)
    Assistance with a launch party of the book

Chapters (Subject to change)

Introduction

Part 1: The Beginning

What are Open Relationships?
This chapter will explain the various types of non-monogamy. Where they came from
and how they look today.

  • A brief history
  • A new era of non monogamy
  • Swinging
  • Polyamory
  • Polyfidelity
  • Poly-Mono Relationships
  • Don't Ask, Don't Tell
  • Infidelity
  • Social Conditioning
  • A Note for the Couples
  • A Note for the Lone Wolves

What’s Your Motivation?

This chapter will address the reasons that people may want to consider choosing an open relationship, addressing some personal curiosities.

  • Heard about it from friends
  • Spicing up your sex life
  • Exploring fantasies and fetishes
  • Monogamy feels unnatural
  • Pleasing your partner
  • Preventing an affair or breakup
  • Escaping issues
  • Thoughts on serial monogamy

Me, Me, Me!

This chapter focuses on each individual reading the book, helping them discover more about themselves so they can enter into non-monogamy more self-aware.

  • You in a nutshell
  • Confidence and Insecurities
  • What do you need and want?
  • Past history and baggage
  • What turns you on?
  • Self care

Part 2: The Nitty Gritty

Building Your Framework
Answering the “How do we DO this?” questions.

  • How to begin
  • Establishing guidelines, rules, and boundaries
  • Different strokes & double standards
  • Where to meet people
  • The invisible sandwich board
  • Building community

Relationship Structures
Outlining the various ways to be non-monogamous.

  • The myth of "The One"
  • Single vs. attached
  • Casual vs. serious and everything "in between"
  • Single vs. single-ish
  • BDSM relationships
  • Falling in love ... again

Communication
The most important part of any successful relationship is strong communication. This
chapter deals with all the aspects of it, including how to handle the bad times.

  • Speak up for yourself
  • Learning to hear
  • Language barriers
  • Bottled up vs. overflowing
  • Defining "private"
  • Fighting fair
  • Honesty for the win
  • Articulation and realizations

Issues & Stumbling Blocks
Highlighting potential problems that people can encounter with plenty of examples.

  • The little details
  • It's ok to be human
  • Scheudling & time management
  • Spending cash on other lovers
  • New relationship energy
  • Battle of the sexes

Jealousy
Dealing with jealousy is probably the thing people ask me about the most!

  • Beneath the layers
  • One emotion vs. many
  • Taking steps to combat jealousy
  • Ye shall overcome
  • Compersion

Sex & Sexuality
All about the many ways that non-monogamy can open up sexual boundaries.

  • First things first
  • Sexpectations
  • Stuck in a rut?
  • Exploring together
  • Exploring apart
  • Taking responsibility
  • BDSM and fetishes
  • Swinging and group sex
  • Sexual constipation
  • Table for one
  • Safe sex & STDs
  • Oral Sex

Part 3: The Big Picture

Brain Power
Learning how to mentally deal with the often very intense emotions that come up.

  • Compartmentalizing
  • Emotional planning
  • Training your mind

Coming Out
How do you tell your family? Your friends? This chapter helps with this touchy subject.

  • Is it worth it?
  • Embracing your new selves
  • Mom, Pops & Aunt Judy
  • Friends and party people
  • Everyone else
  • Ooh! A piece of candy!

All In The Family
What about having kids while being in an open relationship? Using examples from real
families, this chapter navigates these stormy waters.

  • Balancing kids & non-monogamy
  • To tell or not to tell
  • Is this legal?

Growing With It
This chapter talks about some bigger picture ideas including looking to the readers’
future with non-monogamy.

  • Breakups and heartaches
  • How far can it go?
  • Redefining roles
  • Is this still for you?
  • Don't be an elite douchenozzle
  • Advocacy and activism

Cherries On Top
Discussing the awesome side effects of open relationships that aren’t generally discussed in other books on the subject.

  • Strengthening your relationship
  • A new sense of self
  • Giving and receiving
  • Accelerated problem solving
  • Having and eating your cake

Glossary

story:
I have created a series of stories that I would like to turn into childrens books.  All are depicting the creativity my son has and the adventures his imagination has taken him on.  I would like to share these stories with children and their parents in a way that is fun and educational. 
I am self-publishing and trying to raise the funds to get the first book out.  I feel that reading is vital to our childrens developement and want to help grow their interest with these adventures. 

My son and his horse, Red, had many of these adventures together. Sometimes Red was a horse, sometimes he was a fire truck or race car.  Every journey was unique and full of fun.
Any help would be greatly appreciated.  Please share with your friends.

story:
My Story

My name is Patti Larsen. I'm a young adult paranormal author who gave up my day job to commit to a life of creativity and writing. This is the life I'm meant to live and I'm thrilled to be living it. 

When I sold my successful small business for this uncertain world of writing for a living I had no prospects, no sales, only a dream. I'm so fortunate to have the opportunity to devote my life to what I love--and I hope you'll help me do it.

The Hunted series tell the story of Reid, a sixteen-year-old boy kidnapped and dumped in the wilderness of the North Eastern United States. He quickly discovers he is part of an experiment--and he is not alone. Foster kids from across the country have been taken, used as training toys for mysterious hunters, part human, part animal. 

In the first novel, Run, Reid is forced to flee from the hunters, barely surviving long enough to meet and befriend other kids in the same position.

The second book, Hide, finds Reid and his friends deep underground in an abandoned mine, searching for a way past the hunters and to safety.

For the final installment, Fight, Reid has had enough. He learns the terrible secret of the experiment and knows unless he and his friends can stop it, no one will.

My plan is simple: raise enough money to hire an editor for the series, a cover designer and a format specialist for release as ebooks on Amazon.com, Barnes and Noble and through Createspace for hard copy.


The Impact

I won't tell you if these books aren't published the world as we know it will collapse. Or that I have no other options. Of course I do. I am presently working with two small publishing houses on other projects. But I'm so sure this is the right way for me to go. I love trusting my instincts, and they are telling me to take this to you, the Indigogo family, and have you help me bring Reid's story to the reading public.

What I Need & What You Get

My goal is $2,500. That breaks down to $1,700 for professional editing, $150 for cover design, $150 for formatting and $500 for hard copy purchase of the first run ($165 toward buying hard copies per book).

I'll be moving ahead with this whether I reach my final goal or not, even if I'm required to tap into other (family) sources to do it. Planned release of Run is October 1st with Hide to follow November 1st and Fight just in time for the Christmas season on December 1st.


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? NO WORRIES. I know what it's like, really. But please, PLEASE, if you would--just pass this around! Word of mouth makes these projects fly and Reid deserves to escape the fate I've set for him--or does he? Only one way to find out!

story:
About Massively Networked

After more than two years of research and writing, Massively Networked: How the convergence of social media and technology is changing your life is now in final edit. Massively Networked is not just another book on social media; it gets to the heart of surprising changes that are rattling assumptions about health, work, your home environment, politics, the economy and your place in the global ecosystem. 

Why should you care?

In this world of perpetually accelerating change, it is important for each of us to understand the tools at our disposal to create the world we want. You have more power than ever before, and so does everyone and everything else. Consider the following radical ideas that could soon reshape your life:

  • Going shopping may soon become obsolete -- along with closets, cabinets and freezers -- thanks to the rise of virtualization, collaborative consumption and just-in-time production
  • Your meals can be customized for optimal health as personal biomonitoring technologies start to speak with your kitchen
  • Making a living can take on new meaning as online currencies, fundraising platforms, at-home manufacturing, crowdsourced design, and DIY spaces open doors to rethinking your worklife
  • How you understand your place in the global ecosystem can shift radically as an estimated 22 billion nonhuman agents, such as bridges, bicycles and even oceans, join the two-billion-plus people online in the next decade.

I'm so passionate to share these timely ideas and, with your help,  I am self-publishing Massively Networked to get it in folks' hands early next year.  I would like your support to fund hardcover and digital (eBook, Kindle, online) versions. 

What's in it for you

By supporting the final production of Massively Networked, you will help unleash the potential for positive change by raising awareness of the practical power each of us holds to shape our future, individually and collectively. Contributions of any amount are greatly appreciated. By supporting the project with a contribution of $25 or more, you will get the following perks:

  • Contribute $25+ and you will be among the first to receive a hardcover copy of Massively Networked -- two weeks prior to its public release* (you can think of this as preordering the book)
  • $50+ to receive a signed copy two weeks prior to its public release, plus a contributor's mention in the book (optional if you would like to remain anonymous)
  • $75+ to receive a signed copy two weeks prior to public release, a founder's mention in the book, and a VIP invite to a special event in San Francisco. 


I must raise a minimum of $2000 by December 6, 2010 to kick off final production, so please make your contribution today. Early support is critical for giving the project greatest visibility on the IndieGoGo site.


*Shipping available only within the United States; shipping to international addresses may be possible for an additional shipping charge and will be handled on a case-by-case basis.

Other ways you can help

I appreciate your contribution today, and hope that you will share this message with your friends and colleagues on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn and other sites using the links at the top of the page. Thank you in advance for your support!

story:
Cornelius Jones Jr. - &Now Festival 2012: New Writing in PARIS!

 

Cornelius Jones Jr., actor-author-advocate-playwright-spoken word/performance artist.  Former cast member of Broadway's The Lion King, featured in MTV's LOGO PSA: "I AM LIVING MY TRUTH," and author of the debut poetic memoir Shadows & Lights.

I have been personally invited to read and perform Shadows & Lights in an arts and cultural exchange festival called  “&NOW 2012 New Writing in Paris,” June 6-10, 2012.  

My aim is to encourage a cultural and inter-continental connection and/or dialogue to art as healing and social transformation by using theater and the literary art as a mean of self-expression and advocacy in hopes of educating communities and liberating people living with and/or affected by HIV/AIDS and other life altering illnesses. 

I am asking for your support in any way possible. No donation is too small.  Even a donation of $10.00 gets me one step closer to my goal of $3,000.00 to assist with transportation, accommodations, and food. If you are inspired and feeling generous in your donation, I am willing to offer anyone who donates $50 or more a complimentary and signed copy of “Shadows & Lights.” For those who cannot financially support at this time, I have also begun a recycling fundraiser so if you are in the LA area please save your recyclable plastic and glass bottles/jugs and cans and contact me immediately (iamlifejones@gmail.com).  And if none of the options are possible, simply spreading the word is just as powerful!

THE IMPACT:
Performing an intimate program of spoken word, movement, and song, through self-exposition and the theater genre of 1-man storytelling, I courageously share how it is to live and survive with HIV, as a gay-identified person, and as a performing artist. Through their live dance performances, plays, documentary films, and poetry: Essex Hemphill, Larry Kramer, and Bill T. Jones (to name a few), have inspired and actively motivated me to live beyond my circumstances.  The artists were at the beginning of an era with limited resources and education but broke the silence through their artistic acts of intervention.   The question is:  is this type of art relevant and important today and how are new artists approaching this topic through an artistic and activist lens in theater and literature? 

The performance aim is a beacon of “Hope” in which we accept our circumstances and move on to become better for ourselves and for our community, regardless of where we may exist in the world.

The festival will take place at the world-renowned Université de la Sorbonne. It is one of the oldest Parisian universities, and the largest institution devoted to the humanities in France June 6-10, 2012.

Ultimately help get the word OUT, share the love and spread the message about my campaign and dont for get to use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

Thank you.

HUGS,

 

Cornelius Jones Jr.

My aim is to encourage a cultural and inter-continental connection and/or dialogue to art as healing and social transformation by using theater and the literary art as a mean of self-expression and advocacy in hopes of educating communities and liberating people living with and/or affected by HIV/AIDS and other life altering illnesses. 
I am asking for your support in any way possible. No donation is too small.  Even a donation of $10.00 gets me one step closer to my goal of $3,000.00 to assist with transportation, accommodations, and food. If you are inspired and feeling generous in your donation, I am willing to offer anyone who donates $50 or more a complimentary and signed copy of “Shadows & Lights.” For those who cannot financially support at this time, I have also begun a recycling fundraiser so if you are in the LA area please save your recyclable plastic and glass bottles/jugs and cans and contact me immediately (iamlifejones@gmail.com).  And if none of the options are possible, simply spreading the word is just as powerful!
THE IMPACT: Performing an intimate program of spoken word, movement, and song, through self-exposition and the theater genre of 1-man storytelling, I courageously share how it is to live and survive with HIV, as a gay-identified person, and as a performing artist. Through their live dance performances, plays, documentary films, and poetry: Essex Hemphill, Larry Kramer, and Bill T. Jones (to name a few), have inspired and actively motivated me to live beyond my circumstances.  The artists were at the beginning of an era with limited resources and education but broke the silence through their artistic acts of intervention.   The question is:  is this type of art relevant and important today and how are new artists approaching this topic through an artistic and activist lens in theater and literature? 
The performance aim is a beacon of “Hope” in which we accept our circumstances and move on to become better for ourselves and for our community, regardless of where we may exist in the world.
The festival will take place at the world-renowned Université de la Sorbonne. It is one of the oldest Parisian universities, and the largest institution devoted to the humanities in France June 6-10, 2012.
Ultimately help get the word OUT, share the love and spread the message about my campaign and dont for get to use the Indiegogo share tools!
 
Thank you.
HUGS,
 
Cornelius Jones Jr.

story:
SURVIVE

 

 

 

Dropping this campaign--it's to be renewed in another form...

 

 

 

 

Campaign masthead photos:  The Rape of the Sabine Women, statue by Johann Heinrich Schönfeld, painting by Pablo Picasso.

Fascinating history behind the artworks, and a key moment in the Battle of the Sexes, or the interplay of the Matriarchy and Patriarchy during the founding of Rome: The Rape of the Sabine Women

 

 

Introduction

 

As I began formulting possible future related efforts towards the rape issue, it occured to me that this was tied in to what is commonly called "The Battle of the Sexes," an archetypal expression that everyone can nod & wink & understand, but ironically a Google search on the term brings up no scholarly backgrounds but merely a few scientific studies on evolution, documentaries and texts mostly concerned with things like job statistics and other social indicators, and virually nothing on the ancient expression itself.

I next turned to Jung and Joseph Campbell figuring these two concerned with grand human archetypes must surly have something. There were a few arcane references such as a mystical treatise but not much, except references to their other theories and god/goddess figures.

While my new projects are pending and I review the recent battles, here are a few of the best I turned up and will be referencing, while obviously the subject of rape itself has been intensly debated for centuries, and I give some recent articles on the associated Survive Facebook Page.


The Battle of the Sexes

 

Not in order of importance, and pro & con views used for comparisons:

http://paulijungunusmundus.eu/hknw/holy_wedding_alchemy_modern_man_p1r_e.htm

http://www.christiangallery.com/Campbell/campbell5.htm

http://articles.latimes.com/1988-04-29/news/li-2436_1_modern-woman

http://www.quotesea.com/quotes/tag/battle-of-the-sexes/1

http://www.economist.com/node/15717198http://blogs.sciencemag.org/origins/2009/02/the-battle-of-the-sexes.html

http://mashable.com/2012/07/04/men-women-social-media/

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Feminist_Sex_Wars

While not touching directly on rape, the above give an overview leading to this struggle, in the hopes to better understand what leads to it, while there are likely many references to rape itself and the driving forces that lead to it--for later research, this gives some background to my next projects.

 

 

The Amazons versus the Greeks

story:
Put Women on Baltimore's Local Money: Print the Second Series!

The BNote is Baltimore's local money, accepted at 240 local businesses across the city.  BNotes, like many local currencies around the country, exist to demonstrate a sense of pride in place, encourage people to support local businesses, and keep money circulating in the community. While many of our regular dollars end up leaving the community and enriching distant corporations and Wall Street executives, BNotes stay in Baltimore.

Let’s keep it working for us by taking the BNote to the next level. This April will mark the 5th anniversary of the BNote making change in Baltimore.  We've quadrupled the number of businesses accepting BNotes since they first hit the streets in 2011 and there are currently over 40,000 BNotes in circulation in our city.

Women have always been powerful change makers in their communities yet have never been featured on U.S. paper currency. We think it's high time to make it happen. This April, with your help, we will print brand new designs of our BN1 and BN5 notes, featuring Frederick Douglass and Edgar Allen Poe, and will print BN10 and BN20 notes featuring two notable Baltimore women - Bea Gaddy and Lillie May Carroll Jackson!

To make the new bills possible, we are raising $15,000 to cover printing costs and new, more durable currency paper.

We call on you to help us reach this goal so we can further our work to make the BNote a fundamental and inspirational part of the local economy and communities of Baltimore! For more information, visit our website or our Facebook Page.

story:
Parlé Magazine is an urban entertainment magazine based in NYC that focuses on the creative aspect of journalism and the world of urban entertainment-music, film, fashion, and literature.

Parlé Teen is a free monthly magazine distributed in New York City high schools that will focus on educating teens and young adults on journalism and creative writing, what is quickly becoming a lost art. Using urban entertainment we will get the teens interested in reading and hopefully participating in the project as well.

Although Parlé has several staff writers, Parlé Teen will be created by teens from high schools across the city. Understanding that everyone isn’t a writer we also hope to show them everything it takes to create, run, promote, and manage a business, so that they can realize that although they are teens, they have a voice too.

Parlé Teen, the magazine, is the first step in the creation of a nonprofit organization of the same name that teaches journalism, mentors the youth and provides educational enhancement.

Finances:
The expected launch date of the first issue is September 22nd.

The goal is to distribute 30,000 copies of publication in 300 schools across New York City. That’s only 100 copies per school, but a good opportunity for schools to test the publication on their school population and to gain advertising for further issues.

It will take about $20,000 to print and distribute 30,000 copies and to launch a website for the project. We need help to raise those funds.

Project Manager’s notes
I’ve been planning this project for almost a year. I know its possible, but only with your help and contributions. I found my love for writing and journalism in high school when I started working on a school newspaper. Sometimes all a teen needs is to find something they are passionate about. With Parlé Teen I hope to be able to provide young adults with that inspiration and passion.

story:
"Dying Days" zombie book series needs You!

Hey! My name is Armand Rosamilia, and I'm the author of the successful "Dying Days" series of zombie releases... to date there are three novellas ("Darlene Bobich: Zombie Killer", "Dying Days" and "Dying Days 2"... it is my goal to release several more novellas in the series, but I need your help!


The Idea

My goal is to put together a book or two (or three?) with new characters set in the same world as my other survivors. "Still Dying: Select Scenes From Dying Days" will be the first. It will feature people trying to survive and their own unique short stories.


What We Need & What You Get

That's where you come in... and into the story itself! We'll be taking donations in exchange for parts in the books themselves... the more you donate, the bigger your part! I'll work with individuals to get the most information I can from you to make your survival (or death, let's face it: zombies!) as memorable as possible! We have several different levels of perks, and depending on the amount of different ones, we can have quite a few different new releases in the series!


Other Ways You Can Help

This is a word of mouth campaign for me, and something a bit different... I hope you will join in the fun (and the zombies, don't forget the zombies!) and let your friends know about it as well, especially those into the undead...

story:
Short Summary

My name is Trent. I'm an amatuer writer from Sydney, Australia. I currently work in the corporate world; but my true passion is writing.

Last month I started writing a full length novel. However, due to my work commitments; I have not been clear headed enough to spend much time on it.

I'm about to start a new life as a married man, and would like to begin this new life by chasing my passion.

What I need

Firstly, I need to be able to live for 6 months. As I have loans to pay and other expenses; the primary lump of funding will be my time.

I also need funding to self publish the first 200 copies of the book.

The target funding includes funding for the following:

* Editing
* Proof reading
* Self publication of my first 200 books
* Living expenses while I write (and taxes paid etc)

 

What's in it for you

As a contributor, you are entitled to a number of perks (depending on your spend). All perks are cascading - therefore; you will get the perks of the lower perks plus the perk of your donation amount.

 

If I don't hit the target

If I don't make my target (+/- 30%) I will donate the money back to other indiegogo projects.

If I get within 30% of the target - I will continue with it (although I will be a struggling artist, haha).

 

Why contribute?

Not only will you be helping me chase my dream, you will also be contributing to the continuation of story telling. Without it, human existence would not be as rich and robust as it is.

Floating is a haunting, beautiful and confronting story that I believe will touch the mind and heart of everyone who reads it.

story:
About Me

My name is Gemma Scott. 

I'm 20 years old and in 2011 I was paralysed from the waist down and  I now depend on wheelchair on a daily basis. 

Before 2011 I was a keen sprinter for an athletics club in the Scottish borders. I have recently taken up wheelchair racing and have been lucky enough to be able to borrow a racing chair. 

Unfortunately this chair is only on loan, i appreciate being able to borrow a racing wheelchair as it has allowed me to start enjoying athletics again.  The wheelchair that i am currently using is not fitted for my body, it is too big for me and therefore is not providing me with the correct support.

 I thought that the time has come for me to try and raise money for my own chair.

My Goal 

My goal is to raise somewhere between £3000 and £5000 to get my own racing chair. In order to be fitted for my own racing chair I need to travel to Loughborough, England. 

Racing chairs are custom built for each individual and this is why the cost is so high.

I will be taking part in the Jedburgh Wheelchair 10k on the 26th of October 2014, it would be great to have everyone support for this event. This is an event in my home town so will mean a lot too me when i complete this.

I hope to have my own racing chair by the Jedburgh 10k, with your support i hope to be able to achieve this.

Any help is greatly appreciated.

Thank you!

The Impact

Having my own racing chair will help me enormously. 

It will help me not only continue within the sport of wheelchair racing but will allow me to train more often and then, hopefully, continue my sports career of competing. 

This will also help my confidence by allowing me to enjoy being involved in sport again.

Final Point

Asking for help, especially financially, is not something that comes easy to me. Any help will be greatly appreciated, not matter how big.

story:
Short Summary

On June 1, 1660, Mary Dyer became the first woman in America executed for her religious beliefs. Her death shocked the colonists and the English government into into passing laws guaranteeing religious freedom.

My great-grandmother deeply admired Mary Dyer, so when I was about fifteen, I went looking for a book on her. I couldn't find anything for kids. Flash forward a few decades and there are still no children's books about her. Mary Dyer, Friend of Freedom, is the first middle-grade biography about her. I hope to place this book in schools and libraries so that children can learn tolerance from her work as a voice for religious freedom and women's rights.

What We Need & What You Get

I'm about $2000 short of publishing this book. It has been written, edited and formatted, but I need help with the following:

  • Publishing costs, including ISBN numbers and cover design
  • Setting up an author website with additional information on Mary Dyer, religious tolerance, etc.
  • Creating teacher's materials or study guide to accompany the book
  • Creating marketing materials to reach out to schools and libraries
One of the things that makes this book perfect for schools is that it meets government educational guidelines for biographies. Did you know that the Department of Education requires biographies to be at least 100 pages? Mary Dyer, Friend of Freedom is 104 pages, making it the right length for 3rd-6th graders, while keeping the cost low enough to fit many school and library budgets. The book contains:

  • Mary's life story
  • Breakouts on other important figures, groups, and events in her life (Roger Williams, The Narragansett, The Death of Anne Hutchinson, etc.)
  • A Historical Timeline
  • A Glossary
  • Diagrams and illustrations to highlight the text
Education is a key element of this book. If you look over the perks, you'll notice they start out relatively standard (copies of the print and ebook), but if you can make a big contribution, I'll contact schools and libraries in your community and tell them that my speaking & presentation fee has been paid. And if they're close enough to my home, I'll even throw in my travel expenses. I want students to know about  Mary Dyer!

The Impact

Mary Dyer, Friend of Freedom is designed to add religious tolerance to the discussion of civil rights in the classroom by focusing on Colonial history and the price of religious intolerance. We need to broaden what students are taught about acceptance and civil rights. By teaching them about Mary Dyer, we add another strong voice to the subject.

Religious freedom remains an extremely relevant topic. We have just witnessed a shooting at two Jewish centers in Kansas. Different religious groups are routinely subject to profiling or crude stereotypes, and even our politicians are dismissive of different beliefs. George W. Bush once said he wanted the Army to reverse its recognition of Wicca because "Witchcraft is not a religion."

I think the book's dedication sums up what I hope to accomplish: To my great-grandmother, Esther Briggs, an ardent admirer of Mary Dyer, and to my son, John King Briggs, that he may someday admire her, too.

Your  contribution will be a great help in having other children admire Mary and her lasting contribution to religious freedom.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about this book by using  Indiegogo's share tools to let others know how they can contribute, too.

Or ask your children's school or library to purchase the book for their students this fall, or bring me in to discuss the importance of Mary Dyer's life's work.

Like I said above, I've been hearing about Mary Dyer since I was very young, probably 7 or 8, making this book a labor of love as much as an academic pursuit. Anyway you can help out is greatly appreciated. Thanks!

story:
Short Summary

I, a journalist with 25 years of experience, have been with one of the most important groups shaping developments in the Middle-East for a whole year. I wrote the book - in Dutch. A professional translator is working on translating two chapters of it to English. With these two chapters, I can try to get an English publisher. I can't finance this myself, since I have been working on the book for some 18 months now and I'm basically broke. 

What We Need & What You Get

I just need to pay the translator properly. Since I work as a freelance journalist, I know that getting paid properly is getting harder and harder. So no way I will underpay the translator myself. What you will get? Eventually: the English version of my book. It will be the first independent journalistic book based on long term on the ground research with the Kurdish troops in Kurdistan. Truly unique!

If you can't contribute, it doesn't mean you can't contribute. You can share the campaign! Thank you!

story:
WhyFeminist.com is a website that teaches people how to fight gender based oppression and how sex, sexuality and gender can be tools for empowerment.

Why Feminist has had a great first few months. At WhyFeminist.com, we've reached thousands of people from dozens of countries, spreading the word about gender based discrimination and how can fight against it. 

But we aren't satisfied! Sexism, homophobia, transphobia, and many other forms of oppression continue to affect all of us. The evidence is all around us, from widespread sexual assault to a nationwide attack on reproductive rights, there's so much work to do and so much we can fight for.

We want to reach as many people as possible in 2015, releasing high quality articles that both teach and inspire. To do this, we need your help. We're asking for financial contributions to help sustain us and make sure we can change as many lives as possible. 

Here's what we need to make 2015 a successful year:

$3600 for our writers

$1800 for our editors

$600 to pay for graphic designers and website maintenance. 

Even if it's just five dollars, every single donation matters and will go to all of the people that work so hard fighting discrimination! And if you're unable to financially contribute, please help spread the word! Your support means the world to us.

story:
Miracle of Ducks Goes to LA

Howdy! I'm Charli Mills, writer and lead buckaroo over at Carrot Ranch where I wrangle a dynamic literary community online for those practicing craft, reading stories and discussing process.

I'm at a critical crossroads with my debut manuscript, "Miracle of Ducks." For seven years I've dreamed, wrote and revised what has been a powerful story for me to tell. Writing might sound as romantic of a lifestyle as that of a cowpoke on the range, but truth is both work hard and eat a lot of beans.

These are the lean years of my career. Yet, I've been awarded a scholarship to attend a women's symposium, LA BinderCon, and it would be the perfect boost to my career. The workshops are for writers like me who want to tell women's stories, such as the ones history has marginalized. More than that, it's a professional networking opportunity that empowers women with tools, connections, and strategies to advance their careers.

My scholarship includes a VIP event with literary agents, and you can bet my turquoise dream boots that I'll be pitching my manuscript. Help me get "Miracle of Ducks" to LA for my big break -- a women's rodeo with a shot at the big ride of my career. I'm saddled up and ready to ride!

What I Need & What You Get

To make this happen, I need help with travel expenses, lodging and professional preparations. Because I get the chance to meet literary agents and pitch my manuscript, I plan to put my synopsis, manuscript and platform on thumb drives to distribute. Because I also believe in networking and encouraging other writers, I plan to share business cards to spread the word about the literary community at Carrot Ranch. I'll even pitch our Rough Writer's collaborative anthology.

Even small contributions will help! Perks start at $10.

Total expenses come to $1,041. I'm asking for help in the amount of $635.
  • Airfare $206 (patron provided already)
  • Lodging for three nights on UCLA campus ($531)
  • Super Shuttle round trip between airport and campus ($34)
  • Meals beyond included breakfast ($80)
  • Business expenses for copies, cards, flash drives ($90)
  • Travel expenses to get to Seattle airport ($50)
  • Fundraiser fees (approximately $50)
In addition to all the personal financial investment I've made to my manuscript already, including workshops ($1,000), professional editing ($500) and platform building ($300) I plan to find extra client work in the amount of $200 for this opportunity. I'm well-invested in the success of "Miracle of Ducks."

I'd love to get my hair cut, replenish my make up and buy a new outfit, but I am forgoing such luxuries and focusing on getting to LA with my manuscript.

Any excess contributions will go directly to the collaborative project at Carrot Ranch. The literary community is in the process of establishing a way to give back to literacy or writing through our stories, as well as putting together a quality book of shorts that will benefit all the writers involved. It's a group decision but we do plan to fund it in the future. Thus all contributions benefit this creative  and collaborative work.

The Impact

I look at my writing career as a combination of continuing education and entrepreneurial business. Until I have a book published, I have no product to sell. To the best of my ability, I balance offering my writing skills to clients with building my writer's platform. I chose to build a platform and community together because I recognize the need for writers to have both a synergistic presence and a place to practice and process craft.

"Miracle of Ducks" is the first of many fictional stories I have to tell that cultivates a strong voice for women.  I'm already working on my third novel and I produce one flash fiction story per week. My freelancing portfolio of writing spans over twenty years of published articles. I'm a reliable writer; my next step is to emerge with a successfully published novel.

My former career in marketing communications prepares me for the strategic aspects of attending a symposium such as this. I know how to network, overcome shyness in crowds and promote my brand as a writer. This opportunity will have a turning-point impact on my career. And I hope to make an impact in the world as a woman writer who believes in the diverse voices and stories of women.

    Risks & Challenges

    My biggest challenge as a writer is financial. I took a big risk to pursue writing "Miracle of Ducks," but I decided to use my skills and resourcefulness when I had a major life set-back. It has not been easy, but every day I joyfully embrace getting to write.

    I also chose to return to my remote western roots and live in a rural region of northern Idaho. It's an important element of my voice which reflects rural and western women. Going to LA alone is a big deal for me because I also have diagnosed PTSD. I've traveled for business many times before so I know how to handle my anxiety-level and trigger points. Mostly, I'm willing and able. Like an entrepreneur, I see these as calculated risks worth taking.

    My plan all along has been to continue learning on my own (rather than to pursue an MFA). I have Bachelor of Arts degree in writing and have invested in many books and resources over the years. I attended numerous writing workshops to get "Miracle of Ducks" to where it is, including a five day book development course that was offered where my book is set.

    I've already mapped out my trip and reserved a safe place to lodge that is within walking distance of the conference. I've reserved the shuttle service to get me to and fro the airport. I feel that I'm prepared logistically, as well as strategically and professionally.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Read and offer feedback or encouragement. My greatest contributors are often on a lean bean diet like me, but take time to share an uplifting word or read my writing.

      • Spread the word to appropriate people -- patrons of the writing arts.
      • Like the Carrot Ranch Flash Fiction page on Facebook.
      •  Read the weekly stories published in compilation.
      • Get to know the Carrot Ranch Congress of Rough Writers.
      • Cut my overgrown hair or offer to help me to look "good" for LA!
      • Introduce me to possible clients who might benefit from my writing skills.

      That's this writing buckaroo's creative campaign! And I'm sticking to it!

story:
Short Summary

Discover the World of RobotiCS at our web page

A Czech team of game inventors and graphic specialists has forged 2 card games and a storyline with an additive of education into a World of RobotiCS.

Everything has a story behind it. Either a business or a relationship. Essence of the RobotiCS' story is in the book written by me Tomas "Snox" Cicha. I has finished all the adjustments and translated the first chapter into English (You could download it at our web pages here). The first pillar of three is working. You could buy a book and get into the storyline. Become a fan and join us at facebook or Twitter account.

The book narrates a story of Matias Karingen a young programmer. Technology is esential for the living and surround the whole population, which is compound of humans and robotic androids and humanoids. Together with Mat you will discover the secrets of such technological and robotic world, find new frined and experience dangerous adventures. 

But the main work is ahead of us. As RobotiCS deck-building card game rules, card attributes and illustrations are beeing either created or adjusted you could support us by buing the book to discover the consequences in the whole World. You could pick even a pack with fan accessories to show others you support our ideas and the whole story. Or you could meet up with author or a RobotiCS team members to either chat with them or experience a Prague tour.

Enjoy the first chapter for free here!

Why RobotiCS?


Programmer Matias Katingen - the main character

It was my dream to master a storyline since I was a teenager. One of my most favourite books is R.U.R. written by Czech famous novelist Karel Capek, the co-inventor of the word ROBOT.

"Just look around there are robotic vacuum cleaners, unmanned aerial vehicles, industrial robots,  smart TVs, preprogrammed cars, etc. We are living in such world and the dependance on technology separate us one from each other emotionally. I wrote a story about near future to draw attention to this problem."

Origin of the book


Zoom to the cover of the book

As it was my first sci-fi novel, it was very hard to formulate all the ideas into continous reasonable text. During first 3 months a simple version of the book has been created. But my book was full of weedy words >:(. To get rid of them together with some short modifications took me another 3 months. But even though I was not satisfied (I am not even now anyway :D). Together with help of my aunt I made major stylistic check and modifications with some cuts in length and cosmetic changes in storyline. Meanwhile I implemented changes suggested by my close friends and relatives. Because I was a full-time employee it took ages. I finished the book at the end of the year 2014. 

Creation of the entertaining world


Manufactured mechbot
Franckie has been my friend for many years. Together we always like playing trading card games (me since 95, Franckie since 04). But when we reached highest posts in the tournament organisation structure, we realised that our hands were bound. 

To do extraordinary experience and relaxing torunaments with some moral impact on the players, it was almost impossible. Therefore we would like to use the story of RobotiCS, created values to forge 2 more game pillars next to the storyline: Trading card game and deck-building card game pillar. Also we would like to stop the negative influence of dependence on technology, bring people together, help them to socialize, find their self-confidence and bring their parents closer to them.

What We Need & What You Get


Symbols of the robotic clans

We would need to collect 10 000 USD to get funds for translation of the other chapters to English,  more illustrations and to print samples of the Deck-building card game. Than we would like to organize a conference for our RobotiCS team members (you could join this team and take a part!), other will be used to cover shipping, expenses for printing the book and accessories. If there will be any leftover I would use it for next propagation of the book and propagation of Deck-building card game and for more events and conferences with you.

Perks  


Anibot King

We would like to offer you something memorable. Not just a book, but also something you would show everybody else what is your life style. That you care about future and about technologies. We would like to create RobotiCS clothing and other accessories to make you distinguishable, because we would like to recognize you on the street, meet you for a while, have a chat with you and give you a high five. Stand out for something new. We would always stand beside you!
If we collect 20 000 USD we would run the deck-building card game in 3 months, simply because we would be able to pay more illustrators and graphic designer. Now we all do this project voluntarily, therefore we have only small pool of time. If we collect 50 000 USD we would participate at a toy fair in the US - so we will come to US guys and present the game live. We woul do a big show from this trip and organize first tournament in DBCG there. We definitely would love to but at the moment we do not have money for that.  
We would appreciate any help in spreading the word, sharing posts, liking any messages. If you would like to participate in organizing of events and tournaments do not hesitate co contact us at info@rbtcs.eu. 

About the team


Humanoid Rocky

RobotiCS team developes the three main pilars of RobotiCS - deck building card game environment, trading card game settings and world of RobotiCS storylines. We would like to bring you all the entertainment in the most professional and enriching way. We are not a group of white collars but mainly players, judges and tournament organiser with long term experiences. We love card games and that is our drive. We would like to give such drive to your lifes!

About the author, yeah about me!

Tomas Cicha is a card game player since 1995. In 2004 he became a national champion and since that date he decided to start a tournament organising or a head judging of hundreds of tournaments. In 2009 he took a job as a tournament coordinator and marketing specialist for CEE. 2008 - 2011 he acted as an interpeter at Pokémon World Championships event. In 2010 and 2011 together with his firends he organized an international event with hundreds of players. Since 2012 he started writing a RobotiCS book. Also together with Franckie they started preparing RobotiCS games. During all that time he worked either as a project manager or a marketing and PR specialist in different companies.

About the Values


Anibot Siwa

We want to give people something more than the play - the values important for life. So we decided to create a World that will carry such values and card games that will introduce the values to people.
These are the values that we are bound to:

I. CRYSTAL CLEAR 

Everything must be transparent, public accessible and easily understandable.

II. 3E - ETHICS, EDUCATION, EXPLICITNESS 

The Code of Ethics will ensure equal treatment and moral principles. Game system will be primarily set to develop the strategic and tactical thinking and secondarily educate in technologies. Everything in the game should be intuitive, simple and clear. 

III. SOCIABILITY 

Bring people together - families, friends, individuals and teach them thru entertainment. Create 2 surroundings - one more relaxing with stable conditions for families and group of friends and one more challenging with turbulent conditions and possibilities for self-development and self-fulfillment. Create a life-style that they could be poud of. 

IV. ALL ABOUT TECHNOLOGIES 

Interest in the technology rarely exceeds basic user experience. Thru the game environment we would like to raise interest in technologies and cybernetics. We would like to cooperate in this goal with different associations and NPO's.

About the RobotiCS World


Programmer Rony


What?

RobotiCS is bringing education and moral principles in entertaining way to people. It is based on a novel from a trustworthy robotic world written by Tomas Cicha. The author and other members of the RobotiCS team used their best skills and experiences to create one of the most entertaining ways of play and education. They prepared a deckbuilding card game (DBCG), basis of trading card game (TCG) and a whole world connecting it together.

How?

Whole project is based on 3 pillars and 4 values. Pillars represents the main differencies of product lines and offers competetive play of TCG, relaxing moments of DBCG and educational impact of the whole world. 4 values are based mainly on transparency, ethics, sociability and education in technologies. Key elements would be an attractive organized play and great events with technology-motivated side events.

Why?

All of us agree on the fact, that technology helps us. But where the team see the problem is lack of technological specialist. There are a lot of common everyday users and even user experts, which are starting to be very dependent on these gadgets. This activity consumes time. Such trend is lowering the intesity of relationships between people (esp. in families). They may talk to each other but do not live thru experiences and emotions together. There is almost no time for that. RobotiCS would like to give an example how to highlight the problems, entertain people and get them together. 

What to do?

At first, buy the book and enjoy the storyline. You would see what is the possible upcomming future. Meanwhile check the web pages, follow us on facebook and watch our posts at Twitter account. Then do not hesitate to join the discussions either at our facebook pages, or web pages and follow the news. You could even take a part on preparation of the graphics or storyline there. We also would be grateful for any donation you might be able to send us to support the ideas and project.

Discover the World of RobotiCS at our web page

story:
Story of My Book

 

Beside the Nine  discusses what it is like to clerk for the Supreme Court justices, and how former clerks are shaping the future of constitutional law.

My name is Madison Elder, and I am the author of Beside the Nine. I wrote this book because I wanted to illuminate a part of United States judicial system often viewed only through the lens of its opinions - the Supreme Court. Further, I wanted to portray the Court through the eyes of its law clerks, a much different perspective from how it is traditionally viewed.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that the Supreme Court is not as strictly one-dimensional as it appears to the public, but warm and collegiate, while always aiming to find the right answer to the country’s greatest legal questions. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for studying the Supreme Court in you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you look at the future of constitutional law in a new light, taking from the lessons and advice of former Supreme Court law clerks to understand their justices’ long-term impact in an area that has nothing to do with the landmark opinions they deliver.

In this book, you'll learn about the Supreme Court law clerks' role, and the crucial mentorship their beloved justices provide.

 

  • the clerks’ important, yet too often overlooked responsibilities
  • inspiring stories of the working relationship that develops between clerks and their justices
  • career advice and insight about the future of constitutional law from former clerks

 

You will love this book if you are interested in politics, law, and, of course, the United States Supreme Court! Beside the Nine speaks to young adults and professionals who are looking to learn more about our nation’s highest court. This book offers a different view of the American judicial system by looking through the lens of those who are a crucial part of its function, but also out of the spotlight.

 

The Book - Beside the Nine


The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction and Chapters 1-5. In the introduction, I describe who young Supreme Court clerks are, and why their role becomes so significant as they pass through later stages of their career. I discuss their position at the Court and detail their workload, from sifting through petitions of certiorari to drafting final opinions. Each part of the processes and protocol surrounding a case on the Supreme Court’s docket will be explained comprehensively.

Part 2 contains Chapters 5-8. Through stories and anecdotes, this section discusses the special relationship between clerks and their justices, and what makes it so special, whether that means playing basketball with Justice Clarence Thomas at the “highest court in the land” (there is actually a basketball court located directly above the courtroom in the Supreme Court building!), whitewater rafting with the adventuresome "FWOTSC" (first woman of the Supreme Court, as Justice Sandra Day O'Connor proudly referred to herself), and sweet love stories that develop between co-clerks (while their justices enthusiastically play matchmaker).

Part 3 contains Chapters 9-10. Based on interviews I’ve conducted with former Supreme Court clerks, I discuss how Supreme Court clerks are shaping the future of constitutional law - even long after they finish their clerkship. In addition, clerks share their own advice for those thinking about entering the legal field, as well as discuss what qualities they believe are integral to the fabric of a successful constitutional lawyer.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

 

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for my Book - to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

 

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.



I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

 

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share my experiences writing this book
  • And more...

 

About the Author


Madison Elder is an alumni scholar at UCLA studying history and political science. Upon graduating in the spring of 2021, she plans on attending law school and pursuing a career in constitutional law. Until then, she is focusing on leading Bruins Supporting Veterans at UCLA, a student organization she began in 2018. Madison’s work to support veterans began during high school, when she raised over $1500 for veteran organizations, even presenting donations to Senator Lindsey Graham and actor Gary Sinise on behalf of the groups.

When she is not volunteering for veteran nonprofits or carefully planning club events, you can find her researching around campus. In the Cotsen Institute of Archaeology's Armenian lab, Madison works on obsidian sourcing and lithic typology projects. She also performs research on the relationship between ancient Egyptian women and the law. Madison wrote Beside the Nine because she strives to keep challenging herself to continue learning, and is fascinated by the Supreme Court and American judicial system. Her book provides a uniquely personal approach to this subject, reflecting on law clerks and the relationships they form with their justices.

Some of Madison’s favorite things are historical biographies, playing basketball, hiking trails, paddleboarding at the beach, and visiting national parks. For more information, you can connect with Madison at meelder@ucla.edu and on Facebook, Twitter (@meelder23), and Instagram (@meelder).

 

Risks & Challenges

 

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #BesideTheNine and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Madison Elder

story:
The Story of My Book

My name is Claire Navaro Krawsczyn and I am the author of Expectant Entrepreneur. This book started as a simple idea: to document my experience as a woman who was simultaneously growing my family and my business. Today, Expectant Entrepreneur is so much more than that. It captures the stories of women across the world who experience the challenges, thrills, hardships, loneliness, and victories of what it means to be a mother and a business owner--and the unique characteristics of women who choose to be both at the same time. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that there is an enormous and welcoming community of women in the world who deeply understand what it means to be an Expectant Entrepreneur. Through this book, I hope to share the stories and triumphs of other women who have decided that they can be successful business owners and amazing mothers. And, ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you confidently plan your own maternity leave within your business.

In this book, you'll learn about how the women who came before us created a world in which women can be both mothers and business owners and the unique characteristics of mother-business owners:

  • The Unique Challenges of Expectant Entrepreneurs
  • Hallmark Characteristics and Shared Stories
  • How to Be an Expectant Entrepreneur

You will love this book if you are, or you support, a bold woman who isn't afraid to be both a mother and entrepreneur.

Expectant Entrepreneur is a non-fiction book that speaks to mothers and entrepreneurs who are looking at expanding their businesses while also growing their families for the first--or fifth--time.

 

The Book - Expectant Entrepreneur


The book is written in four parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction + and Chapters 1-4. In this section, called “How We Got Here,” we outline the path of women through modern history that created the opportunity for today’s Expectant Entrepreneurs. Part 1 opens up the cultural significance of entrepreneurism within the context of feminism, independence, and motherhood.

Part 2 contains Chapters 5-15. Throughout this section of the book, “What It Means to be an Expectant Entrepreneur,” we hear from dozens of women across the world who share their own stories of motherhood and entrepreneurism. Through their experiences, we explore some of the hallmark characteristics that these women share in an effort to explore what it means to be an Expectant Entrepreneur. Chapters 5 sets us up to understand the context of Chapters 6-15, each of which explores a single characteristic that unites business-owning mothers across cultures and countries.

Part 3 contains Chapters 16-19, which reflects my own personal journey as an Expectant Entrepreneur. I had both of my daughters, now 4 years old and 7 months old, while also growing my business into a sustainable, stable six-figure company. Preparing for my own maternity leave was a challenge, and through voice memos, notes, journal entries, and more, I documented my journey in an effort to share my experiences with other women.

Part 4 is the Fourth Trimester, or, the conclusion of Expectant Entrepreneur that encourages women to connect and build a community around our individual perspectives of our shared experience.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book.

Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The cover design of my book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (paperback, hardcover, and e-book formats)
  • The copyediting for my book to ensure correct grammar and spelling prior to publication (a must-have!)
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter:
    • When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish an e-book and paperback format of my book.
    • When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook.
    • When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a special acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more!

 

A Note from the Author: Claire Navaro Krawsczyn

This book surprised me. It’s existence alone feels like a surprise: I wrote every word, and yet I cannot believe that it exists!

Less than a year ago, I was planning for the arrival of my second daughter with my husband, Adam. Our first daughter, AJ, is the sparkliest little girl I’ve ever known, and I was thrilled to have another little girl in the house. At the same time, I was completely overwhelmed. Somehow, I needed to figure out how to grow my primary business, Verano Marketing & Communications, enough to pay for my family’s needs, cover medical bills, pay my team, and keep clients delighted, all while also giving myself the time, space, and rest I wanted as a new mother.

Owning two businesses is a challenge on any given day. Owning two businesses while trying to create a financially viable maternity leave was a special kind of obstacle. I searched for resources, people, and stories to learn from and help me figure out how to make it all work. Was it possible to keep my businesses thriving while I was not involved? How do I make it happen with limited resources, a small team, and no back-up plan in place?

Expectant Entrepreneur started as my own experience navigating this special time in mother entrepreneur’s life: the window of time leading up to a self-funded and self-created maternity leave. In the end, it evolved into so much more. It’s not my journey alone. This book became a collection of the stories of remarkable women in different types of businesses from across the world. Their willingness to share openly, honestly, and without reservation is something I will be grateful for for the rest of my life.

My hope is that through this book, I can connect women, their businesses, and the people who support them by sharing the experience of what it means to be an Expectant Entrepreneur.

To connect with Claire, you can connect with her via the book website: www.expectantentrepreneur.com, via email at claire@clairekrawsczyn.com, or follow her story on Instagram @clairekrawsczyn.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to you, the backer. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Trust me: I know how it can feel when budgets are tight. If you want to help but can't financially contribute, it would be amazing to offer support in other helpful ways.

 

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook (Tag me! @clairekrawsczyn), Instagram (@clairekrawsczyn), and LinkedIn (/in/clairekrawsczyn) with your friends, family and network. Please use #expectantentrepreneur and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book to five friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. This is extra impactful if you do this as a text message, email, or direct message on social media!

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Claire
