story:
Intro and Summary

My name is Naomi Nowak and I'm an artist. I've been making a living from my creativity full time since 2012, painting, illustrating, designing an eco-friendly clothing line and making jewellery. More on that on my website and instagram ♥

Social media has been a blessing in my life - from the early days of LiveJournal, through Tumblr and Instagram. They no longer function in the same way though which has made things a lot more difficult for me and my colleagues. It's unnecessary, and that's what brings me here.


(a realistically messy view of me at work. i love what i do)

Here's a super brief explanation of what's going on. Skip this paragraph if you already know :) Up until a few years ago social media feeds were chronological. You chose who you follow and their posts showed up in your feed according to the time posted. Simple, democratic. This changed and now artificial intelligence decides what you see in your feed and in what order. Pages or people you have chosen to follow may not show up at all, others may show up disproportionately often. The corporations running social media say this is to "optimise your experience" and "show you the best content". In fact, it's to manipulate you to spend more time online and click more ads (see links below). It's been devastating for art, activism and small business which is why I'm creating this zine.

In addition to making art and fashion i'm also an activist and my work has everything to do with non-consumerism, the environment and human rights (more here). Confession: I really have no interest in grappling with issues of “tech” and “media”. But the problem is that centralised and opaque corporations now have a near monopoly on our means of communication and are actively hindering my work, and that of many others, through artifical intelligence manipulation. So I either grapple with this issue or cop out. This zine is my way of tackling it and it is my hope and belief that others can be helped by it as well ♥

The "Social Media Survival Guide" builds on research into how social media algorithma impact artists, makers, small business and activists. I've outlined coping strategies for protecting mental health. And ways that I think we can change things. 

The zine also touches on the bigger implications: this effects our political climate, the ways in which we consume and interact and can literally be a matter of life and death.



I've created seven original illustrations for this (scroll down to see them!). They are inspired by the seven pointed star - faery star - a symbol I've used much in my work as an artist. Each illustration represents an element - Earth, Air, Fire and Water but also Above, Below and Within. The originals are also up for grabs here to help fund the zine.

We as humans are facing huge challenges at the moment with climate change and a rise of fascism in many corners of the world. I believe in change but it's being hindered by the fact that the way we relate and communicate - very often through social media - is now skewed. This is a dangerous development and a daunting thing to think about. Remembering the old adage "As Above so Below" always helps me when I feel overpowered and hopeless. It's my personal belief that a little bit of magical thinking goes a long way, which is why I've included drawings with magical intent. If that's not your cup of tea maybe you'll find them pretty at least ;) 

I've used my own experiences to inform the texts, but also spoken to many of my peers and read books and articles on the matter in an effort to distill something useful for those of us who have decided to stick it out in a sticky climate.

If, like me, you think this issue is important please consider supporting the project by becoming a backer or spreading the word ♥

On how pre-orders work


Funds raised from pre-orders will go to the following:

- Printing costs - This is ofcourse the main expense, and not one that I can afford out of pocket. I want to support a small printing business and keep this as eco-friendly as possible, which is costlier than international print-on-demand services.
- Time - As this campaign launches the illustrations are completed and the text is ready in draft form. Editing, layout and pre-print prep still needs work and it's time consuming. I've already taken a lot of time off my regular work (painting, sewing, illustration, jewellery) in order to do this and it's gonna take a bit more.

So this is very straight forward - what's on offer is the zine itself - 20 pages of text and pencil illustrations - and you can get yours in a few different ways :) I've even included a limited amount at a reduced price for fellow artists who might be struggling financially. I'll up this number if the goal is reached. 

The original elemental illustrations are also available to help fund printing costs and hopefully find good homes.

If the pre-order goal isn't met you will be fully refunded and this project will not take shape in printed form. Print is important to me because of the nature of the subject - it deals with how intangible, highly secretive formulas shape our online world. I would really love for this information to be on paper, in your hands, to look at when you're offline :) That's also how protection works - I created the illustrations with specific intent to be soft in a harsh climate. I will continue to write about this on my blog and keep posting videos on the subject regardless if it goes to print or not ♥

Why is this important and what's in it? (aka the slightly longer story & deets)


What really stands out for me when I speak to artists and small business owners about this is the mental health and emotional aspect. This development has unnecessarily messed with our livelihood in order to favour... What, exactly? Ad revenue, corporations, yes. But those things existed before the changes and were making plenty of money then, too ... So it must be more complex than that. This goes deep and cannot be easily reversed, but I believe awareness is always the first step towards change.

Artificial Intelligence is a complicated issue that's often difficult to discuss and make sense of, especially as it's constantly changing. We know that AI has little understanding for slower values and deeper meaning - what it cares about is clicks and optimisation and this tendency is spinning our world into darker places day by day by exploiting our lowest common denominators. My dream is to provide an easily accessible foundation to discuss and build strategy around this challenge.

It's also an attempt to heal my own wounds arounds this. At this point I would actually love to just get off social media, but I can't because it's my livelihood. Like many others, I didn't see this shift coming so I spent years of my life building an audience online for my soul's work - which is painting and drawing  - and managed to create a large following on several networks.  A few years ago this was effectively taken away from me (and many others) for very obscure reasons. Many of us are making a living with the scraps that are left. There's a lot of secrecy and doublespeak going on from corporations around this, which I'll go into in the zine.

I'm personally very grateful for the kind and wonderful people who support my art and appreciated my work throughout the years ♥♥♥ I'm saying that to make sure these efforts aren't misconstrued as 'negativity'. For me this is the opposite, a very hopeful venture, wanting to make a small difference for some of my peers and then maybe good vibes and kindness will snowball from that. As Above, So Below.

This issue bubbles up in conversation everywhere. On instagram, facebook, twitter ... But I've experienced a lot of fear in talking about it, because the system may punish those who speak out (by limiting their so called "reach" and oftentimes, thereby, their livelihood). 

Now, some details!

Zine specs: 

- A minimum of 20 pages (this may go up as i edit the text)
- 7 full page illustrations
- Printed on eco friendly paper, using eco friendly inks and supporting small printing business.
- A5 (half letter) size

Zine contents:

- An introduction containing a brief explanation of what has changed on social media, my personal reasons for creating this work and a bit of my life as a full time creative. 
- A main section with 10 guidelines for navigating social media and supporting one another in this climate. From self-care to supporting colleagues to building strategy for change.
- Four mini essays: On mental health, on the rise of fear and fascism + outrage culture, on consumerism and climate change, on spiritual protection and building community.
- Some hopes and ideas for the future.
- A dictionary explaining the newspeak words used by corporations to make us believe these changes are for our own good.

I should perhaps add a disclaimer here: I'm not here to "help you get followers". There are plenty of people who say they can do that. They very probably can't and the reasons for that will be outlined in the booklet. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I'm well aware that it's not possible for everyone to pitch in. If you believe in this project though - sharing it is hugely appreciated and extremely helpful!
You can share on social media of course (please do!), but email, direct messages and word of mouth are just as valuable ♥♥♥

Risks & Challenges

I haven't made a zine for many years now, but I've made plenty of comics and illustrated booklets in my day. Some self published, some with a publisher. 

I'm also experienced when it comes to shipping orders and getting things done as I've been running my web shop (on etsy and on my own sites) since 2012. I have customers all over the world, some of whom are undoubtedly reading this, hi!!

So I'd say I'm qualified to get this off the ground, into print and into your hands! It should ship in December if all goes to my plan, but I put January just to be safe.

For full disclosure and transparency, here are the possible challenges: 

- The holiday season. I sometimes get more orders than usual around the holidays and shipping orders is time/energy consuming. I think I've calculated so that I'll have time to finish this up for print in time to ship it in December. Absolute worst case scenario it will go out late January. This also depends on the printers, as they can be busy around this time of year as well.

- Health issues. I've struggled a little bit with my health this year, which isn't something I'm used to! It's nothing serious and I'm doing very well for the most part I just have days where I can't get much done. If too many of those happen in Nov/Dec the print prep will be delayed somewhat and orders will go out in January, rather than in December which is my goal.

I'm well prepared though, and most of this work is finished :) It's always best to add, just like I do in web shops: Please remember that this is a one woman show, and your kind patience is much appreciated should things get delayed.
 

Links and Resources


https://youtu.be/kc_Jq42Og7Q - Computer scientist and Silicon Valley pioneer Jaron Lanier explains social media issues. Short and to the point from someone with real insight!

Former Facebook VP says social media is destroying society with ‘dopamine-driven feedback loops’ - the title says it all no? This headline is from the Washington Post.

 

Illustrations


A look at the eight original drawings that are up for grabs to fund the project.

Cover Illustration

Earth Elemental


Air Elemental


Fire Elemental

Water Elemental


Above


Below


Within

Intro and Summary
My name is Naomi Nowak and I'm an artist. I've been making a living from my creativity full time since 2012, painting, illustrating, designing an eco-friendly clothing line and making jewellery. More on that on my website and instagram ♥Social media has been a blessing in my life - from the early days of LiveJournal, through Tumblr and Instagram. They no longer function in the same way though which has made things a lot more difficult for me and my colleagues. It's unnecessary, and that's what brings me here.(a realistically messy view of me at work. i love what i do)
Here's a super brief explanation of what's going on. Skip this paragraph if you already know :) Up until a few years ago social media feeds were chronological. You chose who you follow and their posts showed up in your feed according to the time posted. Simple, democratic. This changed and now artificial intelligence decides what you see in your feed and in what order. Pages or people you have chosen to follow may not show up at all, others may show up disproportionately often. The corporations running social media say this is to "optimise your experience" and "show you the best content". In fact, it's to manipulate you to spend more time online and click more ads (see links below). It's been devastating for art, activism and small business which is why I'm creating this zine.In addition to making art and fashion i'm also an activist and my work has everything to do with non-consumerism, the environment and human rights (more here). Confession: I really have no interest in grappling with issues of “tech” and “media”. But the problem is that centralised and opaque corporations now have a near monopoly on our means of communication and are actively hindering my work, and that of many others, through artifical intelligence manipulation. So I either grapple with this issue or cop out. This zine is my way of tackling it and it is my hope and belief that others can be helped by it as well ♥The "Social Media Survival Guide" builds on research into how social media algorithma impact artists, makers, small business and activists. story:
Grow Street Smart Awareness and Inquiry-In-Action with Us

We are facing a world of complexity and uncertainty. People in organisations acknowledge the need for developing new sets of capacities and new ways of organising to face this challenge. There are numerous models, frameworks and examples for getting started, and yet current research shows that whilst these are well known there is a problem putting them into action.

We, Jane Allen, Heidi Gutekunst and Bill Torbert, work with the integrated perspectives for transforming individuals, teams and organisations. As a team combined we have more than 80 years of experience of working with transformations, as facilitator, CEO, organisational consultant, coach and professor in leadership. The core of our work is, Action Inquiry, the life work of Bill Torbert, which is statistically confirmed as reliably generating both personal and organisational transformation. 

 

The models, theories and frameworks are in place – where is the action?

For pragmatists there often is a gap between the theories and the applying them in organisational life. Practices done in offsite education programmes and retreats are seldom directly applicable in the chaotic workday, where we need to be more ‘street smart’ while bringing in awareness and inquiry-in-action.

 This gap, of translating the practices of transformation to become more street smart, is calling for attention!

We have developed a set of Street Smart awareness and inquiry-in-action -practices and are in the process of developing and gathering more. It is our contribution to the world, in a time when it is most needed. We are doing it in form of writing a book with an online extension - an online learning platform. 

 

Is it only for organisational leaders?

Street Smart Awareness and Inquiry-In-Action is for people who feel a call for personal and organisational development, and who benefit from practical ways of applying practices of transformation in the midst of chaotic, uncertain and complex environments.

Have you ever been on a workshop, become inspired to apply the learning and then when you get back to work and daily life the good intentions go out of the window? 

Do you ever struggle to get your brain and body connected?

Have you ever been in a crisis, where your (trained) mind tells you left and your gut feeling right?

It is also for people working with the leaders of the future. Our children. The way we teach our children in school (and parent our children) is in need of transformation and often lack the resources, and therefore we want to offer support to this group.    

 

Together we can create much more awareness-in-action

We believe in the power of small actions and their ripple effect.

Together we can create an even more aware world with closer connections, more loving interactions and more engaging workplaces by taking the baby steps in transforming ourselves, our organisations and our schools by developing more mature and healthy leadership.

Come along and join this adventure by: 

Buying

  • the book in advance, as a printed or digital version
  • the book plus a 3 month online programme

Inviting

  • a group of friends to buy the book and the online programme
  • your work team to buy the book plus the online programme

Giving the book as a gift

  • to someone you know

Spreading the word about this campaign in your network

 

We need funding is for making the book useful and inspirational, by enriching the content with inspiring illustrations, hiring both a professional text editor and a professional video artist. We will need 12000 € for an illustrator, 4000 € for text editing, 8000 € for video production and 6000 € for producing the perks. 

 

“It all looks impossible until it is done”

The timeline is tight, we have set to write this book over the summer 2017. In no way is it impossible - we have done "the impossible" before". In 2015 we set up a commercial, branded, international conference in Helsinki for over 100 organisational leaders: Bringing Transformations to Life in Organisations. A then unknown topic and now 2 years later has become a hot topic in Finland.  

It needs determination and a healthy load of discipline, to make it tangible. We trust our passion and love for making this happen by creating magic in this process. 

 

Thank you for considering to support this dream to come alive!  We feel grateful for every possible contribution, whether it is funding this project or simply spreading the world! 

Come along - join the fun and contribute to a world of more Street Smart Aware leaders of today and tomorrow - that includes us all!

 

/heidi

On behalf of the authors: Jane and Heidi, in collaboration with Bill

Cover designed by Serenity in Chaos Art. 

 

About Amara Collaboration

We set up the social enterprise, Amara Collaboration, with a vision to double the worldwide number of leaders with capacity for awareness-in-action and the exercise of mutually-transforming power. We believe that aware leadership will contribute to a more conscious world with aware organisations, effective leaders, sustainable decisions, engaged employees and more loving relationships.  

In the spirit of being a social enterprise we contribute 60% of our profit to the purpose of Amara. Last year we made it possible for two lovely, active individuals working hard to transform the school system and leadership in Ukraine to attend a certification training, so that they can bring it into their local work.

story:
While we may not have reached our goal, we are excited that the book is still going to be printed! Here's a look at how we're blending images and illustrations to bring the story to life!

"If we could all look at our ocean from a fish's perspective like Mr. Dude, we would realize that the sea desperately needs our help. Read this enchanting story about change to your children and tell them that they are the future and they have the power to do what needs to be done to protect our beautiful ocean." Shaun Tomson, World Surfing Champion and Environmentalist

A surfer at heart, Mr. Dude is someone who – like so many of us, unfortunately – never put a whole lot of thought into the ways that his decisions and behaviors affected the environment around him. He used plastic straws, he guzzled one bottled water after another, and he carried things around in plastic bags. A local surf hero, he was content not to know the effect that he was having on the ocean that was so dear to his heart. It was not something that he did out of meanness or malice: rather, he lacked any real intentions. He did what he did thoughtlessly.

Introducing: The Radical Undersea Journey of Mr. Dude

In this book, Mr. Dude is in for an awakening – rude, important, and life-changing. The Radical Undersea Journey of Mr. Dude is a children's book that tells the tale, beginning with the local surf hero's eco-unfriendly exploits and leading into the momentous day on which he finds himself transformed into a fish. As a fish, Mr. Dude sees firsthand just how tremendous is the destruction he has sewn. A fun and impactful adventure, this is one that I am confident will inspire loving hearts and real action, encouraging the next generation to do what is right for our planet by cultivating a sense of awareness and responsibility with regards to our roles in the world.

I've already written The Radical Undersea Journey. That part is done. What comes next is printing and distribution, and to prepare for that, I'm launching this pre-order campaign. That is what this campaign is all about: pre-orders for the book itself. The illustrations and images are currently in the layout process, and we're getting things ready for holiday delivery!

Grab your signed copy of The Radical Undersea Journey of Mr. Dude today!

It is up to all of us to act as stewards for our plant. The oceans have reached a critical point in their health, suffering for far too long from our nonchalance and ignorance. Widespread destructive habits cannot go on forever, and before it is too late, we need to take major, sustained action toward protecting our precious environment. Local surf hero Mr. Dude may come across as less-than-heroic before his aquatic transformation, but he represents behaviors and mindsets that are common to the point of universality.

You could be saying to yourself – But that isn't me. I don't use plastic straws or plastic bags. That's great! If you are already doing the right things, then I applaud you. By and large, though, humans everywhere are wreaking havoc on our planet because they refuse to see the writing on the wall. There are entire "islands" made out of our waste floating around in the ocean. Enough is enough. Education is the answer, and changing one heart and one mind at a time, The Radical Undersea Journey of Mr. Dude can play a big part in moving towards smart solutions that begin in the home. 

Yes, better is possible. We can protect our oceans effectively – and defend all the wildlife that call these waters home. Mr. Dude starts out as someone who pays no attention to what his habits are doing to the oceans in which he spends so much of his time, and he learns to do better and be better. We can all take on an active role in effecting lasting, widespread change. Families can all make meaningful steps into a brighter future for humans and the natural world that is the one and only world we know.

My name is Vipe Desai, and in addition to writing, I also serve as a Board Member for the Ocean Institute, Ocean Champions, and recently founded Vote The Ocean.

Many of you already know that I’ve been involved with ocean conservation for more than 30 years but it’s the last 8 that have been most meaningful. After the birth of my son, I wanted to make sure that I helped him to understand why we need to live an eco-friendly life. It’s these past 8 years of his life that I’ve come to understand that conversations around protecting our ocean are the most meaningful.

Fostering this conversation has made me realize that we have to raise children from the get-go with the values that respect our planet and engraining these good values in our children begins at home.

That is what this book is all about: doing what I know is right and inspiring others to do the same.

Born in 1999, Juliet Schreckinger is a Long Island-based artist who also enjoys boxing, surfing, and skateboarding. She attends the School of Visual Arts in Manhattan, where she majors in Illustration, with a concentration in Fine Art. Her work features a variety of subject matters in many mediums, although most of her current work is completed using a stippling technique in pen & ink, with occasional splashes of color. Her work has been featured in Fine Art Connoisseur Magazine and the Acrylic Works 6th Edition, and she is an ARC Salon DaVinci Initiative finalist. Juliet’s pieces are often inspired by the two places she loves most: the city and the ocean.​

"Art has been and forever will be a constant in my daily life. In my work, I explore the art of visual storytelling, largely influenced by the things I am most passionate about as well as my real-life experiences. Through an illustrative take on fine art, I attempt to express a story in each piece I create."

Because I've already written The Radical Undersea Journey of Mr. Dude, there is a minimum of risk inherent to what comes next. Illustrations and pages are already being prepped to send to the printer! No matter what logistical barriers arise, I will figure out a way forward. I believe in this book deeply, and just as I have throughout my career, I will see this project through to the finish. I will also keep all my contributors updated regarding the progress that I make and any delays that arise.

Mr. Dude couldn't do it all alone even after learning the error of his ways, and neither can any of us. It is going to take a large, concerted effort to turn these tides, and we all need to come together on this. In addition to contributing to the campaign monetarily, you can show your support for The Radical Undersea Journey of Mr. Dude by sharing a link to the campaign page on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, and any other social media platforms you use.

I appreciate all your support, and I thank you for your time.

Sincerely yours,

Vipe Desai
story_txt:
While we may not have reached our goal, we are excited that the book is still going to be printed! Here's a look at how we're blending images and illustrations to bring the story to life!
"If we could all look at our ocean from a fish's perspective like Mr. Dude, we would realize that the sea desperately needs our help. Read this enchanting story about change to your children and tell them that they are the future and they have the power to do what needs to be done to protect our beautiful ocean." Shaun Tomson, World Surfing Champion and EnvironmentalistA surfer at heart, Mr. Dude is someone who – like so many of us, unfortunately – never put a whole lot of thought into the ways that his decisions and behaviors affected the environment around him. He used plastic straws, he guzzled one bottled water after another, and he carried things around in plastic bags. A local surf hero, he was content not to know the effect that he was having on the ocean that was so dear to his heart. It was not something that he did out of meanness or malice: rather, he lacked any real intentions. He did what he did thoughtlessly.Introducing: The Radical Undersea Journey of Mr. DudeIn this book, Mr. Dude is in for an awakening – rude, important, and life-changing. The Radical Undersea Journey of Mr. Dude is a children's book that tells the tale, beginning with the local surf hero's eco-unfriendly exploits and leading into the momentous day on which he finds himself transformed into a fish. As a fish, Mr. Dude sees firsthand just how tremendous is the destruction he has sewn. A fun and impactful adventure, this is one that I am confident will inspire loving hearts and real action, encouraging the next generation to do what is right for our planet by cultivating a sense of awareness and responsibility with regards to our roles in the world.I've already written The Radical Undersea Journey. That part is done. What comes next is printing and distribution, and to prepare for that, I'm launching this pre-order campaign. That is what this campaign is all about: pre-orders for the book itself. The illustrations and images are currently in the layout process, and we're getting things ready for holiday delivery!Grab your signed copy of The Radical Undersea Journey of Mr. Dude today!It is up to all of us to act as stewards for our plant. story:
Update: Maroon Released from Solitary!

February 20, 2014: Pittsburgh, PA -- Russell Maroon Shoatz was released from solitary confinement into the general prison population at State Correctional Institution (SCI) Graterford this morning, ending more than 22 consecutive years in solitary confinement. The news was confirmed by Maroon during a legal call with an attorney from the Abolitionist Law Center.

Abolitionist Law Center Executive Director, Bret Grote, said, "My talk with Maroon today was very moving. There are no words to adequately convey the significance of his release to the general population for him and his family. This is a significant victory for a growing people's movement against solitary confinement and the human rights violations inherent in mass incarceration. If we continue to work hard and support one another in this movement, these victories could very well become a habit."

Maroon's son, Russell Shoatz III, said, "We are very excited that this day has finally come. My father being released from solitary confinement is proof of the power of people organizing against injustice, and the importance of building strong coalitions. I especially want to thank all of those who have supported the collective struggle to end my father's solitary confinement, including my siblings and members of the Shoatz family, the Human Rights Coalition, Abolitionist Law Center, Scientific Soul Sessions, the entire legal team, UN Special Rapporteur Juan Mendez, the 5 Nobel Peace Laureates, the National Lawyers Guild, Center for Constitutional Rights, along with the dozens of other organizations and thousands of individuals who have participated in this effort."


What's Next?

The litigation on behalf of Russell Maroon Shoatz is still active. The Abolitionist Law Center and the rest of Maroon's legal team will continue our work on his behalf, until we are assured that he cannot simply be placed back into solitary confinement at the arbitrary whim of prison officials.

Our work on behalf of Arthur Johnson is also moving forward. We are in the preparatory stages of bringing a lawsuit to end his 34 consecutive years of solitary confinement. These preparations include gathering documentary records, client visits, legal research, and organizing educational programs to inform the public about Arthur's case.

The Abolitionist Law Center thanks all our donors for your support, without which this victory would not be possible. The fight continues, both on behalf of Maroon and the many other prisoners being subjected to inhumane conditions. We ask you and everyone else concerned with the inhumane conditions in Pennsylvania's prison to continue to support us in our work to end the practice of long-term solitary confinement. 


About our Work

The Abolitionist Law Center (ALC) was founded in February 2013, with the goal of ending human rights abuses in the Pennsylvania prison system. We believe that prolonged solitary confinement is one of the most severe human rights abuses inside the prison walls. We are working to put an end to it by advocating for the release of those who have been in solitary confinement for the longest, and by educating the public more generally about these human rights abuses.

A prisoner held in solitary confinement lives in a 9x7 room with no human contact for 23-24 hours a day. These conditions are generally believed to cause serious mental illness and emotional suffering, particularly as the duration of solitary confinement increases. A recent Department of Justice investigation of Pennsylvania's use of solitary confinement found that it was causing prisoners to suffer a range of serious mental disorders, which in turn caused many prisoners to engage in self-mutilation or attempt suicide. The United Nations Special Rapporteur on Torture has stated that solitary confinement lasting longer than 15 days is cruel and unusual punishment and possibly torture. There are currently over 2,000 prisoners being held in solitary confinement in the Pennsylvania prison system. Many of these prisoners are held in solitary confinement for years, and sometimes for decades.


Extreme Cases of Solitary Confinement

We are currently suing Pennsylvania Department of Corrections officials on behalf of our client, Russell 'Maroon' Shoatz, who is a 70 year old man who has been held in continuous solitary confinement for 22 years. Bret Grote (Executive Director of the ALC) recently discussed Maroon's case in detail at a panel on political prisoners and solitary confinement, which can be viewed here. The case was recently profiled on Democracy Now!, as well. We are also organizing an advocacy campaign on behalf of Arthur Johnson, a 61 year old man who has been held in continuous solitary confinement for 34 years. We will be filing a lawsuit in his case too, once we raise the necessary funds. 

Success in these cases means gaining release from solitary confinement for Maroon and Arthur. However, winning their release from solitary confinement will also help free the thousands of other prisoners being held in long-term isolation by establishing administrative and legal precedents that limit the allowable duration of solitary confinement, and by creating political pressure to end the practice entirely.


What We Need

All donations are tax-deductible and will be used to pay for costs related to Arthur and Maroon's cases. For instance, travel to meet with Maroon and Arthur costs about $250 per trip. We generally visit them once or twice a month. Obtaining copies of important records can cost anywhere from $300 to $1,500. We need to get copies of Arthur's prison records going back to 1979. We are also awaiting responses from the federal Bureau of Prisons and the FBI regarding Freedom of Information Act requests for Maroon's records, which may end up costing several hundred dollars. We will have to pay between $400 and $500 to file Arthur Johnson's lawsuit. The cost of obtaining expert witnesses and conducting depositions is difficult to estimate with any accuracy, but it will be many thousands of dollars.  

Donations will also be used to pay our full-time legal staff. Beginning in February, we will have one full-time attorney earning $500 per week. To put this in perspective, it costs taxpayers approximately $78,000 per year to hold a single prisoner in solitary confinement. It costs us less than half that amount to employ one full-time attorney for a year, and run a law office with the purpose of getting prisoners out of solitary confinement. 

Raised funds will be used to pursue Maroon and Arthur's cases, and to further educate the public about the use of solitary confinement in prisons, whether or not the fundraising goal is met.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with everyone you know. Tweet it on twitter. Post it on Facebook. Email it to friends and family. As more people interact with this campaign, Maroon and Arthur's stories will spread, which will help to accelerate the process of gaining their release from solitary confinement.

You can also support the campaign by signing up for updates on Maroon and Arthur's cases and by responding to Action Alerts on our website. Recent Action Alerts for Maroon and Arthur are there now. Letters and phone calls to Pennsylvania prison authorities let them know that the public is increasingly concerned about this issue, and goes a long way towards getting them to take these cases seriously.

We are also planning a statewide tour in the fall to talk about Maroon's case and the situation in Pennsylvania's prisons more generally. Any help organizing speaking events in Pennsylvania will be greatly appreciated.

story:
A Quick "About Me"

     My name is Tim Savage. I'm a comedian, writer, actor, and filmmaker, and have created many things you may or may not have come across while wasting time on the internet. Skweezy Jibbs. Ricky Santangelo. Adorable Cat Yawns in Slow Motion.  

     The stuff I've created has been viewed/read tens of millions of times worldwide. I've pitched TV shows, been a successful YouTube personality, and been lucky enough to have some pretty famous fans of my work (Ashton Kutcher, Kyle Mooney, Harley from Epic Meal Time, Ed Bassmaster, Norm MacDonald, et al.) So I gotta kinda sorta know a little bit about what I'm doing, right? 

     Wrong.

     Wait, no, I mean right. Yes. Anyway. That brings me to why I'm here…

     My First Novel! (Yet Untitled) 

     It's about aliens. And robots. And pop singers. And reality TV. And nanotechnology. And giant cobras. And Los Angeles. And Space Octopuses. And narcissism. And inter-species romance. But why not give you a taste? Here are a few excerpts from the rough draft:

***

 Crash, leading the way, held his fist in the air to signal his men to stop. He looked around and at the jungle. Through the jungle. Twitched his nose. Crash pointed at the creek.  

    “A camera there.” 

    A man dressed like foliage hustled over to start setting up the filming angle. “Watch for vipers,” Crash yelled, before pointing at a low branch. “A sound box there!” Another man hustled over to start setting up the camouflaged microphones. “Will!” Crash barked over his shoulder to his right-hand man, who emerged from the thickness of the jungle into the clearing.  

    “Yo, Crash!”   

    “Let’s set up shop right here. Can you get good shots from these angles?”

    “I can get good shots from anywhere. You think this is a good place to find some action?” 

    Crash knelt and ran his fingers along the outline of a fresh footprint in the mud. “They’ll be through again before nightfall.” A scream exploded from down near the tributary. 

    “What happened?” Crash yelled, still kneeling in the mud. 

    “Ray got bitten by a viper!” 

    Crash stood and yelled again.

    “I told you guys to watch out for vipers.”


***


 Jennica's two bodyguards stood outside and listened to her sob.

    “I wouldn’t want that life for all the dough in the world, you feel me?”

    “No shit, homie. Ay, you know they say the more unique your life is, the harder it is to make friends or some shit?”

    “No shit?”

    “I’d say just ask Michael Jackson, but he dead.”

    “Yeah, how’d he die again?”

    “In some weird fuckin’ way that only a weird fuckin’ person would. Sleep injections or some shit.”

    “Goddamn.”

    “True.” 


***

  

    Breakfast started quietly enough for the Horton family. Lizzie was the first to speak.       

    “Can I get a thong?” And that was the end of quiet time. Senator Horton dropped the knife he was buttering his English muffin with and shook his head like a cat that had just been squirted with a spray bottle.  

    “I’m sorry!?”  

    Mrs. Horton replied to her daughter and ignored her husband’s shock, put on or not.  

    “No, you can’t. Stop bringing it up.”  

    “You’ve talked about getting a thong with our daughter?”

    “It’s been brought up. What was I supposed to do, tell her thongs don’t exist?”

    “Dad, I’ve already worn them plenty of times. I just want my own now.”

    “What? Whose thongs are you wearing if you don’t have one…never mind, I don’t want to know.” And that was enough for Mike Horton as he stood up from the table.

    “You know what, you handle this Rebecca. I, I can’t even…I’m not dealing with this.”

    “Perfect. You can handle the most powerful people in the world on a daily basis but you can’t talk with your daughter at breakfast.”

    “She’s not asking me about policy and economic development, she’s asking to buy lingerie!”

    “Daddy.”

    “Furthermore, if Hilary Clinton started talking about panties and corsets, I’d react the same way.”

    “Stop blowing things out of proportion.”

    “I’m not blowing anything out of proportion.”  

    “Good, because you have to take Lizzie to school today.”

    “What?”

    “I have an early meeting. It’s perfect timing. You can catch up with your daughter in the car. Maybe she’ll ask you for bra advice.”


**


     His concentration was broken as a parade of Vyperians swished in from the other side of the room. Each had a different creature with him. Standing in front of Admiral Zeezak was Commander Bool, and the first Vyperian squiggled up to the octos with a small cage. He held it up for examination. Inside was a cricket.     

    “What do you think, sir?” 

    The Admiral stroked the ring around his beak with his third tentacle. “It looks awful enough. Is it an aggressive creature?” 

    “No, but it makes a horrendous noise when it rubs its leg on its…” 

    “A horrendous noise that we, no doubt, would hear also,” Commander Bool interjected. “Next.”  

    The next Vyperian approached with a parrot, perched firmly on a stick. “This one has a beak that could do terrible damage, my Lord!” The parrot suddenly squawked and screeched, causing most of the Vyperians in the room to wobble in surprise. Before Commander Bool could utter a response, Admiral Zeezak whipped out his ray gun and vaporized the parrot, exploding it into a puff of burnt feathers which fell slowly to the floor of the command room.  

    “No.”

    The next Vyperian presented yet another creature in a cage. “This, my lord, is what the earthlings call a cobra. A specimen this size has enough venom to kill 200 humans. It is widely feared across the globe, even by races that aren’t likely to see such a creature in their lifetimes.”  

    “Does it make any awful noises?”  

    “No, my Lord, it is silent.”

    The cobra reared up inside the cage and spread its hood while locking gaze with the Admiral. With two tentacles, Admiral Zeezak swooped the plastic cage away from the other Vyperian and brought it up to his eyes. The cobra remained still for just another moment, and then it struck, struck, struck again, leaving smears of venom all across the inside of the cage where its fangs had hit.

    Admiral Zeezak’s beak ring flickered purple.  

    “This,” he said softly. “We shall start with this.”


**


     Dr. Frank Faraday opened his eyes. Instantly, he knew things were different. He knew where he was, and what was happening, even though he had no memory of anything after the trip down the hallway where he threw up blood on people that cared far less than they should have about a random man puking blood onto everything. 

    Dr. Faraday sat up. There was nothing in his room but the gurney he was on. He looked around. The walls were made of concrete that had been set nine years earlier by a local construction company that had recently been shut down for violating building codes to save money in the recession. He looked at the gurney. It had been manufactured by a medical supply company in Turkey within the past eight months. A sharp tinge of fear rose up in Dr. Faraday’s mind.  

    How do I know these things?  

    A door slid open and Jennifer Hsu walked in with her lab coat ensconced associate.  Dr. Faraday took one look at her and smiled. “Your sister,” he said confidently, “has amazing tits.”  


So If You've Read This Far…

The book is finished as a rough draft and I'm editing it. The money I collect will be used to:

  • Put together some nice artwork
  • Help me market the book online (it's a sci-fi comedy. Pretty much the two hardest genres to sell, and I decided it would be a great idea to do both at the same time)
  • Potentially pay a professional editor
  • Buy spinning rims for my car. They are REALLY cheap now, and I just can't pass up a good bargain. I may be lying about this one. I may not.


What You Get

Frankly, you can get the book! Yeah, there are other perks (which you can read about in the perks section), but a reasonable contribution gets you a digital copy when it is finished! 

Everyone Wins!

With a reasonable contribution, you can get a copy of the book, and I can get some funding to help get some attention and advertising for it. At the moment, I don't have any plans to actually print hard copies, but that may happen down the line depending on what kind of funding I end up with. 

Even if you pass on the contribution (and listen, if sci-fi comedies aren't your cup of tea, I get it. Believe me), please pass this along to someone you think might like this kind of book. I'd really appreciate it!


Thanks,

Tim
story_txt:
A Quick "About Me"     My name is Tim Savage. I'm a comedian, writer, actor, and filmmaker, and have created many things you may or may not have come across while wasting time on the internet. Skweezy Jibbs. Ricky Santangelo. Adorable Cat Yawns in Slow Motion.       The stuff I've created has been viewed/read tens of millions of times worldwide. I've pitched TV shows, been a successful YouTube personality, and been lucky enough to have some pretty famous fans of my work (Ashton Kutcher, Kyle Mooney, Harley from Epic Meal Time, Ed Bassmaster, Norm MacDonald, et al.) So I gotta kinda sorta know a little bit about what I'm doing, right?      Wrong.     Wait, no, I mean right. Yes. Anyway. That brings me to why I'm here…     My First Novel! (Yet Untitled)      It's about aliens. And robots. And pop singers. And reality TV. And nanotechnology. And giant cobras. And Los Angeles. And Space Octopuses. And narcissism. And inter-species romance. But why not give you a taste? Here are a few excerpts from the rough draft:*** Crash, leading the way, held his fist in the air to signal his men to stop. He looked around and at the jungle. Through the jungle. Twitched his nose. Crash pointed at the creek.  
    “A camera there.” 
    A man dressed like foliage hustled over to start setting up the filming angle. “Watch for vipers,” Crash yelled, before pointing at a low branch. “A sound box there!” Another man hustled over to start setting up the camouflaged microphones. “Will!” Crash barked over his shoulder to his right-hand man, who emerged from the thickness of the jungle into the clearing.  
    “Yo, Crash!”   
    “Let’s set up shop right here. Can you get good shots from these angles?”
    “I can get good shots from anywhere. You think this is a good place to find some action?” 
    Crash knelt and ran his fingers along the outline of a fresh footprint in the mud. “They’ll be through again before nightfall.” A scream exploded from down near the tributary. 
    “What happened?” Crash yelled, still kneeling in the mud. 
    “Ray got bitten by a viper!”     Crash stood and yelled again.
    “I told you guys to watch out for vipers.”*** Jennica's two bodyguards stood outside and listened to her sob.    “I wouldn’t want that life for all the dough in the world, you feel me?”
    “No shit, homie. Ay, you know they say the more unique your life is, the harder it is to make friends or some shit?”
    “No shit?”
    “I’d say just ask Michael Jackson, but he dead.”
    “Yeah, how’d he die again?”
    “In some weird fuckin’ way that only a weird fuckin’ person would. Sleep injections or some shit.”
    “Goddamn.”
    “True.” ***      Breakfast started quietly enough for the Horton family. Lizzie was the first to speak.       
    “Can I get a thong?” And that was the end of quiet time. Senator Horton dropped the knife he was buttering his English muffin with and shook his head like a cat that had just been squirted with a spray bottle.  
    “I’m sorry!?”  
    Mrs. Horton replied to her daughter and ignored her husband’s shock, put on or not.  
    “No, you can’t. Stop bringing it up.”  
    “You’ve talked about getting a thong with our daughter?”
    “It’s been brought up. What was I supposed to do, tell her thongs don’t exist?”
    “Dad, I’ve already worn them plenty of times. I just want my own now.”
    “What? Whose thongs are you wearing if you don’t have one…never mind, I don’t want to know.” And that was enough for Mike Horton as he stood up from the table.
    “You know what, you handle this Rebecca. I, I can’t even…I’m not dealing with this.”
    “Perfect. You can handle the most powerful people in the world on a daily basis but you can’t talk with your daughter at breakfast.”
    “She’s not asking me about policy and economic development, she’s asking to buy lingerie!”
    “Daddy.”
    “Furthermore, if Hilary Clinton started talking about panties and corsets, I’d react the same way.”
    “Stop blowing things out of proportion.”
    “I’m not blowing anything out of proportion.”  
    “Good, because you have to take Lizzie to school today.”
    “What?”
    “I have an early meeting. It’s perfect timing. You can catch up with your daughter in the car. Maybe she’ll ask you for bra advice.”**     His concentration was broken as a parade of Vyperians swished in from the other side of the room. Each had a different creature with him. Standing in front of Admiral Zeezak was Commander Bool, and the first Vyperian squiggled up to the octos with a small cage. He held it up for examination. Inside was a cricket.     
    “What do you think, sir?” 
    The Admiral stroked the ring around his beak with his third tentacle. “It looks awful enough. Is it an aggressive creature?” 
    “No, but it makes a horrendous noise when it rubs its leg on its…” 
    “A horrendous noise that we, no doubt, would hear also,” Commander Bool interjected. “Next.”  
    The next Vyperian approached with a parrot, perched firmly on a stick. “This one has a beak that could do terrible damage, my Lord!” The parrot suddenly squawked and screeched, causing most of the Vyperians in the room to wobble in surprise. Before Commander Bool could utter a response, Admiral Zeezak whipped out his ray gun and vaporized the parrot, exploding it into a puff of burnt feathers which fell slowly to the floor of the command room.  
    “No.”
    The next Vyperian presented yet another creature in a cage. “This, my lord, is what the earthlings call a cobra. A specimen this size has enough venom to kill 200 humans. It is widely feared across the globe, even by races that aren’t likely to see such a creature in their lifetimes.”  
    “Does it make any awful noises?”  
    “No, my Lord, it is silent.”
    The cobra reared up inside the cage and spread its hood while locking gaze with the Admiral. With two tentacles, Admiral Zeezak swooped the plastic cage away from the other Vyperian and brought it up to his eyes. The cobra remained still for just another moment, and then it struck, struck, struck again, leaving smears of venom all across the inside of the cage where its fangs had hit.
    Admiral Zeezak’s beak ring flickered purple.  
    “This,” he said softly. “We shall start with this.”**     Dr. Frank Faraday opened his eyes. Instantly, he knew things were different. He knew where he was, and what was happening, even though he had no memory of anything after the trip down the hallway where he threw up blood on people that cared far less than they should have about a random man puking blood onto everything. 
    Dr. Faraday sat up. There was nothing in his room but the gurney he was on. He looked around. The walls were made of concrete that had been set nine years earlier by a local construction company that had recently been shut down for violating building codes to save money in the recession. He looked at the gurney. It had been manufactured by a medical supply company in Turkey within the past eight months. A sharp tinge of fear rose up in Dr. Faraday’s mind.  
    How do I know these things?  
    A door slid open and Jennifer Hsu walked in with her lab coat ensconced associate.  Dr. Faraday took one look at her and smiled. “Your sister,” he said confidently, “has amazing tits.”  So If You've Read This Far…The book is finished as a rough draft and I'm editing it. The money I collect will be used to:
Put together some nice artwork
Help me market the book online (it's a sci-fi comedy. Pretty much the two hardest genres to sell, and I decided it would be a great idea to do both at the same time)
Potentially pay a professional editor
Buy spinning rims for my car. They are REALLY cheap now, and I just can't pass up a good bargain. I may be lying about this one. I may not.

What You GetFrankly, you can get the book! Yeah, there are other perks (which you can read about in the perks section), but a reasonable contribution gets you a digital copy when it is finished! Everyone Wins!With a reasonable contribution, you can get a copy of the book, and I can get some funding to help get some attention and advertising for it. At the moment, I don't have any plans to actually print hard copies, but that may happen down the line depending on what kind of funding I end up with. Even if you pass on the contribution (and listen, if sci-fi comedies aren't your cup of tea, I get it. Believe me), please pass this along to someone you think might like this kind of book. I'd really appreciate it!Thanks,Tim

story:
Short Summary

Bacterial lenses -Discover the relationship between the bacterial world and every other life form and how this interaction has shaped the way we live in from its very beginning to this very moment, and how it will continue doing so in the near future.

My name is David Medina and I am the author of Bacterial Lenses. I wrote this book because I felt that there was an important lack of perspective available to people who wanted to understand the origin and development of human history from a different point of view than those we are often told in college or regular books. Normally, when someone asks “how did we get here, to this exact moment”, we have access to a vast array of information coming from anthropology, geology, biology, and other sciences. However, I have been missing for quite a long time the involvement of bacteria in all these events, this is the reason why I decided to use their perspective in this book and tell everything from their metaphoric lenses if they had ones. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover a different perspective and vision of how bacteria have helped to shape the true nature of the existence that we all enjoy today, and how they have been key players in our evolution and development throughout history. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for microbiology and the bacterial world in you. And then, ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you understand all that has ever happened and will ever take place on this planet from a completely different perspective, one coming from a world that you cannot see with naked eyes.

In this book, you'll learn about microbiology and anthropology :

How bacteria shaped the behavior of unicellular organisms to start turning into communities that gave rise to multicellular life forms, the earliest ancestors of every other complex life form in the planet

How bacteria have helped the creation of society, moving the first humans from isolated groups to settlements that triggered important cultural exchanges that settled the principles of what we are today

How bacteria have shaped the evolution of humanity, impacted entire civilizations and allowed both extraordinary catastrophes and scientific miracles

You will love this book if you have some degree of curiosity in microbiology or biological sciences, or you are just craving for some general quick and accessible knowledge in scientific topics around bacteria. 

Bacterial lenses is a non-fiction book that speaks to the college student, life science professional or anyone who is looking at the intersection between microbiology and human history for the first time.

The Book - Bacterial lenses

The book is written in 5 parts:

Part 1 contains the introduction + Chapters 1-4. In this section, you will learn the impact that the bacterial world had in the early development of every other life form on the planet and how they were able to colonize and spread all over the surface of the primitive Earth. One of the section’s stories will show you how they sought to populate the Earth; bacteria changed the composition of the atmosphere and triggered the biggest massive extinction that the planet has ever seen. You will also come to understand the importance of the bacterial influence in the switch between unicellular and multicellular life, which ultimately gave rise to all the complex organisms we know today. 

Part 2 contains Chapters 5-9. Here, you will learn the importance of bacteria in the birth and rise of the first human societies and civilizations, from the moment that our hominid-like ancestors left Africa to the end of the biggest bacterial pandemic that the entire world has ever faced, The Black Death. One of this section’s stories will show you how bacteria impacted the development of the first societies and how they were able to use the establishment of humans in bigger groups to unleash some of the earliest forms of human diseases. Additionally, you will learn more about the quasi-apocalyptic impact that bacteria had in the spread of the Black Death, whose consequences are apparent even nowadays in practices such as quarantine and hygiene. 

Part 3 contains Chapters 10-12. In this section, you will learn about how the construction of microscopes and the curiosity of a growing scientific community led to the birth of bacteriology, which changed the way we humans interact with bacteria. In these chapters, you will learn how the obsession of a young Dutch scientist changed the world forever when he was able to observe the unseen microscopic world. You will also learn about the seven cholera pandemics that have been ravaging the world since the early XIX century and their impact in societies who are still suffering. 

Part 4 contains Chapters 13-14. Here, you will learn about the rise and fall of antibiotics through the golden era of antibiotic discovery, and how a miracle drug that saved so many lives became the match that burned our dreams of a better future. In some of the stories of this section, you will learn about the scientific passion of Alexander Fleming and how a lucky mistake turned to become the biggest revolution in medicine that humankind has ever seen. You will also learn about how the world has been turning its’ back on a growing problem whose outcome and consequences our generation has had to carry the burden of. 

Part 5 contains Chapters 15-18. In this section, You will get a deep understanding of antibiotic resistance: how it works, which factors are altering its behavior and how human’s activities are making the problem worse. You will also learn about the alternatives to the use of antibiotics that we are using to face the problem and about what the future might look like whether we win this war or not. Over this section, you will learn about authentic superbugs that are silently spreading all over the world that are resistant to whatever we throw at them, and that fighting bacteria might not be the only way to end a war that we are destined to lose.  

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this December
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish it. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

The author

David Medina is a PhD candidate at the Department of Chemical Engineering at Northeastern University and founder of the Green Chemistry Lab, an independent research division focused on Nanomedicine with the aim to bring nanotechnology-based solutions to market, such as SynCell Biotechnology and Nanolyx, two biomedical startups in which he is co-founder and Director. 

I decided to write this book because I always felt that the development of human history has always missed, not purposely, the involvement of the bacterial world. Therefore, I decided I had to be the one bringing together the intersection between the bacterial world and everything that has ever happened to us as a society, from the beginning of our existence on this planet. 

Honestly, I have spent most of my life isolated from the world of microbiology, and with only a recent exposure, I have come to realize how important it is. I have been working with pathogens, infectious diseases, and microorganisms for almost 4 years now, and I know how important they are not only for my research but also for society. Therefore I decided to write a book in which I could tell how relevant they have been, are, and will be to whatever was and will happen way before and beyond our own existence. 

For more information, you can connect with David Medina at d.medinacruz@northeastern.edu and LinkedIn profile (https://www.linkedin.com/in/davidmedinacruz/). 
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes it. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #BacterialLenses and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
David Medina

story:
Behind My Book

Manipulated Memories is a distorted collection of prose, self-affirmations, and short stories that explore self-love, mental health, and the journey of life when your own mind is against you.

My name is S.E. Anthony, and I am the author of Manipulated Memories. I crafted this book because, amid my daily journaling and my self-discovery, I realized I did not know if my reality was distorted or if my memories were manipulated. In this collection, I peel back the layers of the growth that is possible after destruction. I explore the deranged reality of battling with oneself, I talk myself out of death and heartbreak time and time again, and I question my lineage and my mother's scars.

By reading this collection, you will discover a thin line between dreams and reality. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to explore yourself, your healing, and your memories in a new light. I changed my life trajectory through writing. I hope my poems speak to you and bring you many beautiful experiences.

In this book, you will join me in carefully dissecting self-love, mental health, healing, resilience, vulnerability, and self-worth through poems like:

"Brown Skin Girl" — Brown skin girl opens the door to self-worth and explores the importance of rest

"All too well" — A poem about transparency and battling with oneself

"Owe It" — A morning mantra that emphasizes self-love, self-worth, and setting boundaries

This book is an open love letter to everyone. You will adore this book if you are battling with mental health, are beginning or have already begun your self-love journey, appreciate positive self-affirmations, or simply enjoy poetry.

Manipulated Memories speaks to anyone who knows that healing is not linear and that there is no blueprint to self-discovery. I look forward to exploring mental health and self-love with my readers. I believe it will change us all for the better.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Introduction and content from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

About the Author 

S.E. Anthony is a talented writer with a focus on amplifying the voices of those in need. She is a captivating spoken word poet, devoted activist, published author, and mental health advocate based in Washington, D.C. She focuses her work on themes of mental health, positive self-affirmations, and healing. Her gifts to the world inspire people to elevate themselves and live their truth.


S.E. established her voice and love for poetry while writing daily journal entries. She is also inspired by powerful writers such as Toni Morrison. Her work is transparent, allowing readers to follow her on a fearless journey of questioning her worth, mental state, sanity, healing, and even her identity.

Outside of poetry, S.E. writes blog posts that explore self-discovery and activism. After seeing how one voice can raise up many others while on the front lines during the D.C. protests, she hopes to inspire others to find their will to fight.

For more information, you can connect with S.E. Anthony at manipulatedmemories@outlook.com and on Instagram at @proseandpaper.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, you can still help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #manipulatedmemories and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

S.E. Anthony
story_txt:
Behind My Book
Manipulated Memories is a distorted collection of prose, self-affirmations, and short stories that explore self-love, mental health, and the journey of life when your own mind is against you.My name is S.E. Anthony, and I am the author of Manipulated Memories. I crafted this book because, amid my daily journaling and my self-discovery, I realized I did not know if my reality was distorted or if my memories were manipulated. In this collection, I peel back the layers of the growth that is possible after destruction. I explore the deranged reality of battling with oneself, I talk myself out of death and heartbreak time and time again, and I question my lineage and my mother's scars.By reading this collection, you will discover a thin line between dreams and reality. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to explore yourself, your healing, and your memories in a new light. I changed my life trajectory through writing. I hope my poems speak to you and bring you many beautiful experiences.In this book, you will join me in carefully dissecting self-love, mental health, healing, resilience, vulnerability, and self-worth through poems like:
"Brown Skin Girl" — Brown skin girl opens the door to self-worth and explores the importance of rest
"All too well" — A poem about transparency and battling with oneself
"Owe It" — A morning mantra that emphasizes self-love, self-worth, and setting boundaries
This book is an open love letter to everyone. You will adore this book if you are battling with mental health, are beginning or have already begun your self-love journey, appreciate positive self-affirmations, or simply enjoy poetry.Manipulated Memories speaks to anyone who knows that healing is not linear and that there is no blueprint to self-discovery. I look forward to exploring mental health and self-love with my readers. I believe it will change us all for the better.

What We Need & What You Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this spring.
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish it.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
You will receive early access to the Introduction and content from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
And much more!

About the Author 
S.E. Anthony is a talented writer with a focus on amplifying the voices of those in need. She is a captivating spoken word poet, devoted activist, published author, and mental health advocate based in Washington, D.C. She focuses her work on themes of mental health, positive self-affirmations, and healing. Her gifts to the world inspire people to elevate themselves and live their truth.S.E. established her voice and love for poetry while writing daily journal entries. She is also inspired by powerful writers such as Toni Morrison. Her work is transparent, allowing readers to follow her on a fearless journey of questioning her worth, mental state, sanity, healing, and even her identity.Outside of poetry, S.E. writes blog posts that explore self-discovery and activism. After seeing how one voice can raise up many others while on the front lines during the D.C. protests, she hopes to inspire others to find their will to fight.For more information, you can connect with S.E. Anthony at manipulatedmemories@outlook.com and on Instagram at @proseandpaper.

 
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.
The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute financially, you can still help:
Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #manipulatedmemories and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.
Thank you so much for all of your love and support!
Thanks again,
S.E. Anthony

story:
The Book:

THREE years ago, Benjamin Benoit and myself, set out to discover who the Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence are.

The result: A 200 page book documenting The Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence through personal interviews and stunning photography. (Yes, it is completed and ready to order.)

In bright make-up and Nuns habits, San Francisco’s drag nuns are a well-established cultural fixture. The Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence formed in 1979 as an “order of queer nuns”. Since then, they’ve become a powerful presence for charity and social activism, across the country and the world.

This spectacular journey into the irreverent, compassionate world of these queer activists offers a rare glimpse at the remarkable people behind the habits. Who are these nuns? What is The Sisterhood? How did they find themselves within it?

Sister Stories…in their own words… is a compelling look at a cultural movement, an important piece of queer history, and gorgeous piece of art.

NOW the Coast to Coast Tour BEGINS!

I have taken the next FOUR months off work to take a train across the country, visiting Sister Houses and hosting interactive conversations with Sisters and their communities. 

This is NOT your typical book signing, but an in-depth deep dive into LGBTQ+ history, culture and rights; where they have been and where they go in the future.

I will be visiting so many places, including San Diego, Sacramento, Nashville, Memphis, Alabama, Arkansas, New Orleans and many more.

I have created a fantastic shirt to commemorate the occasion! Here is a little video of the 1st shirt coming off the press!

Additionally, I will be interviewing Sisters across the country for Book #2 in the Series: Sister Stories...from the Road!

The Impact:

Sister Stories is much more than just a book; it is a social movement, an opportunity to build bridges of communication and learn about a culture and history that many may not know exists. To that end:

  • 20% of net proceeds from the sale of Sister Stories and associated art, is donated to the Sisters General Fund. In the interest of transparency, monies will be distributed via an outside source, tax specialist, Joel Levine. 

Challenge--it's always $!

I have spent three years fundraising and making Sister Stories...in their own words,  a reality AND making it accessible and affordable. Now that I have done that, I need to get Sister Stories in the hands of people across the country and the world AND begin creating Book #2!

I hope you will join the journey and adventure! Here we go!​

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, if it's not in your budget to grab a book now, that's O.K., you can still help spread the word. 

  • I would LOVE you to let your friends, family, bloggers, podcasters, anyone and everyone, who might be interested--know about this book and the tour.
  • I would also LOVE you to make some noise about this campaign, by using the social media share tools, provided here.
  • Sign up for my Mailing List!
  • SUBSCRIBE to my YouTube Channel, where I will be documenting the trip, people and places!​ I need to get to 100 subscribers, so I can get my own url--(instead of the hieroglyphic that YT gives me!) Click/Subscribe here: YOUTUBE CHANNEL
