http://igg.me/at/WMN-2015calendar 
 also join us at : www.facebook.com/WhatsMyNameGame to play the game with us.


Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools as well!

story:
I love sea holidays, bathing, the warm sand, the light wind refreshing you before a cruel heat, tanning…On the other hand, I hate the beach crowds, noisy people, the ones playing with the ball and dumping tons of sand on your head while you are trying to catch the best sunrays. The same people wetting you while they get out of the sea. Not to mention those who step on you when you have finally found the chance to sleep…Do you know what I mean?


Sometimes, chaos solves everything...

One day, on a marvellous deserted beach of the French Caribbean, while I was preparing to lie on my towel, I observed, a horde of children arriving to my small paradise, howling, gesticulating, balls, shovels and pots in their hands. In a couple of minutes, I was surrounded from all sides by these adorable kids, who came there, just like me, to enjoy the pleasure offered by the beach.

I also love kids, especially when they are resting…but on the beach, they are a real pain in the ass!

I tried as well as I could to distance myself, to isolate myself from them, but the beach was too small and their energy, too high.

Ten minutes later, I finally surrendered; I picked up my briefcase and went elsewhere to see if there wasn’t any other quiet corner to find.

Along the sea, I walked into a small fishing harbour which housed some of the most Spartan-like boats. It was at that moment when I saw it: alone, moored at the end of the harbour, abandoned from all. It was a raft made from bamboo sticks connected by a rope. It was a really normal boat, which just had to float. It had a wooden crate fixed on the platform, used with no doubt, to store small gear.

I looked all around me and discovered that I was alone; I instantly laid myself on the top. The place was isolated and extremely quiet. The only thing disturbing my silence was the cry of the seagulls in the sky…

Obviously, it wasn’t very comfortable but that peacefulness, that serenity of lying alone over the water, cradled by the gentle waves of the sea…From time to time, a bolder wave was smashing against the bamboo, spraying me with refreshing salt water.

I was quite peaceful, without giving a fuck/without any worries, as we say.

When my skin started to burn, I only had to lay myself down by the water to extinguish the blaze and once the burning feeling was gone, I went back to my frail boat. Only a few inches of water, I couldn’t risk drowning myself! Especially since I can’t swim!...Yeah!
Holding my fingers crossed behind my neck I watched the sky, breathing the air of the sea in my lungs, enjoying the moment.

That was the moment it came like a flash… it crossed my brain in a split of a second and appeared clearly in front of my eyes. The idea…the good idea…building rafts for sunbathing.

This is not such a lazy idea, right? Yes, I admit it; I tend not to use my body more than necessary. But when an idea seems great to me, grinding my gears, I am ready to move mountains.

Then I started to think about what could look like those rafts. The ones on which I was daydreaming, were too uncomfortable.

Obviously, I immediately made the connection with an inflatable mattress. Indeed, we can use it to tan in the sea. Therefore, I thought, this idea is not so new. I remembered an incident that happened to me long ago, while enjoying a holiday in the Mediterranean…

That day, I had my plastic mattress properly inflated and I was lying on top, on a place where I was walking. I don’t know about you, but I fall asleep quickly. Let’s say that as soon as I closed my eyes, I already started travelling. Speaking of trips, I made a beautiful one…When I opened my eyes, awakened by the noise of the patrol boat’s engine; I realized I drifted away several miles from the beach. Without the aid of the guards, I would have probably made a small world tour.

I never repeated the experience…


Another problem with the inflatable mattress is when you want to change the position, in this situation, you can quickly capsize. Hence the idea of rigid, floating platforms, large enough for you to be able to lie on them alone or in pair, firmly anchored in the sand for not waking up on the other side of the ocean. The advantage is tanning safely while being pleasantly cradled and comforted by a soft overlay.

In remembrance of this idyllic time, I gave the name, Raft-Tan to the beach companion: The Raft Tanner.






That was the story. Now, it is necessary to talk about money. Making a scale prototype, test situations, filing patents cost no less than 150.000 $.

Wow, not cheap at all! Tranquillity and comfort have a price, that’s for sure.

But, but…how many Raft-Tan can be issued from factories? Our beautiful planet abounds of beautiful paradise beaches and spacious water places in many countries.

Just as the pedal boats conquered the world, Raft-Tan can encounter a great success as well.

The market is huge and so are my needs…

On our own, we cannot do anything, only arouse our fantasies. This is reason why I created a strong team to develop this project. Nautical experts, confirmed traders, boys and girls with a strong skill to achieve this challenge.

But most of all, I need YOU, the one who is about to read me. Because without you, my Guadeloupe-like raft will forever remain a nice, simple holiday memory…I personally want to be confident, and I want you to be confident enough as well in order for you to offer some money from your pocket or your sock.

If you also want to tan, resting peacefully on the water, without getting sand in your eyes, without handling the promiscuity of a crowded beach, without any person to stumble upon you, if you want to stand out from the crowd, out of the herd, in an original way, then join me, join us. Together we will build a beautiful story, our common story. The story of Raft-Tan!


                          

I could have written this story in France, but here, you see, we are a little bit cold. Our beautiful country doesn’t like entrepreneurs. That’s why I am calling all the world’s citizens. Because I know that you, the ones living in other environments, you have the entrepreneurial spirit, you have the sense; you know how to detect a good business, but most of all, you always want to dream and you know that among us, most people are not dreaming…

Patrice DEUMIE


Why do we need your help ?
In order to explain to you why we need your help, please find below the different steps of the project.
  • Study: stress calculation, stability, volume and materials with the 3D files to create a master model: 4,000 $
  • Creation of the master model by numerical machining PUHD foam from the files provided by the study: 7,000 $
  • Creation of the mold to produce parts by vacuum method: 11,000 $
  • Creation of the prototype in isophthalic polyester resin with flax fiber reinforcements (organic material), PU foam sandwich, gelcoat finishings (choice of RAL color ): 3,000 $
  • The rest of the money will be used to produce Raft-Tans for all the contributors who have purchased one and create samples to advertise Raft-Tan in the world.

More information on the company that will build the raft-Tan

To produce the Raft-tan, we have selected a leading company in composite materials manufacturing. Located in the south of France and founded in 1994, there is a workshop of ​​3200 m² 

Specialized in the design and production of technical parts in glass-reinforced polyester resin, models, molds and prototypes, according to various manufacturing techniques, they have opened their market to several sectors: recreation, boating, ... 

To meet the different markets better, they are able to use all the technical transformation of thermosetting resins armed fiberglass. 

In a process of innovation and consistent quality, it works in collaboration with other stakeholders (producers, companies, engineering ...), to the development of composite materials of tomorrow based on organic materials.


    Watch this short video, with a Raft-Tan, you will be protected against this kind of inconvenience,,,




    (Pour nos amis Francophones)

      Oui la plage peut être dangereuse, mais il y a une solution…

    J’adore les vacances à la mer, les baignades, le sable chaud, le petit alizé qui vient vous rafraichir avant d’avoir trop chaud, me bronzer au soleil…Par contre, je déteste la promiscuité sur la plage, les gens bruyant, ceux qui jouent au ballon et vous déversent des tonnes de sable sur la tête pendant que vous tentez de capter les meilleurs rayons de soleil. Ceux encore qui vous aspergent d’eau en sortant de la mer. Sans oublier ceux qui vous marchent dessus alors que vous aviez, enfin, trouvé le sommeil…Vous voyez ce que je veux dire ?

    Quelque fois le hasard fait bien les choses…

    Un jour, sur une merveilleuse plage désertique des caraïbes française, et alors que je m’apprêtais à m’allonger sur ma serviette, je vis arriver sur mon petit paradis, une horde d’enfants, hurlant, gesticulant, ballons, pelles et pots en main. En quelques minutes, j’étais cerné de toutes parts par ces adorables bambins qui venaient là, pour, comme moi, gouter aux joies de la plage…

    J’adore aussi les enfants, surtout quand ils sont à la sieste…mais sur la plage, c’est un enfer !

    J’ai tenté tant bien que mal de me mettre à l’écart, de m’isoler, mais la plage était petite, et leur énergie était grande.

    Au bout de dix minutes j’ai fini par rendre les armes, j’ai ramassé ma serviette et je suis parti voir ailleurs s’il n’y avait pas un coin plus tranquille.

    En longeant la mer, j’ai pris la direction d’un minuscule port de pèche, qui abritait quelques embarcations des plus spartiates. C’est à ce moment là que je l’ai aperçu, seul, amarré au bout du port, semblant abandonné de tous. C’était un radeau fait de bambous, assemblés par un cordage. Une embarcation très sommaire, qui devait tout juste flotter. Sur la plateforme, il y avait, fixée, une caisse en bois qui devait, sans doute, servir à ranger du petit matériel de pêche.

    J’ai regardé tout autour de moi et constatant qu’il n’y avait personne, je m’y suis allongé dessus. L’endroit était isolé et particulièrement silencieux. Seul le cri des mouettes dans le ciel, venait troubler le merveilleux silence…

    Ce n’était, certes, pas très confortable, mais quelle tranquillité, quelle sérénité, d’être ainsi, allongé, seul, au dessus de l’eau, bercé par le doux roulis de la mer. De temps en temps, une petite vague plus audacieuse que les autres, venait se fracasser sur les bambous et m’aspergeait d’eau salée très rafraichissante.

    J’étais bien, paisible, décontracté du gland, comme on dit chez nous (mais ça, il ne faut pas le dire, c’est un peu vulgaire)

    Quand ma peau commençait à frire, je n’avais qu’à me laisser glisser dans l’eau, pour éteindre le brasier, puis je remontais sur ma fragile embarcation, une fois le feu éteint. Il y avait juste quelques centimètres d’eau, je ne risquais pas de me noyer. Surtout que je ne sais pas nager…Ben oui !

    Les doigts croisés derrière ma nuque, je contemplais le ciel, humant l’air marin à plein poumons, savourant l’instant.

    C’est alors qu’elle est arrivée, tel un éclair, en une fraction de secondes elle a traversé mon cerveau pour m’apparaitre, limpide, devant les yeux. L’idée, la bonne idée…Construire des radeaux pour bronzer.

    C’est pas une idée de fainéant ça ? Oui, j’avoue, j’ai tendance à ne pas user mon organisme, plus qu’il ne faut. Mais quand une idée, qui me semble géniale, me triture les neurones, je suis prêt à soulever des montagnes.

    J’ai commencé alors à réfléchir à quoi pourrait ressembler ces radeaux. Celui sur lequel je rêvassais, étant bien trop inconfortable.

    Bien entendu, j’ai aussitôt fait le parallèle avec un matelas gonflable. On peut, en effet, bronzer en mer avec. Donc, pensais-je, cette fumeuse idée n’est pas si nouvelle que cela. Puis je me suis souvenu d’une mésaventure qu’il m’est arrivé il y a bien longtemps, lors de vacances en méditerranée…

    Ce jour là, j’avais bien gonflé mon matelas plastique et je m’étais allongé dessus, à un endroit où j’avais pied. Je ne sais pas vous, mais moi je m’endors rapidement. Disons que sitôt les yeux fermés, je voyage déjà. En parlant de balade, j’en ai fait une belle… Quand j’ai ouvert les yeux, réveillé par le bruit du moteur de la vedette de la police nationale, j’ai pu constater que j’avais dérivé à plusieurs kilomètres de la plage. Sans le secours des gardes cotes, j’aurais peut être fait mon petit tour du monde.

    Je n’ai jamais renouvelé l’expérience…

    Il y a un autre problème avec le matelas gonflable, en voulant changer de position, on peut très vite chavirer. D’où l’idée de plates formes flottantes, rigides, assez grande pour pouvoir s’allonger seul ou à deux, solidement amarrées au sol, pour ne pas se réveiller de l’autre coté  de l’océan. L’avantage est de pouvoir bronzer en toute sécurité tout en étant agréablement bercé et confortablement installé grâce à un revêtement moelleux.

    En souvenir de ce moment idyllique, j’ai donné le nom de, Raft-Tan à ce compagnon de plage : Le radeau à bronzer.

    Voila pour la petite histoire...

    Maintenant il faut parler argent. Réaliser un prototype grandeur nature, faire des essais en situation, déposer des brevets, coûtent pas moins de 150 000$.

    Hou-là, c'est pas donné ! La tranquillité et le confort ont un prix, c'est certain. Mais... combien de Raft-Tan pourraient sortir des ateliers de fabrication, grâce à votre participation ? Notre belle plane regorge de belles plages paradisiaques, de plans d'eau spacieux, dans de nombreux pays. A l'image des pédalos Français qui ont conquis le monde, les Rafts-Tan, pourraient rencontrer un vrai succès. 

    Le marché est immense, nos besoins aussi !

    Seul on ne fait rien, ou bien alors juste se masturber l’esprit. C'est pourquoi j'ai constitué une équipe solide  pour encadrer ce projet. Des spécialistes nautiques, des commerciaux confirmés, des gars et des filles qui ont une farouche volonté de mener à bien ce défit. Mais j’ai surtout besoin de vous, de TOI qui es en train de me lire. Car sans toi, mon radeau Guadeloupéen, restera à jamais qu’un simple bon souvenir de vacances… Moi j’ai envie d’y croire, et que toi aussi tu y crois assez fort pour sortir un peu d’argent de ta poche ou de ta chaussette. Si toi aussi tu as envie de bronzer, peinard sur l’eau, sans recevoir du sable dans les yeux, sans subir la promiscuité d’une plage bondée, sans que personne ne trébuche sur toi, si toi aussi tu veux te différencier de la masse, faire preuve d’originalité, sortir du troupeau, alors rejoins moi, rejoins nous. Ensemble nous construirons une belle histoire, notre histoire commune. L’histoire de Raft-Tan ! Cette histoire, j’aurais pu l’écrire en France, mais ici, vois tu, nous sommes un peu frileux. Notre beau pays n’aime pas les entrepreneurs. C’est pourquoi je fais appel à tous les citoyens du  monde. Car je sais que vous, qui vivez dans d'autres contrées, vous avez l'esprit entrepreneurial, vous avez le nez, vous savez flairer la bonne affaire, mais surtout vous avez toujours envie de rêver, et ça, vois tu, chez nous, plus personne ne rêve…

    merci de soutenir notre projet !

    Patrice DEUMIE
story_txt:
I love sea holidays, bathing, the warm sand, the light wind refreshing you before a cruel heat, tanning…On the other hand, I hate the beach crowds, noisy people, the ones playing with the ball and dumping tons of sand on your head while you are trying to catch the best sunrays. The same people wetting you while they get out of the sea. Not to mention those who step on you when you have finally found the chance to sleep…Do you know what I mean?Sometimes, chaos solves everything...One day, on a marvellous deserted beach of the French Caribbean, while I was preparing to lie on my towel, I observed, a horde of children arriving to my small paradise, howling, gesticulating, balls, shovels and pots in their hands. In a couple of minutes, I was surrounded from all sides by these adorable kids, who came there, just like me, to enjoy the pleasure offered by the beach. I also love kids, especially when they are resting…but on the beach, they are a real pain in the ass!I tried as well as I could to distance myself, to isolate myself from them, but the beach was too small and their energy, too high.Ten minutes later, I finally surrendered; I picked up my briefcase and went elsewhere to see if there wasn’t any other quiet corner to find. Along the sea, I walked into a small fishing harbour which housed some of the most Spartan-like boats. It was at that moment when I saw it: alone, moored at the end of the harbour, abandoned from all. It was a raft made from bamboo sticks connected by a rope. It was a really normal boat, which just had to float. It had a wooden crate fixed on the platform, used with no doubt, to store small gear. I looked all around me and discovered that I was alone; I instantly laid myself on the top. The place was isolated and extremely quiet. The only thing disturbing my silence was the cry of the seagulls in the sky…Obviously, it wasn’t very comfortable but that peacefulness, that serenity of lying alone over the water, cradled by the gentle waves of the sea…From time to time, a bolder wave was smashing against the bamboo, spraying me with refreshing salt water. I was quite peaceful, without giving a fuck/without any worries, as we say. When my skin started to burn, I only had to lay myself down by the water to extinguish the blaze and once the burning feeling was gone, I went back to my frail boat. Only a few inches of water, I couldn’t risk drowning myself! Especially since I can’t swim!...Yeah!Holding my fingers crossed behind my neck I watched the sky, breathing the air of the sea in my lungs, enjoying the moment. That was the moment it came like a flash… it crossed my brain in a split of a second and appeared clearly in front of my eyes. The idea…the good idea…building rafts for sunbathing. This is not such a lazy idea, right? Yes, I admit it; I tend not to use my body more than necessary. But when an idea seems great to me, grinding my gears, I am ready to move mountains. Then I started to think about what could look like those rafts. The ones on which I was daydreaming, were too uncomfortable. Obviously, I immediately made the connection with an inflatable mattress. Indeed, we can use it to tan in the sea. Therefore, I thought, this idea is not so new. I remembered an incident that happened to me long ago, while enjoying a holiday in the Mediterranean…That day, I had my plastic mattress properly inflated and I was lying on top, on a place where I was walking. I don’t know about you, but I fall asleep quickly. Let’s say that as soon as I closed my eyes, I already started travelling. Speaking of trips, I made a beautiful one…When I opened my eyes, awakened by the noise of the patrol boat’s engine; I realized I drifted away several miles from the beach. Without the aid of the guards, I would have probably made a small world tour.I never repeated the experience…Another problem with the inflatable mattress is when you want to change the position, in this situation, you can quickly capsize. Hence the idea of rigid, floating platforms, large enough for you to be able to lie on them alone or in pair, firmly anchored in the sand for not waking up on the other side of the ocean. The advantage is tanning safely while being pleasantly cradled and comforted by a soft overlay.In remembrance of this idyllic time, I gave the name, Raft-Tan to the beach companion: The Raft Tanner. 
That was the story. Now, it is necessary to talk about money. Making a scale prototype, test situations, filing patents cost no less than 150.000 $.Wow, not cheap at all! Tranquillity and comfort have a price, that’s for sure.But, but…how many Raft-Tan can be issued from factories? Our beautiful planet abounds of beautiful paradise beaches and spacious water places in many countries. Just as the pedal boats conquered the world, Raft-Tan can encounter a great success as well.The market is huge and so are my needs…On our own, we cannot do anything, only arouse our fantasies. This is reason why I created a strong team to develop this project. Nautical experts, confirmed traders, boys and girls with a strong skill to achieve this challenge. But most of all, I need YOU, the one who is about to read me. Because without you, my Guadeloupe-like raft will forever remain a nice, simple holiday memory…I personally want to be confident, and I want you to be confident enough as well in order for you to offer some money from your pocket or your sock. If you also want to tan, resting peacefully on the water, without getting sand in your eyes, without handling the promiscuity of a crowded beach, without any person to stumble upon you, if you want to stand out from the crowd, out of the herd, in an original way, then join me, join us. Together we will build a beautiful story, our common story. The story of Raft-Tan!                           I could have written this story in France, but here, you see, we are a little bit cold. Our beautiful country doesn’t like entrepreneurs. That’s why I am calling all the world’s citizens. Because I know that you, the ones living in other environments, you have the entrepreneurial spirit, you have the sense; you know how to detect a good business, but most of all, you always want to dream and you know that among us, most people are not dreaming…
Patrice DEUMIE

Creation of the master model by numerical machining PUHD foam from the files provided by the study: 7,000 $
Creation of the mold to produce parts by vacuum method: 11,000 $

selected a leading company in composite materials manufacturing. Located

 according to various manufacturing techniques, they have opened their

story:
The Impact

    I am a Writing Instructor that doesn't get much time to write. This is my chance to develop my writing habits and prepare myself for a PhD program in the not-too-distant future.

    What's Needed

    The cost of the flight to Austin, TX from D.C. Unfortunately, the flights are already almost $400. As an adjunct, my finances are already tight. However, this is an important opportunity for growth that is worth the investment in my career and personal/professional development.

    • I only need funding for the airfare--Ire'ne has granted me a scholarship for the cost of the retreat!
    • Even if I can't get the entire $400 for the flight, anything you can contribute will get me there.

    Information about Ire'ne's retreat

    November 11-12, 2017 (12 noon Saturday-3pm Sunday):

    Building a Writing Life: Getting Out of Our Own Way. Are you a writer struggling to create or maintain a writing life while also living life-life (job, family, self-care)? Are you a self-taught writer or a writer years out of an MFA program trying to map a road for yourself through a writing project? This weekend retreat is focused on various issues that I see come up again and again in workshops but that are never the prime focus: How do we handle our time and energy resources to write? How do we take care of ourselves while writing? What is our relation to ‘a writing life’ or to the label of ‘writer’? What are successful strategies that are helping us move forward–and how are we getting in our own way? Along with writing exercise, we will have plenty of time to discuss all these issues and help ourselves as we help each other. Price $225 with overnight accommodations/$175 without. Loma Linda, Maxwell, TX. Email to register: irenelarasilva@yahoo.com

    Just $5 will make a difference!

story:
Short Summary

The Knowing is a book about navigating everyday life while also navigating mental health issues. It follows the protagonist, Harper, and her journey coping with PTSD. 

My name is, Valerie Lane, and I am the author of The Knowing. I wrote this book because mental health issues are affecting all of us in 2020. I want readers to turn the pages of this book and connect with someone who is also struggling to cope with an overwhelming amount of stress.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover it’s okay to not be okay. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn more about dealing with trauma and creating compassion for friends or family members who may be coping with trauma as well. 

From the outside looking in, Harper’s life is perfect. She’s got the stable job, a fiancé, and a beautiful apartment with a French bull dog to post on Instagram. However, when Harper makes the difficult decision to leave her seemingly supportive partner, everything falls apart. She realizes just how toxic her fiancé had been towards her, and how much of a passive decision maker she had been in her own life. Once the reigns are back in her hands, Harper has to answer the most difficult question of all: What do I actually want? Through group therapy sessions, blossoming friendships, and the rock solid support of her best friend Brittany, Harper must come to terms with her mental health and heal from the trauma she endured. Will she succumb to the rough waters of mental illness? Or can Harper rise up and write her own story?  

You will love this book if you love reading stories of resilience, female friendships, or are looking to learn more about healing from trauma.

The Knowing speaks to those struggling with mental health issues and family members of people going through trauma who want to grapple with what they can do to help and understanding mental health in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that The Knowing inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

Am I an active decision maker in my own life?

Who do I know that may be struggling with mental health right now?

Can I do something to change the conversation around mental health, LGBTQ+ issues, or victim’s rights?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing these questions will change us all for the better. 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021. 
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish in Spring of 2021!


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

About the Author

Valerie Lane works at the University of Delaware in the Community Engagement Initiative. She is also a small business owner, doing social media marketing and event planning, and a yoga instructor. Identifying as a ‘Jane of all Trades,’ Valerie is excited to add 'Author' to her list of job titles with the publication of her first book. 

Valerie has wanted to write a book since elementary school, after falling in love with Lemony Snicket’s Series of Unfortunate Events. She wrote this book to fulfill her passion for creative work, and to tell a narrative about mental health during a particularly difficult year. She hopes to impact readers by de-bunking stigmas about mental health, incorporating LGBTQ+ themes, and telling stories of survivorship.

When she’s not writing from her LoveSac couch, Valerie is sure to be catching up on episodes of General Hospital, rewatching The West Wing, and The Office, knitting, and crocheting. She identifies as a health nut and follows a vegan gluten free diet along with a daily dose of exercise on her bike that goes nowhere. 

For more information, you can connect with Valerie at valerienlane@gmail.com and at @valerielane_writer on Instagram.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheKnowingBook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Valerie

story:
Porque creímos… 
Pues bien, de eso se trata este proyecto… de creerle a Dios. Le creímos cuando, hace ya algunos años, nos dijo que nos amaba de tal manera que había dado a su Hijo unigénito para que todo aquel que en él crea, no se pierda, mas tenga vida eterna. (Juan 3:16)… y le creímos cuando nos invitó a confesar que Jesús es el Señor, y que Dios le levantó de los muertos, para que seamos salvos. (Romanos 10:9)… también le creímos cuando nos dijo que todo lo que pidamos en oración, creyendo, lo recibiremos (Mateo 21:22)

Porque entendimos…
Entendimos que la oración es el alimento que nutre nuestra alma, es el contacto íntimo de nuestro espíritu con Dios nuestro Creador, es recordar que no estamos solos y que tenemos un Padre celestial que nos ama y nos acompaña en cada paso de nuestras vidas; que siempre está con nosotros brindándonos amor y esperanza.

Entendimos el poder de la oración. Vimos como en toda la Biblia encontramos relatos de oraciones contestadas: Abraham oró, y mientras él oró, Dios no destruyó la ciudad de Sodoma, Ezequías oró cuando su ciudad era amenazada por el ejército invasor de los asirios comandado por Senaquerib. Todo el ejército de Senaquerib fue destruido y la nación fue librada por una generación más, porque el rey había orado. Elías oró, y Dios envió fuego del cielo para consumir la ofrenda del altar que él había construido. Eliseo oró, y el hijo de la sunamita resucitó de los muertos. Jesús oró junto a la entrada de la tumba de Lázaro, y el que había estado muerto durante cuatro días salió vivo. El ladrón crucificado oró, y Jesús le aseguró que iba a estar con Él en el paraíso. Pablo oró, y nacieron iglesias en Asia Menor y en Europa. Pedro oró y Dorcas resucitó para poder servir a Jesucristo varios años más… La oración es poderosa y activa el poder de Dios en aquello por lo que oramos

Porque actuamos…
Y como le creímos, actuamos, lo pusimos en práctica, y cuando lo pusimos en práctica empezaron a suceder cosas extraordinarias, clamamos y Él respondió, y nos mostró cosas grandes y ocultas que no conocíamos (Jeremías 33:3). Fue así, en oración, como logramos entender los pensamientos que Él tiene acerca de nosotros, pensamientos de bien y no de mal, para darnos el fin que nosotros esperamos (Jeremías 29:11), y entendimos que Él tiene un plan y un propósito para la vida de cada uno, para la mía… para la suya… para las nuestras…

Porque escuchamos…
En cierta oportunidad leía las siguientes palabras del doctor Billy Graham: ¡Qué cosa gloriosa sería si millones de nosotros hiciéramos uso del privilegio de orar!  Aquello calo profundo en mí y se convirtió en una carga, ¿de qué forma podrían convocarse multitudes a orar por las necesidades de otros? Fue cuando el Señor puso en nuestro corazón este proyecto: un website en el que las personas puedan publicar sus peticiones, por un lado y, por el otro, puedan calendarizar tiempos de oración que permita que oren por las peticiones publicadas, las suyas y las de otros.

Pusimos en oración aquella inquietud para que el Señor confirmara que era Él quien había puesto aquello en nuestro corazón y nos dio la siguiente palabra: “Ahora estarán abiertos mis ojos y atentos mis oídos a la oración en este lugar;  porque ahora he elegido y santificado esta casa, para que esté en ella mi nombre para siempre; y mis ojos y mi corazón estarán ahí para siempre.” (2 Crónicas 7:15-16). Es así que decidimos que era tiempo de poner manos a la obra… “porque Dios es el que en vosotros produce así el querer como el hacer, por su buena voluntad” (Filipenses 2:13)

NO ES CASUALIDAD,
DIOS TE TRAJO HASTA AQUÍ POR UNA RAZÓN

Dios provee… 
Y como en todo proyecto, nos dimos a la tarea de conceptualizarlo y dimensionarlo. El costo del desarrollo y publicación se ha estimado en $9.000 y el tiempo en 3 meses, por lo que se necesitan $3.000 mensuales para ponerlo en marcha. Para mantener el mayor orden, se ha decidido realizar 3 campañas, una para cada mes, a las que hemos llamado Campaña de Fase 1,  Campaña de Fase 2 y Campaña de Fase 3

En la Fase 1 se iniciará el desarrollo del prototipo de la aplicación, y se trabajará en el diseño gráfico, priorizando conceptos de sencillez y usabilidad, con el fin de que el sitio sea fácil de utilizar y muestre la información más relevante: las peticiones, la cantidad de personas orando por ellas en tiempo real y testimonios de oraciones contestadas. Asimismo se suscribirá el/los dominios y se contratará el servidor de hosting adonde se publicará. Inicialmente se trabajará para que sea en dos idiomas, español e inglés, y se dejará previsto en el diseño la inclusión de otros idiomas.

En la Fase 2 se publicará el avance y se continúa con el desarrollo de la aplicación.

Las secciones del sitio son:

Peticiones / Intercesores / Reflexiones / Testimonios / Colaboradores / Suscribase

La Fase 3 es de depuración y correcciones de fallos y errores que se detecten durante el uso de los visitantes.

El financiamiento de estas fases es la razón de ser de estas campañas que iniciamos, en la que tienes oportunidad de ser parte de esta visión que Dios ha puesto y que no dudamos será de gran bendición para todos los que le crean, no a nosotros, a Él, que es quien ha puesto este querer, nosotros y usted solo somos el hacer

" Que cada uno dé como propuso en su corazón,
no de mala gana ni por obligación, porque Dios ama al dador alegre" 
                                                                                                        2 Corintios 9:7

story:
In 2015, we rented out our home in Baltimore, Maryland, bought an RV, and set out on an Amazing Marriage Adventure. Our goal was to share married couple’s love stories from across the United States in hopes of inspiring all couples to live a more amazing life together. After over a year on the road and over 40,000 miles driven, we completed the Adventure and have documented at least one married couple’s love story in each state.

Amazing Life Together is a celebration of love and compilation of 75 unforgettable love stories and inspiring quotes about marriage that couples shared with us as we traveled across the country. The book is full of impactful stories of trials and triumphs that will fill your heart with love, joy, hope, and inspiration. From the former drug dealers in inner-city Atlanta, GA, to the young farmer and his wife in Gackle, ND, to the couple battling breast cancer together in Portland, OR, to the NFL player and his wife in Chicago, IL, each couple has a unique story that will touch your heart.

A beautiful full-color, hard-bound book, with over 110 gorgeous color photos, Amazing Life Together will be an inspiring addition to your coffee table and will leave a lasting impact on you and those you share it with. Have we mentioned it would be the perfect wedding gift for those soon-to-be-married couples in your life?

A SNEAK PEAK OF THE INCREDIBLE COUPLES INSIDE AMAZING LIFE TOGETHER 

Jen and Ryan - Brooksville, FL

"Marriage is hard but really good. We have learned that it is important to be creative with how things can look. It is not always black or white. We are really good at seeing other ways to do things that are not expected or normal. It has given us opportunities to grow in different ways. We have fun outside of the norm."

 

Siggi and Martellus - Chicago, IL

"My whole goal is to be the man that I would want my daughter to marry. Whether it’s as a father or the way I treat her mom. I want my daughter to see how much fun you can have in a relationship. I want her to grow up in an environment where we have breakfast for dinner or dessert before dinner."

 

Millie and Richard - Bronxville, NY

"In order to get through the challenges, we have learned that we can’t take marriage lightly. We have to really truly be in love and feel like we can’t even live without that other person by our side. It won’t work unless we truly love each other and are committed to each other."

 

 

WHAT THIS CAMPAIGN WILL FUND

After spending over a year in an RV, and then a year transcribing and compiling the love stories we documented, we are excited to complete the self-publishing process of Amazing Life Together. The book is written. It is in the final stages of editing. The cover is designed, and now we just need your help to print it. Our goal is to raise $10,000 to print the first set of books. 

Through this self-publishing process, we have learned there are quite a few benefits to self-publishing over traditional publishing. However, there are just a few challenges, as well. One of the challenges is the cost of printing. Without having access to the scale of print jobs that traditional publishers have, the cost to print each book is extremely high. We have decided to create this book as a hard-bound, premium full-color book, because we want this to be something you are excited to have on your coffee table, today and everyday! It is meant to be something that can inspire you with love for years to come. By choosing a high quality product, we are forced to price the book at $50, which we understand might be higher than what you would typically spend on a book. However, we hope you see the value, as we do, in the quality product and mission surrounding it.

Purchasing your Amazing Life Together book through this pre-sale is monumental in getting this book into the hands of many. By purchasing our first round of books, we will be able to secure a slight discount on the bulk order. All proceeds from the sales of these books and donations from this campaign, will go directly to Amazing Life Together, funding the completion of this project, and allowing the organization to continue to document and share inspiring love stories in the future.  

THE IMPACT

As wedding photographers, we've seen how much energy and excitement goes into planning a wedding. However, after photographing over 125 weddings, we realized that there is so much hype surrounding a wedding day, but not the marriage afterwards. Our hope is that this book will be a beautiful reminder of the inspiring love that surrounds us and the gift that is marriage.

WHAT COUPLES ARE SAYING

Joni & Tory - Maine - “Just talking about us like that, and really having to dig deep for your answers was so good for us! It was a total refresh having to really think about how our relationship works. We’ve been on cloud nine all weekend and I feel like it’s totally been so affirming for the little team that we’ve become. So thank YOU guys for the reminder of the treasure that we have in one another.”

Amanda & Tyler - New Hampshire - “Thank you! Thank you! Thank you for yesterday! You really made our day, week, year. It was truly refreshing to meet a couple that shares a lot of our views on marriage. Thank you for what you are doing. I believe that the adventure you are taking is going to help a lot of couples. You have already made us fall a little more in love!

Lindsay & Keli'i - Hawaii - “We enjoyed doing the interview with you and had a lot of fun with it! We felt that it was quite beneficial for us just to take the time to reminisce and talk about things that are important to us. Thank you so much for that! I wish you the very best in this project, I think it’s wonderful!”

GET THE BOOK

It's super easy! Just make a donation and select the perk with your choice of book. Once the books are printed, we will ship it directly to you! The Ebooks will be released at the same time as the printed book.
story_txt:
In 2015, we rented out our home in Baltimore, Maryland, bought an RV, and set out on an Amazing Marriage Adventure. Our goal was to share married couple’s love stories from across the United States in hopes of inspiring all couples to live a more amazing life together. After over a year on the road and over 40,000 miles driven, we completed the Adventure and have documented at least one married couple’s love story in each state.
Amazing Life Together is a celebration of love and compilation of 75 unforgettable love stories and inspiring quotes about marriage that couples shared with us as we traveled across the country. The book is full of impactful stories of trials and triumphs that will fill your heart with love, joy, hope, and inspiration. From the former drug dealers in inner-city Atlanta, GA, to the young farmer and his wife in Gackle, ND, to the couple battling breast cancer together in Portland, OR, to the NFL player and his wife in Chicago, IL, each couple has a unique story that will touch your heart.
A beautiful full-color, hard-bound book, with over 110 gorgeous color photos, Amazing Life Together will be an inspiring addition to your coffee table and will leave a lasting impact on you and those you share it with. Have we mentioned it would be the perfect wedding gift for those soon-to-be-married couples in your life?
A SNEAK PEAK OF THE INCREDIBLE COUPLES INSIDE AMAZING LIFE TOGETHER 



Jen and Ryan - Brooksville, FL
"Marriage is hard but really good. We have learned that it is important to be creative with how things can look. It is not always black or white. We are really good at seeing other ways to do things that are not expected or normal. It has given us opportunities to grow in different ways. We have fun outside of the norm."


 



Siggi and Martellus - Chicago, IL
"My whole goal is to be the man that I would want my daughter to marry. Whether it’s as a father or the way I treat her mom. I want my daughter to see how much fun you can have in a relationship. I want her to grow up in an environment where we have breakfast for dinner or dessert before dinner."



 



Millie and Richard - Bronxville, NY
"In order to get through the challenges, we have learned that we can’t take marriage lightly. We have to really truly be in love and feel like we can’t even live without that other person by our side. It won’t work unless we truly love each other and are committed to each other."

story:
Mission

Our mission is to publish a book containing 100 true life stories of mental health recovery. The series is called Mental Illness Recovery Series and the book gives rise to the silenced truth of mental illness and the exhausting, but noble journey of recovery.

Why are we doing it?

Did you know that 4.8 million people in a year experience mental illness in the U.S. alone? That statistic is the dark truth about just one side of the world’s mental health. Imagine considering the whole world. Can you guess that number? Well the World Health Organization stats its approximately 450 million people. That number is way too high, so we have made it into one of our priorities to further understand the true struggles behind mental illnesses.

Haven’t you searched online, in magazines and books looking to better understand your or a loved one’s mental illness and all you get are articles or chapters on what the mental the illness is, the symptoms and treatments? Isn’t it time to take a step further and write about the ugly side of mental disorders without the stigma that accompanies it? We made it our priority to make a difference. To give a voice to those who day to day battle with their disorders.

Who we are?

Psych2go: Psych2go.net is an online platform that shares trending psychology topics. It’s a welcoming tightknit community for aspiring psychology students, and anyone else who would like to learn about many interesting subjects. Psych2go consists of a dedicated team of writers, and unlike other websites whose writers have PhDs. This webpage gives students the opportunity to work and polish their writing skills. By doing so students can further develop their critical thinking. Not only that, but the more experienced students use this platform to share their knowledge with the public. Psych2go also has a YouTube channel where various psychology subjects from different fields are discussed. If you have not check us out, feel free to. Everyone is welcome.

Michelle Gaston: Mental illness and writing is Michelle’s passion; she has suffered and still struggles with anxiety and dysthemia also known as persistent depressive disorder, with brief episodes of derealization (DR). Michelle is part of the psych2go administration and writing team. She is the author of the Mental Illness Recovery Series. She started this project because there are loads of articles and books on how to overcome mental illness, but these ignore the true struggles behind recovery. As Michelle was going through her journey to overcome her disorders, she had a hard time finding stories she can relate to. Not only that, but she encountered much stigma through her mental illnesses. This is why she started this series, to show the truth about recovery, to give others a voice as well, and to help break the stigma.

Mental Illness Recovery Series

This series covers stories from people all over the world. There are stories from the U.S., South America, Europe, Germany, U.K and much more. Not only that, but each story portrays different cultural backgrounds and how they perceive mental illnesses. Each story covers the person’s background information, their mental disorders, diagnosis, the causes for their disorders, symptoms, how it affected their life, negative behaviors, the type of therapy received, coping techniques, changes within them, what they learned from their illnesses and advice. Some of the stories have names and pictures for you to see the true face behind the struggles and other stories are anonymous.

The following is a list of all the disorders this series covers. The list portrays a wide variety of mental illnesses. Unfortunately, the media only talks about depressive and anxiety disorders, and even though both of these illnesses are the most common we cannot ignore the rest of them.

  1. Depression Disorders: Major Depression Disorder (MDD) / Recurrent Depressive Disorder / Bipolar Disorder / Seasonal Affective Disorder (SAD) / Mild, Moderate & Severe Depression.
  2. Anxiety Disorders: Generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) / Social Phobias / Obsessive compulsive disorder (OCD) / Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) / Panic Disorder / Agoraphobia / Specific Phobias / Social Anxiety Disorder / Emetophobia (fear of vomiting)
  3. Neurological Disorders: Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) / Attention Deficit Disorder (ADD) / Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)
  4. Cognitive Disorders: Dyslexia / Learning Disabilities
  5. Addiction: Polysubstance Abuse Disorder / Alcohol Addiction / Self-harming Addiction
  6. Sleeping Disorders: Insomnia
  7. Impulse Control Disorders: Trichotillomania (hair pulling)
  8. Personality Disorders: Borderline Personality Disorder (BPD) / Antisocial Personality Disorder (ASPD) / Schizotypal Disorder (STPD) / Narcissistic Personality Disorder
  9. Psychiatric Disorders: Dissociative Identity Disorder (DID) / Schizophrenia / Schizoaffective Disorder / Body Dysmorphia Disorder (BDD) / Gender Identity Disorder (GID) / Dissociative disorders (DD) / Delusional Disorder
  10. Eating Disorders: Anorexia Nervosa / Bulimia Nervosa / Eating Disorder Not Otherwise Specified (EDNOS)

Where would the funds go?

The funds would go into covering the expenses of publishing a book, such as the material, editing, and marketing. 

Follow us in our other social media accounts:

Facebook

Website 

Mental Illness Recovery Series Stories

story:
The Living Writers Series is a program created for the enrichment and enjoyment of the high school literary experience. Professor Hiram Sims had a profound epiphany in his fiction writing class at Compton College. He assigned a novel called Butterfly Jar, written by Jalondra Davis. It's a coming-of-age story where the main character, Stacey, struggles to rationalize the realities of her South Central home while living through the LA Riots. These students had never studied a novel that took place in their own city that reflected the relevancy of their own culture and location. On the day that they turned in their final essay, Jalondra Davis walked through the door. They could not believe it! Not one of the students, who ranged from ages 18 to 65, had ever met an author. Nor could they believe that someone from their own neighborhood could write a book worthy of being studied in a classroom. In awe and disbelief, they asked her questions, read excerpts from their essays, took pictures with her, and had her sign their books. Professor Sims knew that this was an experience that every writing student deserved.​

As Professor Sims began to examine the curriculum taught at local high schools, he recognized the same disturbing pattern in countless American English classrooms - all of the writers were dead! The absence of the living writer in the classroom often made the reading of poetry and fiction in the public school system in some ways lifeless. In addition, several Los Angeles schools were void of literature that reflected their culture and community. So, the Living Writers Series (LWS) was created to fill this void and bring living Los Angeles poets and storytellers into the classroom. Once a month, Los Angeles writers who have published books visit LAUSD classrooms, and perform their works for students. The readings are traditionally followed by book signings where interested students are given a free copy of the author’s work.

The opportunity to meet the same person that stirred your soul through print is so rare and has created such a palpable sense of excitement that the Living Writers Series expanded from one classroom to four high schools in just a few years. Stakeholders at all levels have been reaching out requesting programming to be available at their home site. However, it takes quite a bit of passion, effort and hours to adequately do the program justice and that's where we would love your support.​

By donating, you can increase the presence of the Living Writers Series. Proceeds, in part, will be used to acquire books that will be available to a local high school student forever! Every year, your donation will go to a new student at Foshay Learning Center, View Park High School, King Drew High School, Fairfax High School, and many others.​

In recognition of your support, you will receive a monthly newsletter detailing the amazing work going on in countless Los Angeles classrooms because of your donation. You will also receive exclusive footage of our monthly performances in the classroom.  Please support either through donation, volunteering or spreading the word to prevent dreams from going deferred.

story:
OUR STORY

Over the last several months, the UCLA Art | Sci Center has partnered with Building Bridges Art Exchange and the International Association of Synesthetes, Artists, and Scientists (IASAS) to produce several groundbreaking events. There has been an art exhibition full of the work of synesthetic artists, an author’s reading with synesthetic physician Dr. Joel Salinas, a wine tasting with synesthetic sommelier Jaime Smith, and a performance by synesthetic musician Kaitlyn Hova. The IASAS also organized a symposium at the UCLA Art | Sci Center which explored cutting edge research into synesthesia, with keynote speakers including Dr. Salinas, Dr. Michael Banissy, and Dr. Richard Cytowic

OUR MISSION

These events are a singular achievement, and we want to document, preserve, and share the rare knowledge and artistic production that have been created. By contributing to the production of this book, you will be part of a historical undertaking to bridge the gap between the arts and sciences through exploration of a unique condition of the brain. 

THE GOAL

We are trying to raise $15,000 for the design and production of this gorgeous book. It will not only be filled with documentation of the artwork and essays by contributing scientists, but will also feature a tactile design and an online component. We are offering a number of fantastic perks along the way to our goal, including t-shirts, calendars, signed books and more! 

THE CAMPAIGN

Our three institutions have worked closely with dozens of artists and scientists over the last few months, and we would love to bring this book to life in order to document, preserve, and share our findings with the world.

Please join us, contribute if you can, and share!

story:
What is Mynah?

Mynah is an annual print magazine about Singapore, Singaporeans and Singaporeanness. We aim to critically and creatively examine the facets of this country that either don’t get enough time in mainstream media, or haven't been discussed in broad ways. We do this with word counts that run into the thousands, allowing our stories depth and context.

"Opinionated and interesting, [Mynah] presents an affectionate and fascinating picture of everyday life in Singapore," — Stack Magazines

"Instead of seeking to mimic the West's editorial rules, Mynah feels like it wants to look like a part of the local fabric," — MagCulture

Art: Lee Chang Ming

What's in Mynah #2?

  • An essay on Singapore's leftist movements and historical amnesia
  • A profile of a practising bomoh
  • An analysis of how National Day Parades do a disservice to Malay mythistory
  • An investigation of Singapore Noodles
  • Three atypical National Service narratives that explore gender, mental health, and citizenship
  • A chronicle of online public shaming in Singapore
  • And more!

We pride ourselves on being a magazine where both emerging and established voices have a space, and in Mynah #2 we're proud to feature the work of young writers like Faris Joraimi, Saza Faradilla, and Lim Min, and seasoned contributors like Kirsten Han and Crystal Abidin, just to name a few.

Art: Godwin Koay

Why Mynah?

Mynah began because we saw a gap in Singapore’s publishing landscape where in-depth Singapore stories should’ve been—the kind that look into aspects of the country that fall by the wayside or recede into the background. We wanted to carve out a space where stories could plumb Singapore’s depths and explore the timbres and textures of our country the mainstream media does not cover. We also wanted Mynah to be a space for the architects of these stories—writers, illustrators, photographers and more—to be in conversation with each other.

We launched last year to great reception that confirmed our belief that there is a demand for intelligent writing about Singapore—even in print, believe it or not! We’re big believers in the print medium and with the 24/7 news cycle, we wanted to create a slow reading experience, a magazine you can sit with and keep coming back to again and again. This issue contains 17 stories in a ~160-page magazine: the result of a year’s worth of research and writing.

Where does the money go?

Mynah is committed to being a non-profit magazine. Our editors and creative team have donated their time to the publication and no one in the team makes any money from this.

Your money goes firstly toward paying our contributors for their time and labour. We value original, creative work and firmly believe that paying creators is the first step to ensuring that their work continues to exist. We’re still a new magazine and have only been able to offer honorariums to our contributors thus far. That said, we’re happy to say that contributor fees have increased by 50% since Mynah #1! We’re hoping to steadily increase our fees over the years and any additional funds from the crowdfunding campaign will go towards work for Mynah #3.  

The bulk of the money goes towards printing the magazine itself. As print lovers, we’re excited to bring a high quality magazine to our readers. This issue, we’re working with Allegro Print – a Singaporean company with 20 years of industry experience. All magazines ordered through Indiegogo are significantly discounted from their usual retail price, so we encourage you to get a copy sooner rather than later! We're committed to getting all pre-ordered copies printed and delivered to you, regardless of whether we meet our funding goal.

Lastly, the money raised will go towards shipping and handling (scroll down to the section Shipping Information for more on our shipping methods and estimated delivery times), producing and purchasing perks, and Indiegogo platform fees (5% of all fees raised).

Here is a breakdown of estimated costs for Mynah #2:   

SGD $2000 – contributors’ fees (writers, artists, illustrators, photographers)

SGD $8000 – printing costs (1,000-copy print run)

SGD $5000  – shipping and handling, perks, Indiegogo platform fees (5% of all fees raised)

Art: Fyerool Darma

What perks do you offer?

Besides copies of the magazine at a discounted pre-order price, we've got some exciting stuff available that we can't wait to share with you. For one, we've got postcard-sized prints of our very own Mynah Visual Mixtapes series. We asked four local artists we admire—Tiffany Lovage, Marc Gabriel Loh and Carmen Chen & Chongwah—to curate five-song playlists to the theme of “Split” and illustrate them, with incredible outcomes. If you choose this perk, you’ll receive prints of all three mixtapes.

We’re also honoured to offer a limited number of the graphic novel Guidebook to Nanyang Diplomacy by Benjamin Chee and Lim Cheng Tju, who contributed to Mynah #2 a scintillating profile of the one and only X’Ho. Released this November at Singapore Writer’s Festival and published by COSH Studios, Guidebook to Nanyang Diplomacy tells the story of the 1915 Sepoy Mutiny in WWI-era Singapore.

In the pages of Mynah #2 you’ll find “Happy Meals,” a delightful and uniquely Singaporean comic tribute to McDonalds by illustrator and cartoonist Joy Ho. A limited number of A3 colour prints of the comic are available as perks.

And last but not least, we have a special bundle of both Mynah #1 and #2, perfect for the latecomers who’d like to get up to speed with our brand of longform storytelling. We’re proud to say that we’re actually nearing the end of Mynah #1’s 1,000-copy print run, so while copies are still available in stores, our first issue will slowly but surely disappear from retail shelves. Get your copy of our debut issue now!

How else can I help?

If what we've said strikes a chord with you and you'd like to help out beyond just purchasing copies of the magazine, here are some ways you can do so:

  • If you're a stockist, distributor or bookstore owner who's interested in stocking Mynah, reach out to us at info@mynahmag.com
  • If you're an educator, programme director or would like to make mass purchases for your school, company or organisation, let us know at info@mynahmag.com
  • If you like what you see and would like to talk about potentially sponsoring future issues of Mynah, again, info@mynahmag.com is the place to go!
  • Know someone who'd love our magazine? Spread the word by sharing our crowdfunding campaign on social media and telling all your friends!

Shipping Information

Mynah uses the following shipping methods for the following countries:

  • United States: USPS media mail
  • Malaysia and Brunei: SingPost airmail
  • Singapore and the rest of the world: SingPost surface mail

All our shipping prices are calculated according to these rates, which were selected so shipping is as inexpensive as possible.

Mynah #2 and perks will be packed and shipped in January 2018. For delivery estimates, please refer to the SingPost website. Funders in the United States will receive their pre-orders between February and March 2018.
story_txt:
What is Mynah?Mynah is an annual print magazine about Singapore, Singaporeans and Singaporeanness. We aim to critically and creatively examine the facets of this country that either don’t get enough time in mainstream media, or haven't been discussed in broad ways. We do this with word counts that run into the thousands, allowing our stories depth and context."Opinionated and interesting, [Mynah] presents an affectionate and fascinating picture of everyday life in Singapore," — Stack Magazines"Instead of seeking to mimic the West's editorial rules, Mynah feels like it wants to look like a part of the local fabric," — MagCultureArt: Lee Chang MingWhat's in Mynah #2?
An essay on Singapore's leftist movements and historical amnesia
A profile of a practising bomoh
An analysis of how National Day Parades do a disservice to Malay mythistory
An investigation of Singapore Noodles
Three atypical National Service narratives that explore gender, mental health, and citizenship
A chronicle of online public shaming in Singapore
And more!
We pride ourselves on being a magazine where both emerging and established voices have a space, and in Mynah #2 we're proud to feature the work of young writers like Faris Joraimi, Saza Faradilla, and Lim Min, and seasoned contributors like Kirsten Han and Crystal Abidin, just to name a few.Art: Godwin KoayWhy Mynah?Mynah began because we saw a gap in Singapore’s publishing landscape where in-depth Singapore stories should’ve been—the kind that look into aspects of the country that fall by the wayside or recede into the background. We wanted to carve out a space where stories could plumb Singapore’s depths and explore the timbres and textures of our country the mainstream media does not cover. We also wanted Mynah to be a space for the architects of these stories—writers, illustrators, photographers and more—to be in conversation with each other.We launched last year to great reception that confirmed our belief that there is a demand for intelligent writing about Singapore—even in print, believe it or not! We’re big believers in the print medium and with the 24/7 news cycle, we wanted to create a slow reading experience, a magazine you can sit with and keep coming back to again and again. This issue contains 17 stories in a ~160-page magazine: the result of a year’s worth of research and writing.Where does the money go?Mynah is committed to being a non-profit magazine. Our editors and creative team have donated their time to the publication and no one in the team makes any money from this.Your money goes firstly toward paying our contributors for their time and labour. We value original, creative work and firmly believe that paying creators is the first step to ensuring that their work continues to exist. We’re still a new magazine and have only been able to offer honorariums to our contributors thus far. That said, we’re happy to say that contributor fees have increased by 50% since Mynah #1! We’re hoping to steadily increase our fees over the years and any additional funds from the crowdfunding campaign will go towards work for Mynah #3.  The bulk of the money goes towards printing the magazine itself. As print lovers, we’re excited to bring a high quality magazine to our readers. This issue, we’re working with Allegro Print – a Singaporean company with 20 years of industry experience. All magazines ordered through Indiegogo are significantly discounted from their usual retail price, so we encourage you to get a copy sooner rather than later! We're committed to getting all pre-ordered copies printed and delivered to you, regardless of whether we meet our funding goal.Lastly, the money raised will go towards shipping and handling (scroll down to the section Shipping Information for more on our shipping methods and estimated delivery times), producing and purchasing perks, and Indiegogo platform fees (5% of all fees raised).Here is a breakdown of estimated costs for Mynah #2:   SGD $2000 – contributors’ fees (writers, artists, illustrators, photographers)SGD $8000 – printing costs (1,000-copy print run)SGD $5000  – shipping and handling, perks, Indiegogo platform fees (5% of all fees raised)Art: Fyerool DarmaWhat perks do you offer?Besides copies of the magazine at a discounted pre-order price, we've got some exciting stuff available that we can't wait to share with you. For one, we've got postcard-sized prints of our very own Mynah Visual Mixtapes series. We asked four local artists we admire—Tiffany Lovage, Marc Gabriel Loh and Carmen Chen & Chongwah—to curate five-song playlists to the theme of “Split” and illustrate them, with incredible outcomes. If you choose this perk, you’ll receive prints of all three mixtapes.We’re also honoured to offer a limited number of the graphic novel Guidebook to Nanyang Diplomacy by Benjamin Chee and Lim Cheng Tju, who contributed to Mynah #2 a scintillating profile of the one and only X’Ho. Released this November at Singapore Writer’s Festival and published by COSH Studios, Guidebook to Nanyang Diplomacy tells the story of the 1915 Sepoy Mutiny in WWI-era Singapore.In the pages of Mynah #2 you’ll find “Happy Meals,” a delightful and uniquely Singaporean comic tribute to McDonalds by illustrator and cartoonist Joy Ho. A limited number of A3 colour prints of the comic are available as perks.And last but not least, we have a special bundle of both Mynah #1 and #2, perfect for the latecomers who’d like to get up to speed with our brand of longform storytelling. We’re proud to say that we’re actually nearing the end of Mynah #1’s 1,000-copy print run, so while copies are still available in stores, our first issue will slowly but surely disappear from retail shelves. Get your copy of our debut issue now!How else can I help?If what we've said strikes a chord with you and you'd like to help out beyond just purchasing copies of the magazine, here are some ways you can do so:
If you're a stockist, distributor or bookstore owner who's interested in stocking Mynah, reach out to us at info@mynahmag.com

If you're an educator, programme director or would like to make mass purchases for your school, company or organisation, let us know at info@mynahmag.com

If you like what you see and would like to talk about potentially sponsoring future issues of Mynah, again, info@mynahmag.com is the place to go!
Know someone who'd love our magazine? Spread the word by sharing our crowdfunding campaign on social media and telling all your friends!

For delivery estimates, please refer to the SingPost website. Funders in the United States will receive their pre-orders between February and March 2018.

story:
This July, the International AIDS Conference will convene in Washington D.C. We intend to use your donations to report on it for our Gay and Lesbian (LGBT) and Black/African-American/Urban publications. As is usual, to help insure publication of community-focused health news, Healthy Living News will not charge our papers for using it.

Messages of Hope: Our Project Deliverables

From the conference halls

Two conference overview news stories (example) that include:

1) a LGBT health-focused news story from AIDS 2012

2) a Black/African-American/Latino health-focused story from AIDS 2012 for their publications.

Two Healthy living news-briefs conference column that includes:

1) a GLBT focused column (example).

2) a Black/African-American/Latino column (example) by our news writer J. Carlton Zeigler.

From the streets of Washington D.C.

A from the streets report by our writer, Gerry Scoppettuolo on actions and demonstrations occurring during the International AIDS Conference.

As a bonus, your contribution will help us on related news articles including a post-conference update on HIV cure research by Kate Krauss. Also, news on the soon to be available HIV in-home test and of PREP Truvada, the new HIV pre-exposure prevention pill (additional contributions to assist in producing these stories would be nice also).

AIDS 2012 is a big conference and Because it will take time to analyse the thousands of conference posters and abstracts being shown at AIDS 2012, all our news stories should be distributed to community papers for publication by the end of August 2012.

It is a time of hope and promise. As our recent Healthy Living News reports revealed, HIV infection can be cured and end to the pandemic may be in sight. So this may be the most important International AIDS Conference ever. Your support will help spread hope to deeply impacted communities. Stories that are published online will be linked to our Facebook "Wall of Gratitude“ so you may see some of the final fruits of your generosity.

Please give generously. HIV impacted communities await a message of hope.

About the Healthy Living News Project

Using email newsletters, Healthy Living News distributes community-specific health news content to about 200 urban, Black/African-American, LGBT, Hispanic and homeless community news publications throughout the U.S., Canada, and overseas. We provide health news content for free! Community publications do not pay for it. This encourages papers to publish health news content.

So far our content has been published in about 80 community news publications (listing below). Although not all the papers we serve publish our news content online, many do.

Healthy Living News is still entirely staffed by volunteers. This includes two new interns who will be compensated for writing about AIDS 2012.

Healthy Livings News' mission is to "help reduce health disparities by educating under-served communities on health and wellness by providing community focused health, fitness and nutrition news to community publications."

to provide community media with community focused health, fitness and nutrition news content that will educate under-served, health disparaged communities on the importance of health and wellness.”

Community press has always played an important and trusted role for the communities they serve. Your support will help these publications provide pertinent, community-focused, health news for those directly in need of it.

story:
Help underwrite the first 'A Quiet Mind' book of quotes

Our Story

We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think. When the mind is quiet, we experience our natural state of being, which is joy.

What if for a moment, every thought in your mind, every worry, every fear become completely, utterly still and there was nothing but silence? We believe that quieting the constant whirring of the mind is a path toward much more joy in our lives. Through stillness, we can relieve suffering.

Welcome to this project -- congratulate yourself for being here! This campaign is the first step in A Quiet Mind’s larger mission to help us all awaken from the needless suffering that fills our lives.

Robert never thought he would hit the top of the charts on iTunes, actually he had no idea what iTunes was until a friend suggested that he start podcasting and teaching people how to meditate. This friend created the first blog and started Robert on his way, pointing people to their own inner truth.  Soon, thousands of people started tuning in to what he had to say. The podcasts, which were completely spontaneous, now began to serve as powerful counsel and spiritual guidance for people all over the country and the world.

The result is just the beginning -- as we can see, an Eastern perspective on life and fulfillment has started to seep into the cracks of Western culture. Where material things have often been equated with happiness, people everywhere are now starting to wake up and do yoga, practice quietude, act more compassionately toward others -- all part of a practice that is a viable way out of depression, anxiety, and anger. Current scientific research on meditation coming from places like Stanford has yielded incredible results on the health benefits of meditation. Yet we have such a long way to go.

That’s where we fit in. We have assembled a team that wants to be a part of this wave of change, by reaching larger numbers of people, and touching as many lives as possible. To do that, we want to start offering other services and help others see the truth about who they are -- wonderful human beings with enormous potential for emotional  healing and compassion.


The Impact

Robert’s simple teachings are helping thousands of people right now to reach stillness and happiness in their daily lives. We want to expand our reach and make that millions of people. Robert believes that everyone is already awake and they have the potential to see this truth,  all they need is a gentle reminder, or the voice of a friend to make that a reality.  Robert’s message and voice is that reminder.

The numbers speak for themselves. A Quiet Mind’s podcasts rank consistently in the top 10 in iTunes Spirituality with up to 70,000 downloads a month, and over 2.6 million downloads to date.  What if those 70,000 turned into 140,000? What if that 140,000 told their friends? There is a movement afoot, and by expanding our services and our reach, this movement will spread.

What We Need & What You Get

We need some very basic help to get things started. The first step is to start transcribing and editing the podcasts with an eye toward pulling out the best quotations, inspirational lines and tools for transformation. These quotations, coupled with some beautiful photos, will go into our first book.  This seed money would go directly to pay for the cost of these transcriptions, as well as server costs for the website for the first few months while we seek out additional sources of funding.

Please check out our “Perks” sections for all of the cool rewards you’ll get for helping us!


Other ways you can help
Please direct your friends to our website: http://www.aquietmind.com
All the podcasts found there are free of charge.
Tell your friends! Word of mouth is such a powerful tool.
