story:
Short Summary

In February of 2013, my dad, Sam Gladstein, was diagnosed with stage 4 lung cancer.  He was given a prognosis which included a 25% chance of living for a year.  This news came a few weeks after his engagement at age 59.  One year later he has married the woman of his dreams, lived to see one son graduate college and  is still battling his disease. The weight of this news and the proceeding struggle has left my family searching for some way to help my dad tell his amazing story.  We wanted the world to know the type of man that we saw, a man who has always defied the odds.  From his days starting a youth shelter in Seattle to his two semi-vagabond hitch hiking trips across the US, he has always gone against the grain.  That is when we decided to commission a biography of his life.

This book is a chance to give a man who has devoted his life to helping others as a teacher and volunteer a chance to tell his story to the world.  I believe that even ordinary people have amazing stories to tell and that is what we want to bring to light.  For myself and my brothers this is also a chance for us to create a record of our Father to some day pass along to our children.

We have an outstanding author, Megan Kruse, set to author our book.  All we need now is the funding to make this all possible.  You can check out Megan's upcoming book "Call Me Home"  published by Hawthorne books at http://hawthornebooks.com/catalogue/call-me-home .

If we exceed our funding goal, we will donate all of the excess funds to cancer patients and caregivers in an attempt to give back to the communities that have helped myself and my family so many times during the past year and a half.

All royalties from the sale of this book will also be going to cancer support groups and research.


What We Need & What You Get

We have a basic goal of $6,000 dollars and a stretch goal of $11,000

  • $6,000 would give us enough for publishing costs, fees for the author and editor, as well as perks to all of our contributors. 
  • $11,000 would give us enough to fly our author around the country to conduct in-person interviews with my Father's family and friends.  Simply put, this would give our author a chance to tell a better story.
  • Every dollar we raise above our stretch goal of $11,000 will be donated to cancer research and support groups.  Please reach out to us if you know of a group in need of help or are interested in our current list of beneficiaries.
  • In exchange for your support we are offering: Personalized thank you cards, acknowledgements in our book, copies of the book as well as "F#ck Cancer" wristbands and tee-shirts.


    Risks & Challenges

    Our main challenge is acquiring the necessary funding to make this book possible.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you know someone whose life has been touched by cancer, please help us reach our fundraising goal by promoting our cause; share our story on Facebook or reach out to your friends and family by using this link:

      https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/f-ck-cancer-the-biography-of-an-ordinary-man/x/8224646 

      Additional inquiries can be directed to newtonj9@gmail.com
story_txt:
Short Summary
In February of 2013, my dad, Sam Gladstein, was diagnosed with stage 4 lung cancer.  He was given a prognosis which included a 25% chance of living for a year.  This news came a few weeks after his engagement at age 59.  One year later he has married the woman of his dreams, lived to see one son graduate college and  is still battling his disease. The weight of this news and the proceeding struggle has left my family searching for some way to help my dad tell his amazing story.  We wanted the world to know the type of man that we saw, a man who has always defied the odds.  From his days starting a youth shelter in Seattle to his two semi-vagabond hitch hiking trips across the US, he has always gone against the grain.  That is when we decided to commission a biography of his life. This book is a chance to give a man who has devoted his life to helping others as a teacher and volunteer a chance to tell his story to the world.  I believe that even ordinary people have amazing stories to tell and that is what we want to bring to light.  For myself and my brothers this is also a chance for us to create a record of our Father to some day pass along to our children.
We have an outstanding author, Megan Kruse, set to author our book.  All we need now is the funding to make this all possible.  You can check out Megan's upcoming book "Call Me Home"  published by Hawthorne books at http://hawthornebooks.com/catalogue/call-me-home .
If we exceed our funding goal, we will donate all of the excess funds to cancer patients and caregivers in an attempt to give back to the communities that have helped myself and my family so many times during the past year and a half.All royalties from the sale of this book will also be going to cancer support groups and research.   What We Need & What You Get We have a basic goal of $6,000 dollars and a stretch goal of $11,000 
$6,000 would give us enough for publishing costs, fees for the author and editor, as well as perks to all of our contributors.  
 $11,000 would give us enough to fly our author around the country to conduct in-person interviews with my Father's family and friends.  Simply put, this would give our author a chance to tell a better story.
Every dollar we raise above our stretch goal of $11,000 will be donated to cancer research and support groups.  Please reach out to us if you know of a group in need of help or are interested in our current list of beneficiaries.

In exchange for your support we are offering: Personalized thank you cards, acknowledgements in our book, copies of the book as well as "F#ck Cancer" wristbands and tee-shirts. 
  

  Risks & Challenges Our main challenge is acquiring the necessary funding to make this book possible.

  Other Ways You Can Help If you know someone whose life has been touched by cancer, please help us reach our fundraising goal by promoting our cause; share our story on Facebook or reach out to your friends and family by using this link:
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/f-ck-cancer-the-biography-of-an-ordinary-man/x/8224646 
Additional inquiries can be directed to newtonj9@gmail.com

story:
¿En qué consiste el proyecto?

Creemos que a todo el mundo le gusta poder ayudar a los demás. Sin embargo, no siempre es posible hacerlo debido a razones económicas o físicas. Nuestro proyecto persigue superar estas barreras y permitir a quien quiera ayudar, hacerlo a través de la transmisión de su propia experiencia y conocimientos de una manera creativa: Tejiendo. 

Visitamos centros de mayores, buscamos quien quiera tejer para proyectos sociales, les facilitamos todo el material y, si no saben, enseñamos cómo hacerlo. 

Nuestros objetivos:

1. Ocupar el tiempo libre de una manera reconfortante: ayudando a otras personas. ¡Por qué creemos en el poder del amor!

2. Hacer que las personas se sientan útiles. ¡Queremos crear una red de solidaridad!

3. Incentivando un consumo textil responsable. ¡Por qué tenemos una tradición de labores que no podemos olvidar!

4. Implementar proyectos sociales. ¡Por qué juntos podemos hacer algo positivo! 

¿Quiénes somos?

Somos unas cuantas personas que organizamos y coordinamos actividades relacionadas con la Terapia de labores, dirigidas principalmente a personas mayores (tanto con experiencia como con ganas de aprender), quienes nos dan su cariño y dedicación, al tiempo que damos visibilidad a sus trabajos y habilidades, motivándoles y mejorando su autoestima. Gracias a ellos desarrollamos proyectos sociales. 

¿Por qué creemos en este proyecto?

Trabajamos para ejecutar proyectos sociales y creemos que podemos hacerlo añadiendo valor de una manera creativa mediante la Terapia de labores. Nuestro objetivo es crear una red de solidaridad. 

¿Qué significa este proyecto para nosotros?

Se trata de un reto personal, rechazando las actitudes egoístas y tomando conciencia de los problemas que hay a nuestro alrededor. 

Se trata de aprender de las cosas importantes que nos ofrece la vida. 

Se trata de hacer ver a los demás que todos podemos aportar nuestro granito de arena (o nuestro "grannie" de lana).

Se trata de apoyar los valores del mundo rural y acercarlos a la ciudad.

Se trata de ser creativo e intentar hacer cosas positivas. 

¿Qué hacemos?

Visitamos residencias, centros de día, hogares… y promocionamos actividades enfocadas a la realización de Terapia de labores, dirigidas principalmente a la gente mayor, de una manera respetuosa con el medio ambiente, permitiendo asimismo la transmisión de una cultura de comercio ético; dirigiendo las actividades hacia un consumo textil responsable, usando, seleccionando y promoviendo fibras naturales y ecológicas de manera que nos permitan contribuir a un desarrollo sostenible.

Asimismo queremos apoyar otras iniciativas, que persigan los mismos objetivos que nosotros. 

Objetivos del proyecto

Objetivos del proyecto:

·De 28.000 horas tejiendo el primer año a más de 192.000 en 3 años.

·  De 1.400 kg de lanas/hilos el primer año a 9.600 kg en 3 años.

·  De 120 voluntarios tejedores el primer año a más de 800 en 3 años.

·  Acuerdos con más de 100 centros/ONGs, entidades sociales...

·  Ejecutar proyectos sociales en España y otros países. 

·  Desarrollar una plataforma IAIA 2.0 (www.Laiaia.org, Linkedin, Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest)

¿A dónde van dirigidos los fondos?

Estamos recaudando fondos para crear una Fundación. La Fundación IAIA persigue 2 objetivos: (1) hacer sentir útil a otras personas a través de su dedicación con la Terapia de labores y (2) desarrollar y ejecutar proyectos sociales.

¿Qué necesitamos y qué obtienes?

Necesitamos recaudar 37.000 euros. Este dinero servirá para poner en marcha el proyecto y ayudar a que muchas personas puedan ayudar a los demás (dotación inicial de constitución de una Fundación, compra de lanas y material, gastos de transporte para visitar residencias). Es un proyecto a largo plazo, donde esperamos crear empleo para seguir trabajando en ello.

Si no llegamos al objetivo para la creación de la Fundación, destinaremos el importe final que hayamos recaudado a la compra de material y transporte para las visitas a residencias de personas mayores, para garantizar que puedan seguir tejiendo solidaridad.

En cualquier, caso nos ayudas a que otras personas también puedan ser solidarias y ayuden a los demás. 

Otras maneras de ayudarnos

Somos conscientes de que no todo el mundo puede realizar una contribución económica, pero si crees en nuestra iniciativa y te gustaría ayudarnos también puedes hacerlo:

Dándonos a conocer en las redes sociales (Linkedin, Facebook, Twitter, nuestra web www.Laiaia.org)

Contándole nuestra iniciativa a amigos, conocidos…

Puedes unirte a nosotros, contacta con nosotros a través de la página web www.Laiaia.org o el correo electrónico info@Laiaia.org

 

Si te ha gustado nuestro proyecto...ayúdanos a difundirlo!

***************

(English version)


What is this project about?

Everybody likes to help others. However, it is not always possible to contribute due to financial or physical reasons. Our project aims to overcome this barrier and help everyone who wants to help through their own experiences and knowledge in a creative way: knitting. We provide all materials and teach how to knit, there are no expenses for the volunteer. Our objectives:

1. Spending free time in a rewarding way: helping other people. Because we believe on the power of love!

2. Making people feel useful. Because we can create a network of solidarity!

3. Supporting responsible textile consumption. Because we have a traditional yarn culture that we cannot forget!

4. Implementing social and charity projects. Because we can do something positive!

Who are we? 

We are a few people that organize and coordinate volunteer knitting activities aimed primarily at groups of elderly people (experienced and also beginner knitters) who bring us their love and dedication, while giving visibility to their knowledge and skills, motivating and improving self esteem. Thanks to them, we generate funds to develop social programs.

Why this project?

Together we work hard to help people by executing social and charity projects and we would greatly value your contribution to this knitting project. We can create a network of solidarity.

What this projects means for us

This is about personal growth, saying no to selfishness and becoming more aware of our surroundings.

It is about learning things that matter in life and about enjoying daily things that we have forgotten to realize.

It is about to be able to tell other people they can help more needy people.

It is about offering a helping-hand to the values of rural world to come closer to the city.

It is about being creative and by trying to do something positive.

What can we do?

We promote activities aimed at developing the production of craft works, mainly by elderly people, in a way that respects the environment as well as the dissemination of a culture of ethical trade, conducting activities towards responsible textile consumption, using, selecting and providing natural and ecological textile fibers contributing to sustainable development.

All the money we granted will be addressed to social and charity projects.

We also support other initiatives, with the same objectives than us.

Project summary

· From 28,000+ hours of knitting the first year to 192,000+ hours of knitting the third year.

·  From 1,400+ kilograms of yarn the first year to 9,600 kilograms the third year.

·  From 120+ knitting volunteers the first year to 800+ .

·  100+ fields visits to elderly homes, NGOs, social enterprises...

·  Social projects executed in 3 Continents: Europe, America, Africa. 

·  Website: ww.laiaia.org / facebook account / twitter account

Where does the money go?

We are raising funds to build a Foundation (GRANNIE in Spanish). IAIA is going to be established with two missions: to make elderly people feel useful giving us their knowledge and to develop charity and social projects. "Yarn Therapy in our cities and countryside" is project under IAIA (GRANNIE).

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising  37,000 euros to make this project happen. The money will be used for constitutional fees, yarn purchases, travelling cost to elderly homes and equipments.

We are looking to generate public interest and support. You can also join our warm and friendly project and knit with us!

If we do not reach the target for the creation of the Foundation, we will address the final amount we have raised to purchase equipment and transport for visits to homes for the elderly, to ensure they can continue weaving solidarity.

Other ways you can help

We realize that not everyone is able to financially contribute, but if you believe in our cause and would like to support our project you can help us also by:

“Liking” our Facebook page at http://www.facebook.com/laiaia (that will be soon available)

Telling your friends about our website (www.laiaia.org) and our project!

Being a volunteer, contact us info@Laiaia.org

If you like our project ... Please, help us spread the word!

**************


(Deutsch version)

Auf was beruht das Projekt?

Wir glauben, dass es allen gefällt anderen zu helfen. Jedoch ist dies aus wirtschaftlichen oder physischen Gründen nicht immer möglich. Unser Projekt strebt eine Überwindung dieser Barrieren an und hilft allen, die mittels der Weitergabe der eigenen Erfahrungen und Kenntnisse auf kreative Art und Weise helfen möchten: Häkeln.

Wir stellen das notwendige Material bereit und zeigen wie es funktioniert. Es gibt keine Kosten für den ehrenamtlichen Mitarbeiter.

Warum sind wir von diesem Projekt überzeugt?

Wir arbeiten, um soziale Projekte durchzuführen und wir glauben, dass wir einen Mehrwert auf kreative Art und Weise mittels der Handwerksarbeit schaffen. Unser Ziel ist es ein Netzwerk der Solidarität zu errichten.

Was bedeutet dieses Projekt für uns?

Es handelt sich um eine eigene Herausforderung, die egoistischen Verhaltensweisen abzulehnen und sich der Probleme bewusst zu werden, die es in unserem Umfeld gibt.

Es geht darum, die wichtigen Dinge zu lernen, die uns das Leben anbietet.

Es geht darum andere zu überzeugen, dass wir alle einen kleinen Betrag leisten können.

Es geht darum die Werte des ländlichen Raumes zu unterstützen und diese in den Städten zu übermitteln.

Es geht darum kreativ zu sein und positive Dinge zu versuchen.

Was machen wir?

Wir fördern Aktivitäten, die im Zusammenhang mit Handwerksarbeit stehen und vor allem an ältere Menschen adressiert sind und einen respektvollen Umgang mit der Umwelt einschließen.

Dies steht im Zusammenhang mit der Verbreitung einer Kultur des ethischen Handels und Aktivitäten hin zu einem verantwortlichen Textilverbrauch: die Verarbeitung, Auswahl und Förderung von natürlichen und ökologisch gewonnenen Fasern, um einen Beitrag zu einer nachhaltigen Entwicklung zu leisten.

Die Einnahmen aus diesen Aktivitäten werden für soziale Projekte verwendet.

Ziele des Projekts

Von 28.000 Stunden Handarbeit im ersten Jahr, ansteigend auf 192.000 Stunden in drei Jahren

Von 1.400 kg Wolle/Fäden im ersten Jahr, ansteigend auf 9.600 kg im dritten Jahr

Von 120 freiwilligen Webern im ersten Jahr, ansteigend auf mehr als 800 im dritten Jahr

Durchführung von sozialen Projekten in Spanien und anderen Ländern

Erstellung einer Internetseite www.Laiaia.org / einem Account bei Facebook und Twitter

Für wen sind die Einnahmen bestimmt?

Wir sammeln Einnahmen zwecks Gründung einer Nichtregierungsorganisation. Die Stiftung IAIA verfolgt zwei wesentliche Ziele:

(1)Mittels Handwerksarbeit Menschen das Gefühl geben, dass sie sich nützlich fühlen

(2)Soziale Projekte entwickeln und ausführen

Was benötigen wir und was bekommst Du?

Wir benötigen 37.000 Euro für die Gründung einer Stiftung. Dieses Geld dient dazu das Projekt in Gang zu setzen.

Wir versuchen öffentliches Interesse und Unterstützung zu generieren. Jeder kann sich uns anschließen, der Interesse am Häkeln hat oder dies lernen möchte.

Wenn wir das Ziel für die Gründung der Stiftung nicht erreichen, wird die endgültige Menge, die wir angesprochen haben, um Ausrüstung und Transportmittel für Besuche in Altenheimen kaufen zu spenden, um sicherzustellen, dass sie weiterhin Solidarität weben

Andere Arten uns zu helfen

Uns ist bewusst, dass nicht alle einen finanziellen Beitrag leisten können, aber wenn Du von unserer Initiative überzeugt bist und es Dir gefallen würde uns zu unterstützen, kannst Du dies gerne tun:

Mache uns bekannt (mittels Facebook, mittels unserer Homepage www.laiaia.org)

Erzähle Deinen Freunden und Bekannten von unserer Initiative

Sei ein ehrenamtlicher Mitarbeiter der Stiftung. Kontaktiere uns mittels der info@Laiaia.org 


Wenn Sie unser Projekt gefallen hat ... helfen Sie uns, das Wort zu verbreiten!

*************


(française version)

Quel est le projet?

Nous croyons que tout le monde aime aider les autres. Cependant, ceci n'est pas toujours possible à cause de raisons économiques ou physiques. Notre projet vise à surmonter ces obstacles et aider tous ceux qui veulent aider à travers la transmission de leur propre expérience et connaissances d'une manière créative: en tricotant. Nous fournissons tous les matériaux et apprenons à le faire, il n'y a aucun frais pour le volontaire.

Nos objectifs:

1. Occuper le temps libre d'une manière réconfortante: en aidant les autres. Parce qu’on croit en la puissance de l'amour!

2. Faire que les gens se sentent utiles. Nous voulons créer un réseau de solidarité!

3. Encourager la consommation textile responsable. Parce qu’on a une tradition d’artisanat textile que l’on ne peut pas oublier!

4. Mettre en œuvre des projets sociaux. Parce qu'ensemble nous pouvons faire quelque chose de positif!

Qui sommes-nous?

Nous sommes quelques personnes (de différents pays) à organiser et coordonner des activités liées à l’artisanat textile, visant principalement des personnes âgées (à la fois expérimentés et désireux d'apprendre), qui nous donnent leur amour et leur dévouement, alors que nous offrons de la visibilité à leurs travaux et compétences. Nous les motivons ainsi et améliorons leur estime de soi. Grace à eux, nous générons des fonds pour développer des projets sociaux.

Pourquoi croyons-nous en ce projet?

Nous travaillons pour mettre en œuvre des projets sociaux et nous croyons que nous pouvons faire cela en ajoutant de la valeur d'une manière créative à travers l'artisanat textile. Notre objectif est de créer un réseau de solidarité

Que signifie ce projet pour nous?

Il s’agit d’un défi personnel, cherchant à rejeter les attitudes égoïstes et à prendre conscience des problèmes qui nous entourent.

Il s’agit d'apprendre les choses importantes que nous offre la vie.

Il s'agit de convaincre les autres que nous pouvons tous apporter notre grain de sable.

Il s'agit de soutenir les valeurs des zones rurales et les rapprocher à la ville.

Il s'agit d'être créatif et d'essayer de faire des choses positives.

Que faisons-nous?

Nous faisons la promotion d’activités visant à la réalisation d’artisanat textile, visant principalement aux personnes âgées, d'une manière qui respecte l'environnement, ce qui permet aussi la transmission d'une culture du commerce éthique; en dirigeant les activités vers une consommation textile responsable, en utilisant, sélectionnant et promouvant les fibres naturelles écologiques nous permettant ainsi contribuer à un développement durable.

Les fonds amassés seront investis dans des projets sociaux.

De même, nous désirons soutenir d'autres initiatives, qui travaillent vers les mêmes objectifs que nous.

Objectifs du projet:

Passer de 28.000 heures de tissage la première année, à plus de 192.000 en trois ans.

Passer de 1.400 kg de laine / fil la première année, à 9.600 kg en 3 ans. (¿tejido ? ¿comprado ?)

Passer de 120 volontaires tisserands la première année à plus de 800 en trois ans.

Accords avec plus de 100 centres / ONG, organisations sociales ...

Exécuter des projets sociaux en Espagne et en d'autres pays.

Développer un site web www.Laiaia.org , un compte sur facebook / sur twitter

Où sont destinés les fonds ?

Nous réunissons des fonds pour créer une ONG. La fondation IAIA poursuit deux objectifs: (1) de faire sentir utile aux autres à travers son dévouement à l'artisanat textile et (2) développer et mettre en œuvre des projets sociaux.

De quoi avons-nous besoin et qu’est-ce que vous obtenez?

Nous devons réunir 37.000 euros pour couvrir la dotation initiale de constitution d'une fondation. Cet argent sera utilisé pour lancer le projet.

Si nous n'atteignons pas l'objectif de la création de la Fondation, fera un don du montant final, nous avons soulevé à acheter de l'équipement et des transports pour les visites de résidences pour personnes âgées, afin de s'assurer qu'ils peuvent continuer à tisser la solidarité.

Nous cherchons à susciter l'intérêt et le soutien du public. N'importe qui pourrait également nous joindre si il est intéressé au tricotage ou à l’apprendre.

D'autres façons d'aider

Nous nous rendons compte que pas tout le monde peut faire une contribution financière, mais si vous croyez en notre projet et souhaitez aider vous pouvez le faire en:

• Le faisant connaître (via facebook, ou notre site web www.Laiaia.org)

• Racontant notre initiative à des amis, connaissances ...

• Devenant volontaire de la Fondation. Pour ceci, contactez-nous info@Laiaia.org 

Si vous avez aimé notre projet ... nous aider à passer le mot!

************


(version italiano)

Quale è il progetto?

Crediamo che a tutti piace aiutare gli altri. Tuttavia, non è sempre possibile a causa di ragioni economiche o fisiche. Il nostro progetto cerca di superare questi ostacoli e aiutare tutti coloro che vogliono contribuire attraverso la trasmissione dalla sua propria esperienza e conoscenza in modo creativo: lavorare a maglia. Noi forniamo tutti i materiali e insegniamo come farlo, non essiste alcun costo per il collaboratore.

I nostri obiettivi:

1.Occupare il tempo libero in modo riconfortante: aiutando gli altri. Perché noi crediamo nel potere dell'amore!

2.Rendere le persone si sentano utili. Vogliamo creare una rete di solidarietà!

3.Incoraggiare il consumo tessile responsabile. Perché abbiamo una tradizione di manifattura artigianale che non possiamo dimenticare!

4.Istituire progetti sociali. Perché insieme possiamo fare qualcosa di positivo!

Chi siamo?

Siamo un bel po’ di persone (provenienti da diversi paesi) che organizziamo e coordiniamo attività collegate con la manifattura artigianale, principalmente rivolto alle persone anziane (siano esperti oppure desiderosi di imparare), che ci danno il loro amore e dedicazione, mentre noi diamo visibilità a loro lavoro e competenze, cercando di motivargli e migliorare loro autostima. Grazie ai loro lavori si genera il capitale per sviluppare progetti sociali.

Perché noi crediamo in questo progetto?

Lavoriamo per realizzare progetti sociali e crediamo di poter farlo aggiungendo valore attraverso un lavoro artigianale creativo. Il nostro obiettivo è quello di creare una rete di solidarietà.

Che cosa significa questo progetto per noi?

Si tratta di una sfida personale, rifiuttando gli atteggiamenti egoistici e prendendo conaspevolenzza dei problemi che ci circondano.

Cerchiamo d’ imparare dalle cose importante che la vita ci offre.

Cerchiamo di convincere gli altri che tutti noi possiamo dare il nostro contributo.

Cerchiamo sostenere i valori delle zone rurali e avicinali alla città.

Cerchiamo di essere creativi e di fare cose positive.

Che cosa facciamo?

Promuoviamo attività rivolte a realizare lavori artigianali, principalmente indirizzato alle persone anziane, in modo rispettoso per l'ambiente, permettendo anche la trasmissione di una cultura del commercio etico; orientiamo le attività verso il consumo tessile responsabile,  selezionando e la promuovendo l’uso di fibre naturali ed organiche in modo di contribuire allo sviluppo sostenibile.

I fondi raccolti saranno destinati a progetti sociali.

Ugualmente vogliamo anche sostenere altre iniziative che perseguono obiettivi come i nostri.

Obiettivi del progetto:

• Da 28.000 ore di lavoro nel primo anno a più di 192.000 in 3 anni.

• Da 1.400 kg di lana / filati nel il primo anno a 9.600 kg in 3 anni.

• Da 120 collaboratori nel primo anno a più di 800 in 3 anni.

• Accordi con oltre 100 centri / ONG, organizzazioni sociali ...

• Eseguire progetti sociali in Spagna e in altri paesi.

• Sviluppare il sito web www.laiaia.org/ un account su facebook / twitter

Dove é investito il capitale ?

Stiamo raccogliendo soldi per creare una ONG. La Fondazione IAIA cerca due obiettivi: (1) fare sentire utile agli altri attraverso la sua dedicazione al lavoro artigianale e di (2) sviluppare e implementare progetti sociali.

Di che cosa abbiamo bisogno e che cosa si ottiene?

Abbiamo bisogno di raccogliere 37.000€ per coprire il finanziamento iniziale per la costituzione di una Fondazione. Questi soldi saranno utilizzati per lanciare il progetto.

Cerchiamo di generare interesse pubblico e di sostegno. Chiunque può unirsi a noi, se è interessato a lavorare a maglia o imparare a farelo.

Se non raggiungiamo l'obiettivo per la creazione della Fondazione, donerà l'importo finale abbiamo sollevato l'acquisto di attrezzature e di trasporto per visite alle case per anziani, per assicurare che possano continuare a tessere la solidarietà.

Altri modi di aiutarci

Ci rendiamo conto che non tutti possono apportare un contributo eocnomico, ma se ci credi nella nostra iniziativa e ci vuoi aiutare si può anche fare:

• Farci conoscere (attraverso facebook, attraverso la nostra web www.laiaia.org)

• Racconta la nostra iniziativa ad amici, conoscenti ...

• Farti partner della Fondazione, contattateci tramite il sito web info@Laiaia.org 

Se ti è piaciuto il nostro progetto ... aiutarci a diffondere la parola!
story_txt:

2. Hacer que las personas se sientan útiles. ¡Queremos crear una red de solidaridad!
3. Incentivando un consumo textil responsable. ¡Por qué tenemos una tradición de labores que no podemos olvidar!
4. Implementar proyectos sociales. ¡Por qué juntos podemos hacer algo positivo!

Gracias a ellos desarrollamos proyectos sociales.

Trabajamos para ejecutar proyectos sociales y creemos que podemos hacerlo añadiendo valor de una manera creativa mediante la Terapia de labores. Nuestro objetivo es crear una red de solidaridad. 

¿Qué significa este proyecto para nosotros?
Se trata de un reto personal, rechazando las actitudes egoístas y tomando conciencia de los problemas que hay a nuestro alrededor. 
Se trata de aprender de las cosas importantes que nos ofrece la vida. 
Se trata de hacer ver a los demás que todos podemos aportar nuestro granito de arena (o nuestro "grannie" de lana).
Se trata de apoyar los valores del mundo rural y acercarlos a la ciudad.
Se trata de ser creativo e intentar hacer cosas positivas. 

¿Qué hacemos?
Visitamos residencias, centros de día, hogares… y promocionamos actividades enfocadas a la realización de Terapia de labores, dirigidas principalmente a la gente mayor, de una manera respetuosa con el medio ambiente, permitiendo asimismo la transmisión de una cultura de comercio ético; dirigiendo las actividades hacia un consumo textil responsable, usando, seleccionando y promoviendo fibras naturales y ecológicas de manera que nos permitan contribuir a un desarrollo sostenible.
Asimismo queremos apoyar otras iniciativas, que persigan los mismos objetivos que nosotros. 

Objetivos del proyecto
Objetivos del proyecto:
·De 28.000 horas tejiendo el primer año a más de 192.000 en 3 años.
·  De 1.400 kg de lanas/hilos el primer año a 9.600 kg en 3 años.
·  De 120 voluntarios tejedores el primer año a más de 800 en 3 años.
·  Acuerdos con más de 100 centros/ONGs, entidades sociales...
·  Ejecutar proyectos sociales en España y otros países. 
·  Desarrollar una plataforma IAIA 2.0 (www.Laiaia.org, Linkedin, Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest)
¿A dónde van dirigidos los fondos?
Estamos recaudando fondos para crear una Fundación. La Fundación IAIA persigue 2 objetivos: (1) hacer sentir útil a otras personas a través de su dedicación con la Terapia de labores y (2) desarrollar y ejecutar proyectos sociales.
¿Qué necesitamos y qué obtienes?
Necesitamos recaudar 37.000 euros. Este dinero servirá para poner en marcha el proyecto y ayudar a que muchas personas puedan ayudar a los demás (dotación inicial de constitución de una Fundación, compra de lanas y material, gastos de transporte para visitar residencias). Es un proyecto a largo plazo, donde esperamos crear empleo para seguir trabajando en ello.
Si no llegamos al objetivo para la creación de la Fundación, destinaremos el importe final que hayamos recaudado a la compra de material y transporte para las visitas a residencias de personas mayores, para garantizar que puedan seguir tejiendo solidaridad.
En cualquier, caso nos ayudas a que otras personas también puedan ser solidarias y ayuden a los demás. 

Otras maneras de ayudarnosSomos conscientes de que no todo el mundo puede realizar una contribución económica, pero si crees en nuestra iniciativa y te gustaría ayudarnos también puedes hacerlo:
Dándonos a conocer en las redes sociales (Linkedin, Facebook, Twitter, nuestra web www.Laiaia.org)
Contándole nuestra iniciativa a amigos, conocidos…
Puedes unirte a nosotros, contacta con nosotros a través de la página web www.Laiaia.org o el correo electrónico info@Laiaia.org

 

Si te ha gustado nuestro proyecto...ayúdanos a difundirlo!

***************
(English version)



What is this project about?

Everybody likes to help others. However, it is not always possible to contribute due to financial or physical reasons. Our project aims to overcome this barrier and help everyone who wants to help through their own experiences and knowledge in a creative way: knitting. We provide all materials and teach how to knit, there are no expenses for the volunteer. Our objectives:
1. Spending free time in a rewarding way: helping other people. Because we believe on the power of love!
2. Making people feel useful. Because we can create a network of solidarity!
3. Supporting responsible textile consumption. Because we have a traditional yarn culture that we cannot forget!
4. Implementing social and charity projects. Because we can do something positive!


Who are we? 

We are a few people that organize and coordinate volunteer knitting activities aimed primarily at groups of elderly people (experienced and also beginner knitters) who bring us their love and dedication, while giving visibility to their knowledge and skills, motivating and improving self esteem. Thanks to them, we generate funds to develop social programs.

Why this project?

Together we work hard to help people by executing social and charity projects and we would greatly value your contribution to this knitting project. We can create a network of solidarity.


What this projects means for us

This is about personal growth, saying no to selfishness and becoming more aware of our surroundings.
It is about learning things that matter in life and about enjoying daily things that we have forgotten to realize.
It is about to be able to tell other people they can help more needy people.
It is about offering a helping-hand to the values of rural world to come closer to the city.
It is about being creative and by trying to do something positive.


What can we do?

We promote activities aimed at developing the production of craft works, mainly by elderly people, in a way that respects the environment as well as the dissemination of a culture of ethical trade, conducting activities towards responsible textile consumption, using, selecting and providing natural and ecological textile fibers contributing to sustainable development.
All the money we granted will be addressed to social and charity projects.
We also support other initiatives, with the same objectives than us.


Project summary

· From 28,000+ hours of knitting the first year to 192,000+ hours of knitting the third year.
·  From 1,400+ kilograms of yarn the first year to 9,600 kilograms the third year.
·  From 120+ knitting volunteers the first year to 800+ .
·  100+ fields visits to elderly homes, NGOs, social enterprises...
·  Social projects executed in 3 Continents: Europe, America, Africa. 
·  Website: ww.laiaia.org / facebook account / twitter account
Where does the money go?
We are raising funds to build a Foundation (GRANNIE in Spanish). IAIA is going to be established with two missions: to make elderly people feel useful giving us their knowledge and to develop charity and social projects. "Yarn Therapy in our cities and countryside" is project under IAIA (GRANNIE).
What We Need & What You Get
We are raising  37,000 euros to make this project happen. The money will be used for constitutional fees, yarn purchases, travelling cost to elderly homes and equipments.
We are looking to generate public interest and support. You can also join our warm and friendly project and knit with us!
If we do not reach the target for the creation of the Foundation, we will address the final amount we have raised to purchase equipment and transport for visits to homes for the elderly, to ensure they can continue weaving solidarity.

Other ways you can help

We realize that not everyone is able to financially contribute, but if you believe in our cause and would like to support our project you can help us also by:
“Liking” our Facebook page at http://www.facebook.com/laiaia (that will be soon available)
Telling your friends about our website (www.laiaia.org) and our project!
Being a volunteer, contact us info@Laiaia.org
If you like our project ... Please, help us spread the word!
**************

(Deutsch version)
Auf was beruht das Projekt?

Wir glauben, dass es allen gefällt anderen zu helfen. Jedoch ist dies aus wirtschaftlichen oder physischen Gründen nicht immer möglich. Unser Projekt strebt eine Überwindung dieser Barrieren an und hilft allen, die mittels der Weitergabe der eigenen Erfahrungen und Kenntnisse auf kreative Art und Weise helfen möchten: Häkeln.
Wir stellen das notwendige Material bereit und zeigen wie es funktioniert. Es gibt keine Kosten für den ehrenamtlichen Mitarbeiter.
Warum sind wir von diesem Projekt überzeugt?
Wir arbeiten, um soziale Projekte durchzuführen und wir glauben, dass wir einen Mehrwert auf kreative Art und Weise mittels der Handwerksarbeit schaffen. Unser Ziel ist es ein Netzwerk der Solidarität zu errichten.
Was bedeutet dieses Projekt für uns?

Es handelt sich um eine eigene Herausforderung, die egoistischen Verhaltensweisen abzulehnen und sich der Probleme bewusst zu werden, die es in unserem Umfeld gibt.
Es geht darum, die wichtigen Dinge zu lernen, die uns das Leben anbietet.
Es geht darum andere zu überzeugen, dass wir alle einen kleinen Betrag leisten können.
Es geht darum die Werte des ländlichen Raumes zu unterstützen und diese in den Städten zu übermitteln.
Es geht darum kreativ zu sein und positive Dinge zu versuchen.
Was machen wir?

Wir fördern Aktivitäten, die im Zusammenhang mit Handwerksarbeit stehen und vor allem an ältere Menschen adressiert sind und einen respektvollen Umgang mit der Umwelt einschließen.
Dies steht im Zusammenhang mit der Verbreitung einer Kultur des ethischen Handels und Aktivitäten hin zu einem verantwortlichen Textilverbrauch: die Verarbeitung, Auswahl und Förderung von natürlichen und ökologisch gewonnenen Fasern, um einen Beitrag zu einer nachhaltigen Entwicklung zu leisten.




Die Einnahmen aus diesen Aktivitäten werden für soziale Projekte verwendet.
Ziele des Projekts
Von 28.000 Stunden Handarbeit im ersten Jahr, ansteigend auf 192.000 Stunden in drei Jahren
Von 1.400 kg Wolle/Fäden im ersten Jahr, ansteigend auf 9.600 kg im dritten Jahr
Von 120 freiwilligen Webern im ersten Jahr, ansteigend auf mehr als 800 im dritten Jahr
Durchführung von sozialen Projekten in Spanien und anderen Ländern
Erstellung einer Internetseite www.Laiaia.org / einem Account bei Facebook und Twitter

Für wen sind die Einnahmen bestimmt?
Wir sammeln Einnahmen zwecks Gründung einer Nichtregierungsorganisation. Die Stiftung IAIA verfolgt zwei wesentliche Ziele:
(1)Mittels Handwerksarbeit Menschen das Gefühl geben, dass sie sich nützlich fühlen
(2)Soziale Projekte entwickeln und ausführen
Was benötigen wir und was bekommst Du?
Wir benötigen 37.000 Euro für die Gründung einer Stiftung. Dieses Geld dient dazu das Projekt in Gang zu setzen.
Wir versuchen öffentliches Interesse und Unterstützung zu generieren. Jeder kann sich uns anschließen, der Interesse am Häkeln hat oder dies lernen möchte.
Wenn wir das Ziel für die Gründung der Stiftung nicht erreichen, wird die endgültige Menge, die wir angesprochen haben, um Ausrüstung und Transportmittel für Besuche in Altenheimen kaufen zu spenden, um sicherzustellen, dass sie weiterhin Solidarität weben
Andere Arten uns zu helfen
Uns ist bewusst, dass nicht alle einen finanziellen Beitrag leisten können, aber wenn Du von unserer Initiative überzeugt bist und es Dir gefallen würde uns zu unterstützen, kannst Du dies gerne tun:
Mache uns bekannt (mittels Facebook, mittels unserer Homepage www.laiaia.org)
Erzähle Deinen Freunden und Bekannten von unserer Initiative
Sei ein ehrenamtlicher Mitarbeiter der Stiftung. Kontaktiere uns mittels der info@Laiaia.org 

Wenn Sie unser Projekt gefallen hat ... helfen Sie uns, das Wort zu verbreiten!
*************

(française version)
Quel est le projet?
Nous croyons que tout le monde aime aider les autres. Cependant, ceci n'est pas toujours possible à cause de raisons économiques ou physiques. Notre projet vise à surmonter ces obstacles et aider tous ceux qui veulent aider à travers la transmission de leur propre expérience et connaissances d'une manière créative: en tricotant. Nous fournissons tous les matériaux et apprenons à le faire, il n'y a aucun frais pour le volontaire.
Nos objectifs:
1. Occuper le temps libre d'une manière réconfortante: en aidant les autres. Parce qu’on croit en la puissance de l'amour!
2. Faire que les gens se sentent utiles. Nous voulons créer un réseau de solidarité!
3. Encourager la consommation textile responsable. Parce qu’on a une tradition d’artisanat textile que l’on ne peut pas oublier!
4. Mettre en œuvre des projets sociaux. Parce qu'ensemble nous pouvons faire quelque chose de positif!
Qui sommes-nous?
Nous sommes quelques personnes (de différents pays) à organiser et coordonner des activités liées à l’artisanat textile, visant principalement des personnes âgées (à la fois expérimentés et désireux d'apprendre), qui nous donnent leur amour et leur dévouement, alors que nous offrons de la visibilité à leurs travaux et compétences. Nous les motivons ainsi et améliorons leur estime de soi. Grace à eux, nous générons des fonds pour développer des projets sociaux.
Pourquoi croyons-nous en ce projet?
Nous travaillons pour mettre en œuvre des projets sociaux et nous croyons que nous pouvons faire cela en ajoutant de la valeur d'une manière créative à travers l'artisanat textile. Notre objectif est de créer un réseau de solidarité

Que signifie ce projet pour nous?
Il s’agit d’un défi personnel, cherchant à rejeter les attitudes égoïstes et à prendre conscience des problèmes qui nous entourent.
Il s’agit d'apprendre les choses importantes que nous offre la vie.
Il s'agit de convaincre les autres que nous pouvons tous apporter notre grain de sable.
Il s'agit de soutenir les valeurs des zones rurales et les rapprocher à la ville.
Il s'agit d'être créatif et d'essayer de faire des choses positives.
Que faisons-nous?
Nous faisons la promotion d’activités visant à la réalisation d’artisanat textile, visant principalement aux personnes âgées, d'une manière qui respecte l'environnement, ce qui permet aussi la transmission d'une culture du commerce éthique; en dirigeant les activités vers une consommation textile responsable, en utilisant, sélectionnant et promouvant les fibres naturelles écologiques nous permettant ainsi contribuer à un développement durable.
Les fonds amassés seront investis dans des projets sociaux.
De même, nous désirons soutenir d'autres initiatives, qui travaillent vers les mêmes objectifs que nous.

Objectifs du projet:
Passer de 28.000 heures de tissage la première année, à plus de 192.000 en trois ans.
Passer de 1.400 kg de laine / fil la première année, à 9.600 kg en 3 ans. (¿tejido ? ¿comprado ?)
Passer de 120 volontaires tisserands la première année à plus de 800 en trois ans.
Accords avec plus de 100 centres / ONG, organisations sociales ...
Exécuter des projets sociaux en Espagne et en d'autres pays.
Développer un site web www.Laiaia.org , un compte sur facebook / sur twitter
Où sont destinés les fonds ?
Nous réunissons des fonds pour créer une ONG. La fondation IAIA poursuit deux objectifs: (1) de faire sentir utile aux autres à travers son dévouement à l'artisanat textile et (2) développer et mettre en œuvre des projets sociaux.
De quoi avons-nous besoin et qu’est-ce que vous obtenez?
Nous devons réunir 37.000 euros pour couvrir la dotation initiale de constitution d'une fondation. Cet argent sera utilisé pour lancer le projet.
Si nous n'atteignons pas l'objectif de la création de la Fondation, fera un don du montant final, nous avons soulevé à acheter de l'équipement et des transports pour les visites de résidences pour personnes âgées, afin de s'assurer qu'ils peuvent continuer à tisser la solidarité.
Nous cherchons à susciter l'intérêt et le soutien du public. N'importe qui pourrait également nous joindre si il est intéressé au tricotage ou à l’apprendre.
D'autres façons d'aider
Nous nous rendons compte que pas tout le monde peut faire une contribution financière, mais si vous croyez en notre projet et souhaitez aider vous pouvez le faire en:
• Le faisant connaître (via facebook, ou notre site web www.Laiaia.org)
• Racontant notre initiative à des amis, connaissances ...
• Devenant volontaire de la Fondation. Pour ceci, contactez-nous info@Laiaia.org 
Si vous avez aimé notre projet ... nous aider à passer le mot!
************

(version italiano)
Quale è il progetto?
Crediamo che a tutti piace aiutare gli altri. Tuttavia, non è sempre possibile a causa di ragioni economiche o fisiche. Il nostro progetto cerca di superare questi ostacoli e aiutare tutti coloro che vogliono contribuire attraverso la trasmissione dalla sua propria esperienza e conoscenza in modo creativo: lavorare a maglia. Noi forniamo tutti i materiali e insegniamo come farlo, non essiste alcun costo per il collaboratore.
I nostri obiettivi:
1.Occupare il tempo libero in modo riconfortante: aiutando gli altri. Perché noi crediamo nel potere dell'amore!
2.Rendere le persone si sentano utili. Vogliamo creare una rete di solidarietà!
3.Incoraggiare il consumo tessile responsabile. Perché abbiamo una tradizione di manifattura artigianale che non possiamo dimenticare!
4.Istituire progetti sociali. Perché insieme possiamo fare qualcosa di positivo!
Chi siamo?
Siamo un bel po’ di persone (provenienti da diversi paesi) che organizziamo e coordiniamo attività collegate con la manifattura artigianale, principalmente rivolto alle persone anziane (siano esperti oppure desiderosi di imparare), che ci danno il loro amore e dedicazione, mentre noi diamo visibilità a loro lavoro e competenze, cercando di motivargli e migliorare loro autostima. Grazie ai loro lavori si genera il capitale per sviluppare progetti sociali.
Perché noi crediamo in questo progetto?
Lavoriamo per realizzare progetti sociali e crediamo di poter farlo aggiungendo valore attraverso un lavoro artigianale creativo. Il nostro obiettivo è quello di creare una rete di solidarietà.

Che cosa significa questo progetto per noi?
Si tratta di una sfida personale, rifiuttando gli atteggiamenti egoistici e prendendo conaspevolenzza dei problemi che ci circondano.
Cerchiamo d’ imparare dalle cose importante che la vita ci offre.
Cerchiamo di convincere gli altri che tutti noi possiamo dare il nostro contributo.
Cerchiamo sostenere i valori delle zone rurali e avicinali alla città.
Cerchiamo di essere creativi e di fare cose positive.
Che cosa facciamo?
Promuoviamo attività rivolte a realizare lavori artigianali, principalmente indirizzato alle persone anziane, in modo rispettoso per l'ambiente, permettendo anche la trasmissione di una cultura del commercio etico; orientiamo le attività verso il consumo tessile responsabile,  selezionando e la promuovendo l’uso di fibre naturali ed organiche in modo di contribuire allo sviluppo sostenibile.
I fondi raccolti saranno destinati a progetti sociali.
Ugualmente vogliamo anche sostenere altre iniziative che perseguono obiettivi come i nostri.
Obiettivi del progetto:
• Da 28.000 ore di lavoro nel primo anno a più di 192.000 in 3 anni.
• Da 1.400 kg di lana / filati nel il primo anno a 9.600 kg in 3 anni.
• Da 120 collaboratori nel primo anno a più di 800 in 3 anni.
• Accordi con oltre 100 centri / ONG, organizzazioni sociali ...
• Eseguire progetti sociali in Spagna e in altri paesi.
• Sviluppare il sito web www.laiaia.org/ un account su facebook / twitter
Dove é investito il capitale ?
Stiamo raccogliendo soldi per creare una ONG. La Fondazione IAIA cerca due obiettivi: (1) fare sentire utile agli altri attraverso la sua dedicazione al lavoro artigianale e di (2) sviluppare e implementare progetti sociali.
Di che cosa abbiamo bisogno e che cosa si ottiene?
Abbiamo bisogno di raccogliere 37.000€ per coprire il finanziamento iniziale per la costituzione di una Fondazione. Questi soldi saranno utilizzati per lanciare il progetto.
Cerchiamo di generare interesse pubblico e di sostegno. Chiunque può unirsi a noi, se è interessato a lavorare a maglia o imparare a farelo.
Se non raggiungiamo l'obiettivo per la creazione della Fondazione, donerà l'importo finale abbiamo sollevato l'acquisto di attrezzature e di trasporto per visite alle case per anziani, per assicurare che possano continuare a tessere la solidarietà.
Altri modi di aiutarci
Ci rendiamo conto che non tutti possono apportare un contributo eocnomico, ma se ci credi nella nostra iniziativa e ci vuoi aiutare si può anche fare:
• Farci conoscere (attraverso facebook, attraverso la nostra web www.laiaia.org)
• Racconta la nostra iniziativa ad amici, conoscenti ...
• Farti partner della Fondazione, contattateci tramite il sito web info@Laiaia.org 
Se ti è piaciuto il nostro progetto ... aiutarci a diffondere la parola!

story:
About me

Hello all. I'm  Paulie Lipman, a performance poet out of Denver, CO. I have been traveling professionally performing poetry since 2002. This was all made possible by poetry slam, or if you will, competitive performance poetry. Recently, I was selected to be one of Denver's representatives (by way of The Mercury Cafe) at the Individual World Poetry Slam competition (this year in Phoenix, AZ). While it is not far, I do need a little bit of help getting there. That's where y'all come in.

    The Basics

    As The Mercury Cafe has covered my registration fee for the tournament, the only costs left are travel, food, and lodging for 4 days. I think this goal can be easily reached.

    What do you get out of it, you ask? I've got what I feel are some awesome perks ranging from personalized senryu and form poems to spoken word albums/chapbooks and custom music production and live performance in the venue/event of your choosing.

About me
Hello all. I'm  Paulie Lipman, a performance poet out of Denver, CO. I have been traveling professionally performing poetry since 2002. This was all made possible by poetry slam, or if you will, competitive performance poetry. Recently, I was selected to be one of Denver's representatives (by way of The Mercury Cafe) at the Individual World Poetry Slam competition (this year in Phoenix, AZ). While it is not far, I do need a little bit of help getting there. That's where y'all come in.
  The Basics As The Mercury Cafe has covered my registration fee for the tournament, the only costs left are travel, food, and lodging for 4 days. I think this goal can be easily reached.
What do you get out of it, you ask? I've got what I feel are some awesome perks ranging from personalized senryu and form poems to spoken word albums/chapbooks and custom music production and live performance in the venue/event of your choosing.

story:
Short Summary

When my daughter Selin was born, I had written a book called “A Bunny Named May” for her. It is about a bunny who sets out to do something no bunny has done before. It is about perseverance, friendship, and humility. Selin was so inspired by the book that she ended up doing the illustrations for it!

 

 

The book’s message is clear: “if a bunny can achieve her dreams and a seven-year-old girl can illustrate a book, you too can achieve anything you want.” 

We are so happy to have your support in this project!  Please buy a book now and tell your friends to do the same!  There is a perk where the First 100 Books will include Bunny May Stickers! 

In this storybook, 26 colorful illustrations and a bonus coloring page have been included.   

We are seeking to raise $5,000 to be able to print the first 1,000 books with a beautiful hardcover on high-quality thick paper. 

Thank you for your support!

Lots of love, 

Selin & Oznur

Early Press Coverage For A Bunny Named May

About Oznur and Selin

Oznur Yucelen Aytekin is a Stanford University and UW-Platteville Engineering School grad and a former Microsoft Sr. Product Manager. She is the founder and CEO of Edhabit, the social platform for continuous learning.

Selin Aytekin is the 7-year-old illustrator behind “A Bunny Named May”. This is their first book together.   Selin loves to read, draw and is a competitive ice skater.  

Help Get the Book Published to Inspire the Next Generation  

Your contributions will help introduce A Bunny Named May to the world so the little bunny May can inspire kids.  Young May sets out to do something quite brave- something no bunny has ever done before. She keeps on trying and trying.  Will she make it?  If a young bunny and a seven-year-old can accomplish their dreams, so can YOU. What will you do next?    

We will be donating 10% of the profits to charities whose aim is to empower girls. The contributors from the country that makes the highest contribution amount will determine which charity we should contribute to. The winner will be announced at the end of the campaign.  

What We Need & What You Get

You will get a beautiful hardcover A Bunny Named May book. And the first 100 books will come with Bunny May stickers! :-)

We are seeking to raise $5,000 to bring A Bunny Named May to life in a  beautiful hardcover format.  

Please GET BOOKS and tell your friends to do the same.  

The Impact

  • This story inspires children and everyone to pursue their dreams.
  • We need your help to inspire children/people in your life and help bring it to life.
  • You can give these books to children, to people you love and be a source of inspiration.
  • 10% of the profits will go to charities that aim to empower girls. 

Risks & Challenges

The book is ready to be printed. Please help introduce May to the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please tell your friends, your family, and everyone you meet to GET A BOOK and support this campaign.     

Please share where you think we should donate the books.  Do you have a favorite organization, charity, or school that you would like to reach?  Please let us know! 

Please share this link

www.igg.me/at/ABunnyNamedMay

with your friends, via Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, email.  

 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/littlebunnymay/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/littlebunnymay/

Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/littlebunnymay/

Youtube: www.youtube.com/channel/UC3bTehxfm1xAZ5Dhl-66CmA

 

Please use the Indiegogo share tools too!

Thank YOU for YOUR support! 

Lots of love,

Selin & Oznur

About Oznur and Selin


Oznur Yucelen Aytekin is a Stanford University and UW-Platteville Engineering School grad and a former Microsoft Sr. Product Manager. She is the founder and CEO of Edhabit, the social platform for continuous learning.
Selin Aytekin is the 7-year-old illustrator behind “A Bunny Named May”. This is their first book together.   Selin loves to read, draw and is a competitive ice skater.  
Help Get the Book Published to Inspire the Next Generation  

Your contributions will help introduce A Bunny Named May to the world so the little bunny May can inspire kids.  Young May sets out to do something quite brave- something no bunny has ever done before. She keeps on trying and trying.  Will she make it?  If a young bunny and a seven-year-old can accomplish their dreams, so can YOU. What will you do next?    
We will be donating 10% of the profits to charities whose aim is to empower girls. The contributors from the country that makes the highest contribution amount will determine which charity we should contribute to. The winner will be announced at the end of the campaign.  
What We Need & What You Get
You will get a beautiful hardcover A Bunny Named May book. And the first 100 books will come with Bunny May stickers! :-)
We are seeking to raise $5,000 to bring A Bunny Named May to life in a  beautiful hardcover format.  
Please GET BOOKS and tell your friends to do the same.  

The Impact

This story inspires children and everyone to pursue their dreams.
We need your help to inspire children/people in your life and help bring it to life.
You can give these books to children, to people you love and be a source of inspiration.
10% of the profits will go to charities that aim to empower girls. 


Risks & Challenges
The book is ready to be printed. Please help introduce May to the world.

Other Ways You Can Help
Please tell your friends, your family, and everyone you meet to GET A BOOK and support this campaign.     
Please share where you think we should donate the books.  Do you have a favorite organization, charity, or school that you would like to reach?  Please let us know! 
Please share this link
www.igg.me/at/ABunnyNamedMay
with your friends, via Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, email.  
 
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/littlebunnymay/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/littlebunnymay/
Twitter: https://www.twitter.com/littlebunnymay/
Youtube: www.youtube.com/channel/UC3bTehxfm1xAZ5Dhl-66CmA
 
Please use the Indiegogo share tools too!
Thank YOU for YOUR support! Lots of love,Selin & Oznur

story:
So Me And You Are Reading This Zine And You're All Like, "Whoa, This Is Great," And I'm All, "I Know."

The Chicago Zine Fest is fast approaching.  I have spent the last four months making the first four issues of SMAYARTZAYALWTIGAIAK and putting them out in limited runs.  I actually lose a penny on each issue, as they cost $3.01 to print and sell for $3.00.  This is why I was such a successful businessman in my youth.  Good math.  Regardless, it is important to me to have some sort of DIY print endeavor in circulation. 

For the upcoming festival of 'zines I would like to have 20 copies of each SMAYARTZAYALWTIGAIAK and 20 each of the first three issues of Rosario Dawson Loves Me (or: I want to die right now, please), my arguably much better 'zine, to sell or trade.  That's $421.40 in printing costs, plus all that fun folding and stapling!  Technically, I couldn't afford to print/distribute the copies I have done so far, and considering I'm in the process of losing my apartment and throwing myself into the river, I definitely can't spare $421.40.  

If you pitch in, and I very much hope you will, I will naturally and with gratitude provide you with copies of the 'zines in question, quite possibly with a nice handwritten letter and small pressed flowers or a Polaroid photograph of my supple and impressive body.  If you haven't read Rosario Dawson Loves Me excerpts are currently being released via Anthem Magazine online, so feel free to give them a once-over.  If you haven't read SMAYARTZAYALWTIGAIAK I don't know if I can or want to explain it.  Let's say it's a collection of conversations bookended by short fiction.  Examples can be found here.  The Fuck Would I Say What For?
is new, created specifically for the Zine Fest, though it will likely continue for at least a couple issues.  It's a compendium of humorous nonsense, which I have in abundance.

I have no great sales pitch.  If you like my writing, this is the best way to support it since this is how my best work makes its way out into the world: in 5.5"x8.5" black and white booklets, written and printed in the dead of night, passed from hand to hand between drug dealers, pizza delivery personnel and faceless fans of inane contemporary fiction all over the Chicago area (and maybe Philadelphia, and a bit of New York, and a few copies in Arizona, Texas and Oregon).  Whatever you can help with I'd appreciate, and I'll buy you a beer if we're ever in the same bar.

Any amount at all would be helpful.  The perks listed on the side are just perks for certain amounts.  If you want to give $1.00 or $23.00 or $.76 I'll like you just the same and thank you when I see you.  

PRINT LIST:

Rosario Dawson Loves Me (or: I want to die right now, please.) #1
Rosario Dawson Loves Me (or: I want to die right now, please.) #2
Rosario Dawson Loves Me (or: I want to die right now, please.) #3

SMAYARTZAYALWTIGAIAIK #1
SMAYARTZAYALWTIGAIAIK #2
SMAYARTZAYALWTIGAIAIK #3
SMAYARTZAYALWTIGAIAIK #4
SMAYARTZAYALWTIGAIAIK #5 (new!)

The Fuck Would I Say What For? #1 (new!)

story:
Our Story

My name is Robyn and I was born Polydactyl.  As a child, I suffered tremendously at the hands of bullies and my goal in life is to provide easy reading material that will assist the young at heart who may also be silently suffering.

The Impact

The impact of this message is Global.  There are millions of children who are purposely isolated and endure massive mistreatment in schools all across America.

What We Need & What You Get

My son and I are so passionate in the fight against bullying that we have donated copies of this book to Children's Hospitals all over the United States.  Please assist us in spreading this message on a national level.  Our goal is $5000 and the purpose of this campaign amount is to secure national advertising through the New York Times as an ongoing effort to spread our anti-bullying message. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to spreading the word about Polly Dactyl's Magic Castle Missions, you can also help by purchasing the book online at: Amazon.com

 

Thank you for making a positive difference in the life of a child!

story:
¿Qué?

Tinta de limón es una novela histórica que destapa una parte de la historia española, según el protagonista, adulterada por cronistas e historiadores.

Fidel Dopico Moldón, miembro de un sector de la IV Agrupación Guerrillera de Galicia, habla desde su sepultura, situada bajo la cimentación de la autopista AP-9, y sobre la que circulan multitud de hombres y mujeres que ignoran un pasado enterrado a tan escasa distancia.

Los recuerdos afloran a la superficie, impulsados por la emotividad de cinco guerrilleros y un perro, atrapados en la incógnita del tiempo. Vida y muerte se mezclan de modo indisoluble en la narración, consiguiendo que tanto el pasado como el presente articulen los soportes de idéntica denuncia.

La crítica estructura el monólogo de Fidel Dopico Moldón; su amor por Alecrín (sepultada junto a él), atenúa el dolor de muchos resentimientos; y en la firme determinación de hacer llegar su testimonio a las generaciones venideras, se vislumbra un obsesivo deseo de que nada de lo ocurrido vuelva a suceder.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Esther Álvarez.

Nació en A Coruña un 3 de abril de una primavera cualquiera, en compañía de una hermana melliza. Ser nieta de un concejal de la II República, encarcelado en 1942 y sometido a un consejo de guerra en 1952 por colaboración con la resistencia antifranquista, acuñó gran parte de sus convicciones.

Durante la infancia, comparar las andanzas de Don Alonso Quijano o la ironía romántica de Bécquer con las historias que contaba su abuelo, la llevaron a creer que la vida real y la literatura eran prácticamente iguales. En ambas había personajes similares, tramas afines e idénticos contextos donde una falta de ortografía debía cumplir la misma penitencia que una declaración de guerra.

Atraída por el mundo de las letras, escribió infinidad de relatos que publicó en las últimas páginas de sus carpetas escolares, y colaboró con artículos de opinión en periódicos locales, tintados con la censura. El día que recibió una carta manuscrita de Antonio Buero Vallejo alentándola a seguir escribiendo, descubrió que el reconocimiento es la física de los sueños.

Hoy es madre y empresaria. Desempeñar ambos cometidos a la vez, la ha implicado en diferentes terrenos del mundo real donde hasta lo más usual puede ser lo más desconocido. Tinta de limón será el primer manuscrito que publica y, aunque le encante aburrirse de vez en cuando, ya tiene otros en marcha.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como una ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Tinta de limón que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Esther Álvarez vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
The Land Drenched in Tears is a moving history of the tumultuous years of modern China under Mao’s rule, witnessed, experienced, and told through the personal lens of an ethnic minority woman, who endured nearly 20 years imprisonment and surveillance regime as a result of her political activism in Xinjiang, or East Turkistan, located in the far west of China.

Writing her autobiography as an extraordinary melange of diary and memoir, which oscillates between first-hand narrative and flashback, the author, Söyüngül Chanisheff, traces her unfortunate youth from her university years, when she founded the East Turkistan People’s Party as a result of her anger and frustration with communist China’s devastating mishandling of the socio-economic life of the people of her native land, through her subsequent imprisonment in China’s notorious labour camps as well as under the surveillance regime, to her emigration to Australia.

Chanisheff’s autobiography is a rare, detailed, and authentic account of one of the most poignant and most fascinating periods of modern China. It is a microcosmic reflection of the communist regime’s tragic realities presented through the suffering and hope of a young woman who tied her fate to that of her beloved homeland. By boldly exploring hidden territories of modern Chinese history, it not only invites the reader to contemplate the universal topics, such as the relationship between citizen and state as well as between ethnic minority and majority, but also encourages similar stories to be told from our troubled contemporary world. This book is highly recommended for anyone who seeks to gain a deeper understanding of the many issues contemporary China faces.

*The Land Drenched in Tears was translated from Uyghur by London-based Uyghur translator and singer Rahima Mahmut. Having received English PEN Translates grant in May 2017, it will be published by Hertfordshire Press in 2018.
