story:
Story of My Book

OWN IT: Navigating the College Athlete Experience to a Successful Career and Life will teach you how to OWN IT as a collegiate athlete through Openness, Willpower, Nerve, Introspection, and Teamwork. Through reading about the experiences of former student-athletes and those who work within college athletics, you will be well prepared to OWN IT during your time as an athlete and also in your career afterward.

My name is Jess Cook and I am the author of OWN IT. I wrote this book because I found my student-athlete experience to be valuable, and other student-athletes feel the exact same way. As a student-athlete, you are given a very unique opportunity, so why not make the most of it? I want future and current college athletes to realize what the student-athlete experience is all about. Along with this, I want former athletes to discover how they can leverage their previous experience to propel them in several areas of their lives.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how to OWN the student-athlete experience at the collegiate level. In this book, I hope to instill the same passion and excitement that I have for the personal development that occurs within college athletics in you. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you excel in other areas of your life outside of athletics. 

In this book, you'll learn how to OWN IT and how to leverage your student-athlete experience to discover success:

The story of Ryan Gilliam - Ryan had his sights set on becoming a player in the NFL. This dream was not out of his reach, but that all changed after one play in a critical game. Ryan found himself lost and had to become open to new opportunities outside of football. 

The story of Jenna Lilley - Jenna was an Oregon Duck. She was a nationally known for playing third base for the softball team. Through her student-athlete experience she was able to combine her academic and athletic passions. Connecting her passions added significant value to her collegiate athlete experience.

The story of Kendall Spencer - Kendall is someone who definitely made the most out of his student-athlete experience. Keeping himself busy throughout all hours of the day, Kendall was able to become a National Champion and also a leader on a national stage. This would not have been possible if sacrifices were not made.

The story of Tommy Zagorski - Tommy was the definition of a hard worker, in every aspect of his life. Football was his passion and he did not let anything get in the way of that, until he experienced a series of unfortunate events. Tommy discovered that having the opportunity to play the sport you are most passionate about at the collegiate level is truly a privilege.

You will love this book if you want to learn more about the lessons learned and the skills gained from being a collegiate athlete.

OWN IT: Navigating the College Athlete Experience to a Successful Career and Lifeis a non-fiction book that speaks to future, current, and former student-athletes. 

The Book - OWN IT

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction, as well as Chapters 1 and 2. In the introduction, we will discuss how a majority of business leaders were collegiate athletes. From there, the book goes onto put all the misconceptions about student-athletes to rest. In Chapter 2, each component of the OWN IT structure is introduced at the surface: Openness, Willpower, Nerve, Introspection, and Teamwork.

Part 2 contains Chapters 3-13. This portion of the book explores the OWN IT framework in depth. Readers will learn through the experiences of myself and others, combined with research. Each component of OWN IT can take on a few different angles. Part 2 allows you to explore all angles to discover how you can fit each component into your life as a future, current, or former student-athlete.

Part 3 contains Chapters 14-15 along with the conclusion. This is where it all comes full circle. The reader will discover how to OWN IT in areas outside of their sport, such as in their professional career. Being a student-athlete provides you with a unique skillset that separates you from the pack. Part 3 will show you how you can use it to your advantage.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Jess Cook is a former student-athlete who played softball and was heavily involved on her college campus. Now a young professional in the professional sports world, she has realized how valuable her time as a student-athlete was. Jess studied Sports Studies, Business, and Entrepreneurship at John Carroll University. 

Jess wrote this book because she was fascinated by the personal development that occurs through the student-athlete experience. If done correctly, being a collegiate athlete can help you excel in various aspects of your life. Jess wanted to help future and current student athletes discover the ways to make the most out of their experience. She also wanted former athletes to realize that their experience prepared them to be successful outside of their sport.

Sports and fitness are what Jess has been all about starting from a young age. She used these as focal points during her time as a student at John Carroll University. Not to mention, she continued to root for all Pittsburgh sports teams while going to college in Cleveland, Ohio. Outside of this, there's nothing Jess values more than family and friends.

For more information you can connect with Jess through email at owing.jesscook@gmail.com and on LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/in/jessica-l-cook/.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #OWNIT and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jess Cook
story_txt:
Story of My BookOWN IT: Navigating the College Athlete Experience to a Successful Career and Life will teach you how to OWN IT as a collegiate athlete through Openness, Willpower, Nerve, Introspection, and Teamwork. Through reading about the experiences of former student-athletes and those who work within college athletics, you will be well prepared to OWN IT during your time as an athlete and also in your career afterward.My name is Jess Cook and I am the author of OWN IT. I wrote this book because I found my student-athlete experience to be valuable, and other student-athletes feel the exact same way. As a student-athlete, you are given a very unique opportunity, so why not make the most of it? I want future and current college athletes to realize what the student-athlete experience is all about. Along with this, I want former athletes to discover how they can leverage their previous experience to propel them in several areas of their lives.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how to OWN the student-athlete experience at the collegiate level. In this book, I hope to instill the same passion and excitement that I have for the personal development that occurs within college athletics in you. And then ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you excel in other areas of your life outside of athletics. In this book, you'll learn how to OWN IT and how to leverage your student-athlete experience to discover success:The story of Ryan Gilliam - Ryan had his sights set on becoming a player in the NFL. This dream was not out of his reach, but that all changed after one play in a critical game. Ryan found himself lost and had to become open to new opportunities outside of football. The story of Jenna Lilley - Jenna was an Oregon Duck. She was a nationally known for playing third base for the softball team. Through her student-athlete experience she was able to combine her academic and athletic passions. Connecting her passions added significant value to her collegiate athlete experience.The story of Kendall Spencer - Kendall is someone who definitely made the most out of his student-athlete experience. Keeping himself busy throughout all hours of the day, Kendall was able to become a National Champion and also a leader on a national stage. This would not have been possible if sacrifices were not made.The story of Tommy Zagorski - Tommy was the definition of a hard worker, in every aspect of his life. Football was his passion and he did not let anything get in the way of that, until he experienced a series of unfortunate events. Tommy discovered that having the opportunity to play the sport you are most passionate about at the collegiate level is truly a privilege.You will love this book if you want to learn more about the lessons learned and the skills gained from being a collegiate athlete.OWN IT: Navigating the College Athlete Experience to a Successful Career and Lifeis a non-fiction book that speaks to future, current, and former student-athletes. The Book - OWN ITThe book is written in 3 parts.Part 1 contains the introduction, as well as Chapters 1 and 2. In the introduction, we will discuss how a majority of business leaders were collegiate athletes. From there, the book goes onto put all the misconceptions about student-athletes to rest. In Chapter 2, each component of the OWN IT structure is introduced at the surface: Openness, Willpower, Nerve, Introspection, and Teamwork.Part 2 contains Chapters 3-13. This portion of the book explores the OWN IT framework in depth. Readers will learn through the experiences of myself and others, combined with research. Each component of OWN IT can take on a few different angles. Part 2 allows you to explore all angles to discover how you can fit each component into your life as a future, current, or former student-athlete.Part 3 contains Chapters 14-15 along with the conclusion. This is where it all comes full circle. The reader will discover how to OWN IT in areas outside of their sport, such as in their professional career. Being a student-athlete provides you with a unique skillset that separates you from the pack. Part 3 will show you how you can use it to your advantage.What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2019
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...
About the AuthorJess Cook is a former student-athlete who played softball and was heavily involved on her college campus. Now a young professional in the professional sports world, she has realized how valuable her time as a student-athlete was. Jess studied Sports Studies, Business, and Entrepreneurship at John Carroll University. Jess wrote this book because she was fascinated by the personal development that occurs through the student-athlete experience. If done correctly, being a collegiate athlete can help you excel in various aspects of your life. Jess wanted to help future and current student athletes discover the ways to make the most out of their experience. She also wanted former athletes to realize that their experience prepared them to be successful outside of their sport.Sports and fitness are what Jess has been all about starting from a young age. She used these as focal points during her time as a student at John Carroll University. Not to mention, she continued to root for all Pittsburgh sports teams while going to college in Cleveland, Ohio. Outside of this, there's nothing Jess values more than family and friends.For more information you can connect with Jess through email at owing.jesscook@gmail.com and on LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/in/jessica-l-cook/.Risks & ChallengesThe biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #OWNIT and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.
 Thank you so much of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Jess Cook

story:
For many, Christmas is an annual celebration of goodwill and joy, but for others, it’s a time to curl up on the couch in the dead of winter for a good old fashioned fright. The festive holiday season has always included a more somber side, and scary tales of child-stealing demons to ghost stories told ‘round the fireplace go back to pre-Christian celebrations. These long-standing traditions have found modern expression in Christmas horror film and television shows, a unique and sometimes controversial subgenre that cheerfully drives a stake of holly through the heart of cherished Christmas customs.

Yuletide Terror: Christmas Horror on Film and Television, the latest book by Canadian micro-publisher Spectacular Optical, offers a definitive, in-depth exploration of the history of these subversive film and television presentations that allow viewers to engage in different ways with the complicated cultural history of the Christmas season.

Yuletide Terror collects over 20 essays and interviews that will deck your halls with insightful looks at all your festive fright favourites, including the BBC’s A Ghost Story for Christmas anthology series and contentious 1980s Santa slashers like Silent Night, Deadly Night. Unwrapping the true meaning of films featuring everyone from the Krampus and Scrooge to killer snowmen and evil elves, Yuletide Terror is a comprehensive look at TV and cinematic holiday horror from around the world, and includes a compendium including nearly 200 Christmas horror film reviews. This new anthology, set to be released for Christmas 2017, is the latest addition to Spectacular Optical’s line of cult film and pop culture books including Kid Power!, Satanic Panic: Pop-Cultural Paranoia in the 1980s and Lost Girls: The Phantasmagorical Cinema Of Jean Rollin.

Yuletide Terror features new writing by both emerging and acclaimed authors including Stephen Thrower (Nightmare USA), Kim Newman (Nightmare Movies), Caelum Vatnsdal (They Came From Within: A History Of Canadian Horror Cinema), Michael Gingold (Rue Morgue), Shelagh Rowan-Legg (The Spanish Fantastic), Alexandra West (Films Of The New French Extremity), Michael Helms (Fatal Visions), Andrea Subissati (Rue Morgue), Zack Carlson (Destroy All Movies!!!), Joanna Wilson (The Christmas TV Companion), Diane A. Rodgers (Cinema Retro), Andrew Nette (Pulp Curry), Amanda Reyes (Made For TV Mayhem), David Bertrand (Satanic Panic), Eric Zaldivar (Co-Writer, Django Lives!), Leslie Hatton (Popshifter), Owen Williams (Empire), Ralph Elawani (Bleu Nuit: Histoire D’un Cinéphilie Nocturne), Derek Johnston (Haunted Seasons: Television Ghost Stories For Christmas And Horror For Halloween), Neil Mitchell (Devil’s Advocates: Carrie), Chris Hallock (Diabolique), Ariel Fisher (Rue Morgue), Lee Gambin (Nope, Nothing Wrong Here: The Making Of Cujo), Zach Clark (Writer/Director, White Reindeer) alongside co-editors Kier-La Janisse (House of Psychotic Women) and Paul Corupe (Canuxploitation).

The book also features Motion Picture Purgatory comic reviews of Christmas horror films by underground cartoonist Rick Trembles, and original illustrations by British artist Alisdair Wood. See Alisdair's cover art here:

THE CONTENTS

Terror and Transformation: The Enduring Legacy of A Christmas Carol
By Leslie Hatton

Ringing The Changes: Bob Clark's Black Christmas
By Stephen Thrower

Christmas Shocking: The Silent Night, Deadly Night Controversy
By Michael Gingold

“Protecting (Not Punishing) Billy”: Gilmer McCormick on Silent Night, Deadly Night
By Lee Gambin

An interview with Christmas Evil director Lewis Jackson
By Amanda Reyes

“They’re Not Working For Santa Anymore”: An interview with Elves director Jeff Mandel
By Zach Clark

Christmas Campout: a Q&A with Campfire Tales co-director Paul Talbot
By Eric Zaldivar

It’s The Most Cynical Time of the Year: Christmastime in Horror Anthology Television
By Amanda Reyes

An interview with Fred Dekker on Tales From the Crypt's "And All Through the House"
By Kier-La Janisse

Why the Ghost Story at Christmas?
By Derek Johnston

Warnings to the Curious: The BBC’s A Ghost Story for Christmas
By Kier-La Janisse

Robin Redbreast and BBC's Play for Today: 1970s Folk Horror for Christmas
By Diane A. Rogers

A Hammer Film for Christmas: Cash on Demand
By Kim Newman

“Hello, Dave!”: The Joyful Misanthropy of The League Of Gentlemen Christmas Special
By Owen Williams

Our Best Tree Ever: When Experimentalists Tackle Yuletide Terror
By Caelum Vatnsdal

Santa Brought a Syringe: Robert Morin’s Petit Pow! Pow! Noël
By Ralph Elawani

All I Want for Christmas is You: Franck Khalfoun’s P2
By Alexandra West

Won't Someone Think of The Children?
By Andrea Subissati

Santa Vs. Satan: How Santa Conquered Hell and Mars to Create Holiday Horror
By Zack Carlson

Stolen Voices and Kooky Carols: Yvonne Mackay’s The Monster's Christmas
By Kier-La Janisse

An Interview with Alain Lalanne, the child hero of René Manzor's 3615: Code Pere Noël
By Federico Caddeo (translated by Lee Paula Springer)

Surviving the Yuletide Season: Alcohol, Physical Affliction and Murder Down Under in The Evil Touch
By Andrew Nette

Apocalypse Sinterklaas: Santa Claus’ Horror Roots in European Folklore
By David Bertrand

Horns for the Holidays: The Krampus Conquers North American Horror Films
Paul Corupe

COMPENDIUM
(featuring nearly 200 Christmas Horror Film and Television reviews!)

PAGE SAMPLES:

PLUS! As part of this campaign, we will be releasing a new Christmas horror short film made to accompany the book, written and directed by Sean Hogan (THE DEVIL’S BUSINESS) and produced by Deviant Films, the team who brought you FUTURE SHOCK! THE STORY OF 2000AD. The short film—a windswept ghost story set on England’s southeastern coast called WE ALWAYS FIND OURSELVES IN THE SEA—will accompany book launch events throughout November/December in advance of its online premiere on Christmas Eve, as a nod to the British broadcasting tradition of Christmas ghost stories.

A lonely recluse prepares to celebrate Christmas alone, when a figure from his past unexpectedly reappears. But are the old ghosts stirred up by her arrival just bad memories or something more?

“Being able to make a small contribution to the Christmas ghost story tradition has me feeling like, well, a kid at Christmas,” says Hogan. “That particular juxtaposition of Yuletide cheer with the eerie and unsettling has always been a particular delight for me, and the various seasonal UK TV ghost stories that were produced over the years are still something I regularly return to for enjoyment and inspiration. Their simplicity of means and economy of style (however dictated by TV budgets) are still beautifully effective, and a lesson to all genre filmmakers that yes, less is often more. I can never hope to match them, but I'm very much looking forward to paying tribute to a form that has continually brought me so much pleasure/fear!”

See the trailers for THE DEVIL'S BUSINESS and FUTURE SHOCK! THE STORY OF 2000AD below!

Perks are unique added incentives to support the book now; they are free gifts you get with contributions of anything over the basic cost of the book - and some of them are pretty spectacular!



Detailed images of the Greeting cards:

Adam Juresko, SILENT NIGHT DEADLY NIGHT

Trevor Henderson, TALES FROM THE DARKSIDE "Seasons of Belief"

Andrew Barr, GREMLINS:

 

Gary Pullin, BLACK CHRISTMAS:

Rick Trembles, CHRISTMAS EVIL:

The funds raised here will go specifically toward the printing and manufacturing of the books, as well as a small budget for the production of the short film and other special perks. These pre-sales also ensure that we can pay artist fees – not only designer fees, but all contributors to the book receive royalties on every copy sold. Part of our goal with Spectacular Optical is to create a small but sustainable business that is able to pay artist fees to the many awesome (and often underpaid) writers and graphic artists working in our field, and to give them books they are proud of. Any writers who contributed to our last books, KID POWER!, SATANIC PANIC: POP-CULTURAL PARANOIA IN THE 1980s and LOST GIRLS: THE PHANTASMAGORICAL CINEMA OF JEAN ROLLIN can vouch for us on this count.

In addition, as part of our crowdfunding campaigns, we often team up with like-minded organizations to offer their products in bundles with our own, acknowledging that collaboration between independent artists and companies keeps our small economy moving and allows us all to find an audience for our unique work.

If we don't reach our goal, the book will still be printed and perks will still be delivered - the book is completely written and copy-edited, contracts have been signed, photographs have been sourced and the book is being laid out. We’re well on our way! But pre-sales through Indiegogo ensure the necessary cash flow to keep everything in the allotted timeline so that we can take advantage of promotional and sales opportunities through the holiday season. Our goal is to have the book ready and being mailed out to customers by the end of November 2017, where it will serve as the perfect Christmas gift, but we need sufficient pre-sales to meet that timeline - so if you want to give someone a copy of YULETIDE TERROR for Christmas, help us spread the word to reach our goal!

YULETIDE TERROR will be a beautiful 6X9", perfect-bound book, roughly 400 pages and heavily illustrated throughout with stills, posters, ads and other visual ephemera. It is a unique book in that it combines academic research with a pop-culture approach, offering a high standard of analytical insight while remaining accessible and comprehensive.

In just a few short years, Spectacular Optical has garnered a reputation for making quality books that showcase underappreciated or under-examined aspects of pop culture - and we hope to make many more. This is the fourth book being published under my own imprint, and I have managed many projects at this scale - from running film festivals to operating my own microcinema. And aside from whatever skills, experience and connections we bring to the table (you can read our full bios below), we’ve also been mentored all along the way by the British cult film publisher FAB Press - so we have some good people on our side making sure we don’t fall.

 

Kier-La Janisse is a film writer and programmer, Owner/Artistic Director of Spectacular Optical Publications and the founder of The Miskatonic Institute of Horror Studies, and has been a programmer for the Alamo Drafthouse Cinema and Fantastic Fest in Austin, Texas. She is the author of A Violent Professional: The Films of Luciano Rossi (FAB Press, 2007) and House of Psychotic Women: An Autobiographical Topography of Female Neurosis in Horror and Exploitation Films (FAB Press, 2012), and has contributed to the books Destroy All Movies!! The Complete Guide to Punks on Film (Fantagraphics, 2011), Recovering 1940s Horror: Traces of a Lost Decade (Lexington, 2014) The Canadian Horror Film: Terror of the Soul (University of Toronto Press, 2015) and We Are the Martians: The Legacy of Nigel Kneale (PS Press, 2017) as well as co-editing and/or publishing Spectacular Optical books KID POWER! (2014), Satanic Panic: Pop-Cultural Paranoia in the 1980s (2015) and Lost Girls: The Phantasmagorical Cinema of Jean Rollin (2017). In addition to her work on the forthcomingYuletide Terror, she is currently writing A Song from the Heart Beats the Devil Every Time: Children's Programming and the Counterculture, 1965-1985, as well as a monograph about Monte Hellman's Cockfighter.

The creator of Canuxploitation.com, Toronto-based writer and editor Paul Corupe has been exploring and documenting the secret history of Canadian genre movies for more than 15 years. A regular contributor to Rue Morgue magazine, he is has also written about film for The Toronto Star, Take One Film and Television in Canada and Cinema Sewer, among others.

 

About Spectacular Optical:
Named after the sinister institution in David Cronenberg’s Videodrome, Spectacular Optical is a small-press publisher of collectible film and pop culture books with an emphasis on supporting Canadian genre film writers and designers. Spectacular Optical is owned and operated by film writer and programmer Kier-La Janisse.

In addition to our print books, throughout the year Spectacular Optical produces film events and brings you articles, essays and interviews with established and emerging genre filmmakers, artists, curators and exhibitors on our website. Through our film production arm, we support the creation of genre-related short, feature-length and episodic media.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can’t contribute financially doesn’t mean you can’t help! It would be a great help just to post a link to our campaign on Facebook, Twitter and/or other social media using the Indiegogo share tools - and encourage others to share the link too!

Through our film production arm, we support the creation of genre-related short, feature-length and episodic media.
Other Ways You Can Help
Just because you can’t contribute financially doesn’t mean you can’t help! It would be a great help just to post a link to our campaign on Facebook, Twitter and/or other social media using the Indiegogo share tools - and encourage others to share the link too!

story:
Matching Grant

A backer has come forward with an offer to match any contributions of up to $500. Nine days are left in the campaign. The perks described below will be granted according to the matched contribution total. For example, your contribution of $50 will be counted as a contribution of $100, which means you'll get a free book.

My deepest gratitude goes to any backers who choose to take up this offer, and to the matching grant backer. I could not be more grateful!

The Project

Imagine walking across America. My friend George Lawrence did that. He walked from LA to New York with a group of environmental activists, taking photos, raising ecological consciousness, learning the land first-hand. I wanted to join him, but I couldn’t. So I wrote him poems.

For each week of the nine-month walk, I wrote him a poem about the next leg of his walk based on research into the landscapes he would walk through, their creatures and features, their social and natural history, their First Nation inhabitants.

Now I am publishing these poems as a large-format, high-quality, coffee table-style book—The Road to Continental Heart: Befriending, and Defending, the Spirit of North America. Continental Heart is a hybrid publication: a book of poetry that includes photographs that George and a friend took along the walk, maps of the route, and excerpts from our correspondence. And I am hoping that you will help support its publication.

The book will be published this year by Boyle and Dalton, a hybrid book publisher. “Hybrid” means they manage the design, production, and distribution of the book and the author contributes financially to the production costs and does the marketing legwork, sets the price, and receives a higher-than-usual percentage of royalties.

Are you interested?

The Hope

The Road to Continental Heart is a meditation on the landscapes of North America expressed in images—images crafted through the poet’s pen and the focused lens. These images are as personal as friendship and feet, as universal as sunlight, rain, and heat.

They teach; they query; they reminisce; they worry about the fate of our homeland. They celebrate the diversity and majesty of the continent we live on. They speak to the spirit of beauty and sense of presence, the love and care that bind a people to its land base. They hope to inspire a deeper relationship with the land we depend on, and to nurture a vibrant culture of place that stands ready to defend it from outrage. The book hopes to appeal to the mind and the soul, to the eye and the heart, as only poems and pictures can do.

Hence this campaign. For I am not able to cover the entire cost of production myself and I am hoping you might help.

The Request and the Offer

The request. I aim to raise a total of $4,100 for the publisher’s production fee and for marketing efforts and fulfillment of contributor orders. Boyle and Dalton’s fee is $4,300, toward which I can afford to pay $1,200, leaving $3,100 from this campaign. For the marketing and campaign expenses and for the estimated cost of shipping pre-ordered contributor copies (see The Offer below), I am asking for $1,000. The total request, then, is $4,600.

The offer. In gratitude for your support, I offer the following:

  • $0–$24      For a contribution of $25 or less, your name will appear in an acknowledgement section of the book’s website.
  • $25–49       You receive an eBook copy of Continental Heart and your name on the website.
  • $50–$99    Your receive a 50% discount on the print edition, an eBook copy, and your name on the website.
  • $100 or more    You receive a free signed print edition of Continental Heart, named acknowledgement in a special section of the print edition, and an eBook copy.

I also plan to donate 5% of my royalties from the book to a leading nonprofit conservation organization, so that together we can continue to advance the environmental goals of the Walk.

The Author

Steven Dale Davison is a published poet and nonfiction writer, a produced playwright, and was for twenty years a freelance and professional writer in the private sector. He has published poems in Gyroscope Review, River and South, Sixfold, Inscape, Crosswinds Poetry Journal, Maximum Tilt, Steam Ticket, Comstock Review, Gravitas, From Whispers to Roars, and TallGrass Writers Guild. His plays have been written in both verse and prose. He has written both short and long fiction and has published a number of nonfiction essays and book chapters. Mr. Davison was awarded a writing scholarship by Earlham School of Religion in Richmond, Indiana.

Other contributors:

George Lawrence—photographs, letters, journal entries.

Gabriella Cover—photographs.

Risks and Challenges

The risk is not receiving a book you ordered along with your substantial contribution. The poems have been written. The photos have been taken, collected, and catalogued. The book has an enthusiastic publisher and the publishing contract has been signed. The only thing left is to track the contributions, provide receipt coupons for those who receive a book, and then to deliver those books. Shipping costs are built into the campaign.

The challenge will be tracking the contributions toward an eBook or a discounted book or a free book and managing the pre-sale shipping. The publisher and I will keep all backers up to date as the book reaches its publishing milestones. Contributors who are getting books will know when we expect to ship your copy and you will have my personal contact information, so that I can sort out any problems with delivery of your book.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t support the campaign yourself financially, you can share the campaign with others, if you feel the project has merit. If you know folks who you think might be interested, please pass on the link for the campaign and the url for the book’s website and its social media accounts.

Once we’ve published, you can share the book itself. We think it will be an interesting and valuable gift for friends or family who share your own passion for the themes expressed in the book, or just a buying tip for folks who love poetry and who love the continent we live on and its unique beauty and majesty.

story:
Story of My Book

Every Step is a Gift: Caregiving, Endurance, and the Path to Gratitude explores my eleven-year journey as a caregiver to my father while he battled Parkinson’s Disease. It’s the story of our relationship, the lessons I’ve learned, and my foray into ultra endurance biking and running.

---

My name is Josh Lasky, and I am the author of Every Step is a Gift. I wrote this book because I feel like there are a lot of other people out there who are having or have had a similar experience to mine, and yet feel completely alone. According to AARP, 78% of people are currently caring for an aging family member or believe they will likely do so at some point in their life. That number is likely to increase, as more than 75 million baby boomers (born between 1946 and 1964) are currently planning their retirement. I didn’t know where to turn for support and inspiration when I chose to care for my ailing father, and like so many of us, I made it up as I went along. Now, on the other side of that journey, I’m certain that I would have benefitted from hearing the stories of others who were in a similar situation to mine.

My hope is that this book will bring conversations about caregiving, aging, and disability more into the mainstream. These topics are still far too uncomfortable for many people to share, but the more we can learn to embrace this natural progression of life, the more we’ll be able to make intentional decisions about ourselves and loved ones. I also hope that my readers will begin to find ways to shape their experiences as caregivers (or in any role struggling with an insurmountable challenge) to be positive and meaningful.

I’m grateful to have found a way to add meaning to my experience as I cared for my father. I was able to do this by cherishing the time that I had with him, while also focusing on my own physical and mental wellbeing through long-distance cycling and ultra running. In addition to detailed interactions with my father, the book highlights my 4,000-mile bike ride from Washington, DC to Portland, OR and my experience running my first races at the marathon, 50-mile, and 100-mile distance.

You’ll love this book if you’ve ever been a caregiver or if you’ve dealt with a really crappy situation and you’ve struggled to make the most out of it. You’ll love this story if you enjoy running or biking for exercise, for mediation, or for escape. You’ll love this story if you’ve ever had to face the disability, end-of-life planning, or death, of a loved one.

Every Step is a Gift is a creative non-fiction book that speaks to caregivers, family members, and athletes who are navigating challenging relationships, while trying to maintain strength, meaning, and resilience.
 

The Book - Every Step is a Gift: Caregiving, Endurance, and the Path to Gratitude

The book is written in 3 Parts:

Part 1 introduces my father’s arrival and first year in Washington, DC where he lived near the campus of the university where I was attending grad school. It also discusses his transition to nursing care following a precipitous decline in his condition.

Part 2 details my father’s deep brain stimulation and recovery, as well as my broken ankle and surgeries required to repair it. This section also describes the cross-country bike ride I embarked on after rehabilitating my ankle.

Part 3 discusses my growing passion for ultrarunning against the backdrop of my father’s steady decline, including his transition to hospice care and his eventual death.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020.
  • The cover design of my book (the mockups you see currently are a placeholder)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats)
  • The copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication,
  • The launch and promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book ($5,000), I will publish.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book ($6,000), I will also publish an audiobook.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book ($8,000), I will publish a hardcover edition.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
 
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book.
  • Your name will appear in a special acknowledgements section of my book.
  • Early access to the introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover.
  • An invitation to a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book.
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Josh Lasky is a son, husband, brother, ultra endurance athlete, and aspiring author. By day, Josh serves as Managing Director and Chief Strategist for LINK Strategic Partners, a national strategic communications and stakeholder engagement firm that advances social impact by empowering individuals to have a voice in the future of their communities.

Prior to joining LINK, Josh worked to build strategic partnerships in various roles at the U.S. Green Building Council (USGBC), most recently leading USGBC’s sponsorship team and managing strategic partnerships for the Center for Green Schools at USGBC. Josh previously held a joint-faculty staff appointment at the University of the District of Columbia (UDC), where he launched the university-wide sustainability initiative and served as UDC’s first instructor of Urban Sustainability. Josh was a Presidential Administrative Fellow at The George Washington University (GW), where he served as the GW Office of Sustainability's first staff member.

Josh is a member of the board of directors of Climate Ride, a nonprofit established to change lives through sports and drive philanthropic impact for the sustainability movement. Since 2008, Climate Ride has granted more than $6 million to climate and active transportation groups around the country.

As an amateur endurance athlete, Josh has completed more than 6,000 miles of bicycle touring, including a 4,300-mile solo and self-supported trek from Washington, DC to Portland, OR. Josh has also completed ultramarathons at the 50-kilometer, 50-mile, and 100-mile distance. If he's not running or riding, Josh is with his partner Kate learning how to fix something in their rowhouse in northeast DC or playing with Brea, their Australian cattle dog.

For more information you can connect with Josh at josh.lasky@gmail.com, on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn.


Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
 
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #EveryStepIsAGift and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to five friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or direct message on social media.


Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Yours,
Josh

story:
Short Summary

UPDATE: The new issue can be downloaded at www.roctober.rocks and it is a whopping 128 pages! But because it is so big with so much color we need to raise a few more dollars! Out new goal is $3600, and if you order the limited hard copy you get exclusive trading crads.

Since he early 1990s Roctober Magazine has been one of the most passionate, thorough, absurd, densely packed, ridiculous music zines in the world, with brilliant, research-obsessed, generous writers covering obscure musicians in all genres. The zine also featuring some of the best graphic artists and cartoonists who ever lived. Roctober helps music fans around the globe discover lost superheroes of music, and those artists get the respect and honors they long-deserve by seeing their stories told accurately and joyfully. After a hiatus of more than 5 years the zine returns, now being published annually each October. A PDF of #52 will be released this Halloween followed by a very special limited edition print edition, which you can pre-order here in this funding campaign.

What We Need & What You Get

Because this is a crazy year (without the non-COVID stores and zine fests and record labels advertising and normal distribution) we are making this issue in a limited edition, so we will print based on pre-orders from this campaign and from local and indie vendors/distros. So your order determines how many we print, and the more orders we get determines how fancy we can print this (extra color, quality of paper, etcetera). If we only get a few orders this will still be cool - just more DIY-looking. But if we get a healthy amount of orders we can make this issue spectacular! So help us meet that goal of greatness.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hopefully you can pre-order a copy, we really appreciate it.

But also help us spread the word --- tell your friends, spread this on socials, and use the indieagogo share tools!

Thanks, and keep on Rockin'!

story:
DỰ ÁN "NHỮNG CHÚ CÁ Ở THIÊN ĐƯỜNG"

Chúng tôi là những nhà làm phim, vì vậy "Những chú cá ở thiên đường" được thai nghén từ một ý tưởng phim, nhưng với những hình ảnh tưởng tượng siêu thực của nó, tôi muốn vẽ nó ra cho các bạn nhỏ được chiêm ngưỡng trước cái thiên đường này.

50% lãi của việc bán sách sẽ được quyên góp cho trẻ em ung thư và các hoạt động vì trẻ em ung thư.

Rất cám ơn mọi người đã ủng hộ cho dự án.

Giới thiệu:

Thể loại: sách tranh thiếu nhi

Số trang: 30 trang (luôn bìa)

Tác giả: Nguyễn Thị Xuân Trang

                Nguyễn Khắc Huy

Người vẽ: KLBC

Nội dung:

Ngày xửa ngày xưa, thế giới này đẹp lắm. Và đẹp nhất chính là hòn đảo Thiên Đường. Ở đó không tồn tại cái chết, tất cả sinh vật đều lớn lên và tái sinh. Nhưng rồi nhiều năm sau, con người vật lộn và huỷ hoại mình giữa thiên nhiên. Tất cả những đứa trẻ sinh ra đều mang mầm bệnh và đối diện với cái chết. Những đứa trẻ sống cô lập ở hòn đảo Vĩnh Biệt, chờ đến ngày mầm bệnh ấy huỷ hoại hoàn toàn sự sống của chúng.

Hòn đảo Thiên Đường bị lãng quên và chỉ còn là những câu chuyện kể thần tiên của ba Ly, Nhưng một cơn bão khiến ông ra đi mãi mãi, để lại tấm bản đồ mà Ly không tài nào lý giải được. Ly vẫn tin rằng, một ngày nào đó, khi cô có đủ kiến thức để giải mã tấm bảng đồ, cô nhất định sẽ tìm đường ra đảo và gặp lại ông.

Đến 1 ngày, khi trung tâm Vĩnh Biệt trở nên huyên náo vì một người mới đến- Minh, một cậu bé kỳ lạ luôn đội một chiếc mũ nhìn như “cái nồi cơm điện” to tổ chảng và theo đuôi là một con robot Koko thú vị, tinh tường thiên văn địa lý và nó có thể bay.

Một đêm vì quá nhớ nhà không ngủ được, Minh lẻn ra ngoài và nhìn thấy Ly đang đi ra phía sau núi. 
Minh thấy cô bé đang cố gắng xuống biển nhưng vô cùng sợ hãi. Minh âm thầm quan sát, càng nhìn cậu càng mến cô bé nghị lực và dũng cảm này. Minh suy nghĩ cách giúp Ly, nhưng rồi Ly bị hụt chân và té xuống nước. Ly hoảng loạn và bắt đầu chìm dần.

Sau khi tỉnh lại, Ly thấy mình tên một mỏm đá và bên cạnh là Minh và Koko. Ly biết Minh đã cứu mình nên đã chia sẻ cho Minh hiểu kế hoạch đi ra đảo Thiên Đường của cô và cho Minh xem tấm bản đồ mà ba Ly để lại. Vừa nhìn thấy tấm bảng đồ, bộ phận dò GPS của Koko không ngừng phát ra tín hiệu. Thì ra ba mẹ Minh, vốn là những kỹ sư vô cùng tài giỏi, đã tìm hiểu nhiều năm về hòn đảo Thiên Đường. Họ khoanh vùng phạm vi của hòn đảo nhưng trước khi họ tìm được chính xác vị trí thì một căn bệnh đã giết chết họ. Nên sau khi nhìn thấy tấm bản đồ, Koko lập tức gắn kết dữ liệu, hoàn thành từ khóa cuối cùng và xác định vị trí của hòn đảo. Đây là một phát hiện vĩ đại. Minh và Ly càng tin tưởng những gì bọn chúng nghe ba mẹ kể về hòn đảo Thiên Đường là hoàn toàn có thật. Chúng quyết định bắt tay cùng nhau tiến hành kế hoạch đến đảo Thiên Đường.

Và kể từ đây, chuyến đi kỳ thú của Minh và Ly bắt đầu. Chúng được những con cá chuồn mang đến cơn mưa kẹo để qua cơn đói, nhưng lại bị bầy cá mập uy hiếp, rồi lại lạc vào vùng biển màu hồng và khi đến được hòn đảo Thiên Đường cũng là lúc chiếc nón của Minh cạn năng lượng và Minh bắt đầu khó thở. Minh buông tay Ly ra và dần dần chìm xuống đáy biển sâu. Còn Ly thì nhìn quanh nhưng vẫn không thấy ba mình đâu...

BẠN CÓ MUỐN ĐẾN ĐẢO THIÊN ĐƯỜNG?

Những ai đã đọc nội dung của "Những chú cá ở thiên đường", và muốn nhìn thấy hình ảnh Đảo Thiên Đường, hãy ủng hộ chúng tôi:

  • Hãy là nhà tài trợ của chúng tôi (gói tài trợ cho truyện sẽ được đề cập cụ thể ở dưới)
  • Hãy là một trong những bạn độc đầu tiên của chúng tôi bằng cách đặc mua sách từ bây giờ
  • Hãy giúp chúng tôi truyền thông về truyện cho bạn bè bằng cách share thông tin này trên tường của bạn.

NHÀ TÀI TRỢ

Hãy trở thành nhà đầu tư để chúng tôi mang "những chú cá..." đến với các bạn độc giả.

Các gói tài trợ:

  • TÀI TRỢ VÀNG: 80,000,000 VND
    • Quyền lợi tài trợ vàng: Trở thành nhà đầu tư chính thức của bộ truyện với 10% cổ phần (không bao gồm quyền tác giả), và được chia phần lãi suất khi phát hành lần đầu tiên.
    • In logo nhà sản xuất trên bìa bộ truyện
    • Đến dự lễ ra mắt truyện với tư cách là nhà sản xuất
  • TÀI TRỢ BẠC: 40,000,000 VND
    • Quyền lợi tài trợ bạc: In logo nhà tài trợ bạc trên bìa bộ truyện
    • Đến dự lễ ra mắt truyện với tư cách là nhà tài trợ
    • Tặng 30 quyển khi phát hành
  • TÀI TRỢ ĐỒNG: 20,000,000 VND
    • Quyền lợi tài trợ đồng: đến dự lễ ra mắt truyện với tư cách là nhà tài trợ
    • In logo nhà tài trợ đồng trên bìa bộ truyện
    • Tặng 10 quyển khi phát hành

ĐẶT MUA SÁCH

Bạn có thể đặt mua sách từ bây giờ, bạn sẽ là những người đầu tiên có được truyện "Những chú cá ở thiên đường", cùng những quyền lợi kèm theo

  • Giảm 50% khi bạn đặt mua trước
  • Giảm tiếp 10% khi bạn đặt 10 cuốn
  • Tặng một vé đến dự buổi lễ ra mắt sách khi bạn mua trên 30 cuốn

XIN CHÂN THÀNH CÁM ƠN.
story_txt:
DỰ ÁN "NHỮNG CHÚ CÁ Ở THIÊN ĐƯỜNG"
Chúng tôi là những nhà làm phim, vì vậy "Những chú cá ở thiên đường" được thai nghén từ một ý tưởng phim, nhưng với những hình ảnh tưởng tượng siêu thực của nó, tôi muốn vẽ nó ra cho các bạn nhỏ được chiêm ngưỡng trước cái thiên đường này.
50% lãi của việc bán sách sẽ được quyên góp cho trẻ em ung thư và các hoạt động vì trẻ em ung thư.
Rất cám ơn mọi người đã ủng hộ cho dự án.
Giới thiệu:
Thể loại: sách tranh thiếu nhi
Số trang: 30 trang (luôn bìa)
Tác giả: Nguyễn Thị Xuân Trang

story:
The last thing we need is another healing program, right?

the Steps is not a prescriptive program.  It's a simple set of instructions designed to inspire intimate self-enquiry, create the possibility of taking full authority over one's life and as an expedient means to end suffering.  I am asking you to collaborate with us in publishing the Steps, a new paradigm in healing for our time as a beautiful, inspiring workbook designed by the incredible literary doula, Anja Aronska and illustrated by the young, respected Mexican silversmith and artist, Paul Rodriguez.


We need your help and have some lovely things to offer in exchange.

The purpose of the Steps campaign is to raise $17,500 to bring this most simple, yet profound healing program to the world by way of a beautifully designed and produced workbook.  The funds raised will go towards all aspects of producing, publishing and promoting the Steps Workbook.  All support is welcome and all supporters of the Steps project will receive untold benefit for having participated in bringing this incredible healing program to the world.  

We have some very encouraging perks, as you can see.  Here are a few more details about incredible opportunities to participate in this great collaboration and receive magical experiences in exchange for lending a hand:

for pledges of $1,008:

 A full week’s accommodation in one of the most sought-after properties in San Miguel de Allende ~ Suite Tallulah.  This fairy-tale hideaway is located in the heart of the village where dreams really do come true http://www.vrbo.com/327478  This is an opportunity to feel the magic of the town where ‘the Steps’ was born.  In addition, you receive a contributor credit in the 1st edition the Steps Workbook, a copy of the Steps Workbook, a 1-hour personal processing session by telephone or Skype and free admission to the Steps online classes beginning January 2014 (accommodation only, bus/airfare not included).

 (1 available)


 For pledges of $900:

Spend a week at Casa Dharma Retreat. Imagine yourself soaking up the healing energy of San Miguel Allende in a magical compound nestled in a canyon four blocks from the centre of town.  https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/450929  You will come to expect miracles as the days unfold at Casa Dharma.  In addition, you will receive a credit in the 1st edition the Steps Workbook, a copy of the Steps Workbook, a 1-hour personal processing session by telephone or Skype and free admission to the Steps online classes beginning January 2014 (accommodation only, bus/airfare not included).

 (2 available)


 for pledges of $348: 

One of five ‘nietas’ (granddaughter rocks). In the story of the Steps, I tell of the thread of rocks running through my life and how the association came full circle as I walked for nine days across the central high desert.  Later, a beautiful Maya shaman showed me that rocks are our little grandmothers (‘they’ve come to help us heal,’ he told me).  the Steps program is a direct result of my sitting meditation practice with a boulder named Grandmother Rock.  As I began to tune into the vibration of rocks my life began to take on a sense of grace and ease.  The nietas were collected in this sacred desert.  They are imbued with the power of awakening.  To hold one of these rocks in your hand is a beautiful experience and connects you to ancient wisdom.  Each nieta comes in its own custom-designed soft leather bag created by Talula de la Lune. http://on.fb.me/16NSI6r ~ the work of the very talented Maggie Donelan, whose own bodacious-woman-meets-the-magic-of-San Miguel story makes owning a piece of her leatherwork feel like a link to what’s possible. In addition, you will receive a contributor credit in the first edition the Steps Workbook, a copy of the Steps Workbook, a 1-hour personal processing session by telephone or Skype and free admission to the Steps online classes beginning January 2014.

 (6 available)



 The Impact

"the Steps is the greatest thing to hit the self-help industry for over 80 years."   As humanity evolves, we are shifting from victim consciousness to experiencing the fullness of who we truly are.  the Steps program is a new paradigm in healing for our time.  It creates the possibility of accelerating this great awakening one soul at a time.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you aren't able to send money, send love. Be kind to someone else. xox

If you aren't able to send money, send love. Be kind to someone else. xox

story:
Ok so here’s the deal…My name is Gina Tempesta, and I used to be a news and traffic radio reporter in the Boston market for many years. About six years ago, I was asked to do a community reading at one of my local elementary schools. Naturally, being a traffic reporter at the time, I thought it would be great to read a book about Boston’s historic Big Dig. But when I went to the library to find a children’s book about the Big Dig there was none to be found. That was when I decided to write one!

And that’s what I did! I spent the following two years researching everything I could about the massive construction project. But what I soon realized was that there was just too much information to write one book and decided to divide it up into a series.

So here I am, looking for funding to help me illustrate and publish the first book  - “Boston’s Other Green Monster: A Story about the Big Dig.”

I am currently looking to raise at least $5,000 to help me to complete the illustrations and pay for part of the printing costs. Any additional funding t will be put in to helping me pay for improving the BOGM website and to start the next book in the series, which will be about the Zakim Bridge. Even if I do not reach my goal, every penny of my fundraising will be put back into the book and the series.

I have spent the past three years reading the BOGM manuscript to elementary children and they are truly interested and inspired by the potential of this becoming a book. Your contribution will go a long way in helping me to bring this book to life for children across the state.

I am grateful for any contribution large or small. If you do contribute $40, you will be one of the first people to get a copy of the book once it is published this fall (eyes on November). For $50, you will get a signed copy of BOGM directly from me.  For $,1000, you or your organization will be considered a “sponsor” and will receive acknowledgement in the book. There are also two perks for $750,  for this, I will travel to a location of your choice with Red Sox’s mascot Wally the Green Monster to do a reading (dates TBD pending availability).

Even if you cannot help out with a monetary donation, please help get the word out through by mouth, social media and the indiegogo share tool!

This is a really exciting project that not only teaches kids about the history of the city, but so much more – civics, social studies, cooperation, pride…the list goes on! 

Thank you for your consideration.

story:
Ubuntu is a Zulu word, meaning one must know the "other" to know oneself. All our fates are tightly bound, whether the other is across the street or across the world. We belong to each other, therefore, we must know each other.

African narratives are reinforced in popular and academic cultures, portraying Africa as "The Dark Continent," a place of wildlife and horror. These limited narratives cannot tell the whole story of this rich and diverse continent.

With our latest book, Uniting a Continent, Tsehai Publishers continues to dispel the dark myths cast over Africa. This book is the first of its kind, as it showcases the founding of the Organization of African Unity (OAU) and exemplifies the rich and unique cultural heritage of each African nation. 

Releasing this book now is crucial, as May 25th marks the end of the 50th Anniversary of the OAU. As we move into the 51st year, we ask you to join us in solidifying this historic moment by helping us publish this book.

Embrace ubuntu, join us in our mission, and donate today!

My name is Elias Wondimu, and I founded Tsehai Publishers in 1998. As a political exile from Ethiopia, my life's mission is to advocate freedom of expression as well as to tell the untold stories of Africa through the publication of literature. At Tsehai Publishers, we give a voice to African writers who would otherwise be unheard. Through these voices, we seek to combat the decades of misinformation and media bias that have reinforced the dehumanization of African people.

Most people want to make the world a better place, and often times Africa becomes the focus of conversation. At Tsehai, we provide a different venue for change. Our mission is rooted in knowledge and empathy, only through true effort to educate can we go beyond popular narratives that show Africa as a helpless continent solely riddled with poverty. We ask you to support literature like this in order to change the dialogue from "Dark Africa" to an empowered and unified Africa. 

Uniting a Continent is a beautifully illustrated, first-of-its-kind historical book that profiles the past and present of the Organization of African Unity. We believe this book contributes to the telling of a necessary story, for we cannot understand and plan for Africa's future unless we appreciate the challenges and triumphs of the continent. 

The book's modern layout and engaging facts will appeal to a broad audience. Both children and adults will be able to pick up the book and learn new information that is difficult to find anywhere else. 

Content:

  • History of the Organization:  An overview of the OAU's history, which chronicles the lead up to its formation, to its inception, and to its successes in the last fifty years. This section includes historic speeches made at the organization's inception, the founding charter of the OAU, and a timeline of significant milestones during the organization's history.


  • Profiles of the OAU Leaders:  A compilation of celebratory biographies of the founding fathers of the OAU. The biographies are accompanied by beautiful illustrated portraits by commissioned artists.

Some of the founding fathers featured in this book:

  • Profiles of Secretaries General:  Biographies of the secretaries general who served the OAU/AU in the last five decades, which also include beautifully illustrated portraits.


  • Historic Photographs:  A collection of photographs that capture the enthusiasm, passion, purpose, and action of a generation that came together to unite a continent.


  • OAU Member Country Profiles: Encyclopedic profiles of the member countries of the OAU/AU. Each profile depicts the country's map, flag, emblem, brief geographical information, and interesting facts about the country. It also presents the dates of independence, the dates the country joined the OAU/AU, and the names of the current head of state and head of government.


In order to publish Uniting a Continent, we need your help in raising $30,000! This money will allow us to publish and market 1,000 copies. Thanks to our dedicated team at Tsehai Publishers, the book is ready to print, but without proper funds we will not be able to execute our mission. 

In exchange for your help in sowing the seeds of change and illuminating the myth of "Dark Africa," we have some exciting perks to thank you for your support.

We are indebted to every individual who helps raise awareness for Uniting a Continent. Whether through word-of-mouth, print-awareness, or pledge, we ask that you’ll take the time to help us take another step towards a more empathetic world. Share the Indiegogo link on social media sites and tell your family and friends about us!


Join the conversation:

Facebook:  www.facebook.com/tsehai.publishers

Instagram:  @tsehai_publishers

Twitter: @tsehai 

Tumblr: www.tsehaipublishers.tumblr.com


Visit our official website: www.tsehaipublishers.com

story:
Hey Friends, just a quick update....if anyone has anything they need or want to advertise, IN PRINT, I can help you out.  I am in the process of producing a publication that is full color pages front to back and I would love to include you in it.  Our prices are reasonable and I will do my best to work with your advertising budget.  This might be a great opportunity for my skinny fiber distributors, website owners, internet marketers, MLM owners, and anyone in the PA area, of course.  It will primarily be distributed in Bucks county PA, which will give your business an entirely new market.  We have over 56000 potential clients that will read and touch your businesses name and advertisement.  GRAB THIS OPPORTUNITY to advertise YOUR business In-Print....and see what our Journal can do for you!  Send me a PM with your email address and I can get you more information!  Take care and Have a great day


We are building a new publication in Pennsylvania.  Don't miss the chance to keep print alive and make my business dream publication a reality!  Thanks for your consideration :)

NEW SOUTHEASTERN PENNSYLVANIA PUBLICATION

​The PA Police, Fire, and Rescue Journal is a free publication delivered to all local stations across Southeastern Pennsylvania.  This is a perfect opportunity to advertise your business to people that not only work and live, but are also consumers in your area.  Our publication features a combination of local and national stories highlighting the heroic efforts of service men and women.  Along with coupons, recipes, upcoming events, and advertising from local businesses.  Our publication reaches over 56,000 local readers that are potential customers.  The best part is you will not be competing with hundreds of other companies.  This publication is designed for and centers around the southeastern Pennsylvania area.  We are dedicated to keeping our community together and keeping business local.  This publication will serve as a catalyst to accomplish those goals.

BENEFITS IN ADVERTISING:

  • Little or No Ad Competition.
  • FREE Ad Link on our site.
  • FREE distribution of your marketing items with publications
  • Targeted Market. 
  • Personal Project Manager. 
  • Certificate of Participation. 

Our team will guide you to getting the most for your contribution.  By adding a coupon or offering a special discount for any police, fire, or rescue personnel,  your business says, I support our local service men and woman. Our marketing team of seasoned professionals have over 25 years experience in sales & marketing.  Our team continues to successfully promote local companies and promoting your business will be no exception .  Our publication will serve as a reminder that together we can keep business local.  No matter what size advertisement you desire, you will be issued a certificate of participation, to display at your location.  Displaying this certificate will ensure that the community knows you offer a special discount to police, fire, and rescue professionals in our area.  Let us help you bring in new business and re-introduce you to the community.  The new issue will be closing soon, so grab this chance to ensure your business is featured in this publication!


CASH/CHECK/OR CREDIT CARDS ALSO ACCEPTED IN PERSON, PLEASE CONTACT FOR THIS OPTION!

story:
Thank you for considering my campaign page. My name is Melvin Hardin, and I am an English major, creative writer and aspiring novelist. From an early age, I have been mesmerized by the power of words. Manipulating words and breathing life on sentences have always been my first love. From my early years, I've learned that writing is therapeutic and a vehicle to transform hidden pains into visual healing. 

This campaign will allow me to expose my product to a larger audience while bringing awareness and rich thinking to areas where hope and healing is needed.  Each contributor will bring me one step closer to reaching my goal, the big screen.   

The purpose for your contribution will help with marketing, printing, graphic design, website and trailer setup.

For those who are unable to contribute financially can also make a difference by spreading the word via email, Facebook, twitter, Instagram and other social media sites.

story:
OVERVIEW OF BOOK PROJECT ~ 

The inspiration for this project literally appeared on my doorstep January 10th, 2012 when a small, dirty and shivering homeless dog found my apartment building and then quickly found my heart. 

Finding Home: The Story of Scrappy is a full color, hardback storybook including both real photographs and professional illustrations featuring the life of a homeless dog named Scrappy. 

Your backing will publish and print the book!  

Story and Photographs by Christy Thomas ~ Graphic Design and Illustrations by Micah Cerelli

The story is told from Scrappy's perspective and details his journey as a homeless dog who finds a loving home, transitions into a family, has tons of fun adventures with his dog "siblings", and then discovers his purpose in life ~ helping homeless children. 

Sample page from the book

The story line is meaningful and challenging to adults and yet simple enough for children to enjoy. And it is TRUE (with some creative liberties assumed when describing Scrappy's thoughts and feelings, of course).  

Sample page from the book

Backers pledging $50 or more will also be helping to fund additional copies of the book which will be GIVEN away to children experiencing homelessness! (See perks for details)  

Scrappy goes to work! 

Sample page from the book

The story is both entertaining and purposeful. 

I desire for the book to be used as a healing tool for children who have personally experienced life in a homeless shelter, the lack of a family, or transitions in foster care/adoption.  Reflection questions are provided at the end of the book for parents, teachers, social workers or counselors to spark discussion with children about the story and how it may relate to their lives. 

Several meaningful themes are woven into the story including family, grief/loss, change/transition, homelessness, love, adventure, and giving back by making a positive difference in your community!

Read all about Scrappy's adventures!

Sample page from the book

Your pledge will reserve you a first edition copy of the book!

Our goal is to have the book published, printed, and ready to hand out by late Fall 2013 ~ in time for Christmas gifts!  Please know that your contribution will make a significant difference in helping this project succeed and positively impact the lives of homeless families!  Plus, I believe readers of all ages and walks of life will really enjoy the story! Thank you! 

Scrappy and his siblings ~ Nika and Duffy!

Behind the Project ~ 

In January 2012 my husband and I saw a small dog living outside in the middle of winter.  We caught him and nursed him back to health. Over the following year we saw him slowly transform from an extremely shy, skittish dog into an energetic and cuddly member of the family. He has brought us endless joy. We named him Scrappy because that first night he was so dirty the name just seemed to fit. Scrappy started going to work with me every day. I am the Lead Social Worker with a non-profit organization in Boise, Idaho which provides housing and holistic services for homeless families with children.  www.catchprogram.org

Scrappy became quite a hit with the homeless children our program serves.  At the office they looked for him to hug, give treats and play with.  I often used Scrappy to build a bridge with children who were hard to connect with or were having a tough day.  He brought an immediate comfort and smile to their face. 

Scrappy brings great joy to kids at the CATCH, Inc. office!

I watched many parallels emerge as I observed Scrappy’s transition from the streets to our home and as the homeless children I worked with moved from community shelters to their own home.  I realized Scrappy’s story would make a creative book that could relate with and encourage the families I work with and beyond. So, I started writing...

Fortunately, I have a love for photography and an obsession with taking pictures of my dogs.  I had pictures of Scrappy from day 1...and most days following.  Thus, the book is a unique, colorful, and artistic combination of photographs and illustrations.  

The graphic designing and illustrations are skillfully done by Micah Cerelli.  Check out her work at www.micahsdesign.com 

 

If you love dogs, true stories, and positive messages then this book is for YOU!

DOG HOUSE IS SOLD! THANK YOU!!!! 

Built by local Idaho builder Scott Patton! Fits dog up to 20lbs.
