story:
*NOTE: For those selecting a perk, please note that for some perks we are requesting a donation for shipping costs as well. Please add this additional amount to your total donation when you enter your contribution. Much love and many thanks! - Michael & Jessica

 

Who We Are

Jessica and I (Michael Sandler) met at a meditation center after I looked up and said, “Oh, there she is!” Though I’d never met or seen her before, I knew I’d marry her. Until recently, we've never been apart.

Since that time we’ve started our own company, written best-selling books, and even produced a how-to movie. We’ve traveled the world working to help others, sharing our love and experiences along the way. Everything we’ve done has been about helping others to heal, overcome life's challenges, and find greater peace, happiness and joy. 

 

We've been seen on: 

 

                                                     

 

What Happened?

On May 19th of this year, I was injured in an accident that nearly took my life. I slipped in leather moccasins in a mountain creek, falling and landing hard on a pyramid shaped rock. My femur exploded on impact, with bones cutting through muscles, veins, ligaments and tendons. Miraculously it missed my femoral artery, but stuck in a freezing cold creek, I couldn’t breath and began to blackout.

As everything faded out, I could have easily closed my eyes and died there on the trail. But I looked over at Jessica, saw the look of fear and terror on her face, felt her heartache and KNEW I couldn’t die.

And so I began FORCING myself to breathe. For two hours before being helicoptered out, I focused on my breath, bringing in sunlight, and breathing out love. These two things were the most powerful, soothing feelings and ideas I could think of, and they helped me get through.

Though it was an incredibly scary time for both of us, it was also magical and transformational. Sitting next to a spouse who might die was life changing for Jessica. And for myself, stuck in the creek and focusing on my breath, my intuition instantly expanded. I began to get downloads of information that came in instantaneous packets, or what felt like little sparkles or glitters of information. Now each time I sit at my desk to write, one of those sparkles opens up into an entirely new concept, idea, or teaching I'd never thought of before.  

 

Why the Accident was a Gift

Even in the creek, we never said “poor me”, or “poor us”, or “why did this happen to me?” Instead, we accepted it as a gift, and a turning point in our lives. We knew we were shifting gears from teaching about the more physical side of life, to teaching the lessons we were now learning about the more spiritual side of life and how we can each overcome any challenges if only we believe.

 

The Book We Had to Write

So that’s what our book is about. Breathe Love shares the story of the accident, the pivotal events that led up to it, our healing journey and where it takes us. And it shares the lessons we’ve been learning; lessons we were ignoring before the accident, and new ones we gained there on the trail, each of which have been branded into our souls.

 

Two Loving Perspectives

 

We feel we have to write this book, to share the love, gratitude, and healing power we found out there on the trail…and to share it from a couple’s point of view. Ultimately, I wouldn’t be here if it wasn’t for Jessica’s love and help to keep me alive and keep me going. This book is from both of our perspectives, mine, going through the physical pain and coming out the other side, and Jessica's, who's pain is more emotional, and more challenging in many ways. It’s a challenge for her to make the time to rest or step back, she always has to be there for me, a tireless job from the minute I slipped.

 

What’s in It for You?

This book will fill you with hope and inspiration, and help you to overcome any challenges you may have in life, whether that's physical, emotional, relational, financial, or spiritual. The lessons we’ve learned will lift your spirit and speak to your soul. For instance, we've learned that life's greatest challenges are opportunities for the miracles, miracles that are happening around us all of the time. In our case, getting injured was the best thing that ever happened to us. It helped us heal serious challenges and communication issues in our relationship, creating a new closeness and a much greater bond.

How precious and fragile and important life is, and how we must cherish each moment because we truly don't know how long we have here.

 

What is the Money for?

Production and marketing of this very special book.

 

Book Production, Marketing & Publicity Costs:

Based on our Barefoot Running book which became a Best Seller:

 

1.     Editing:  $9000

2.     Layout:  $6500

3.     Cover Photo/Graphic Design:  $1000

4.     E-book Conversion:  $1000

5.     Printing Hardcover (limited edition):  $5500 (200 books)

6.     Printing Softcover:  $13000 (5000 books)

7.     Marketing: $6,000

8.     Publicity:  $8,000

9.     Laptop:  $2000

 

Total Book Production Cost and Goal: $54,000

 

What if we get extra money?

If we get additional funds, our first priority is assistance for Michael to help him recover faster and eliminate pain.

 

We can do it! - Our track record

 

Our goal is to turn this into another Indie Best-Seller, and then to take it mainstream. That means we need to sell between 5000 and 10,000 books on our own.

 

However, this isn't the first time we've set this goal and achieved it too. Jessica and I are known for “making the impossible possible”.  For instance, though some of our trusted advisors told us we didn’t stand a chance, our first book defied the odds and became an indie-best-seller, before going on to become the #1 exercise and fitness book on Kindle out of all books, worldwide! We then got picked up in a two-book deal with Random House.

  

A Bit More About Us

                   

Jessica and I are the best-selling authors of Barefoot Running and Barefoot Walking, and producers of the DVD/Movie: Barefoot Running. We’ve toured extensively and spoken before thousands throughout the entire US, Canada, plus Asia. We’ve been featured on dozens of TV shows, in magazines such as Shape and Men’s Health, and on radio shows such as NPR’s The Story, by Dick Gordon, and the Martha Stewart Living show.

 

With Much Love and Gratitude

  

Thank you for helping us share this with the world. Thank you for helping us inspire and heal countless others, and to help everyone open up there hearts more, in order that they may overcome life’s greatest challenges and discover more joy, more happiness, and more peace.

This “accident” like so many of the challenges we all face, was really a “gift” in disguise”.

You can do anything in life and overcome almost any challenge, if only you believe!

Thank you so much for your support!!!

Special Thanks

Special thanks to Gina for filming the footage at the accident scene, to Shaun Simmons for the use of his love-filled music, "Learning to Fly" and Barefoot Truth for "Dancing in the Trees".

 

FAQ

1. How do we pay for shipping for physical perks such as books & t-shirts?

Under the perk description, there is information on how much to add for domestic and international shipping. Once you select a perk, please add the additional cost of shipping to the amount you would like to contribute. There is no free shipping; however, all shipping is automatically upgraded to USPS Priority shipping. 

2. Does Michael have weak bones?

No, when we asked the orthopedic surgeons this same question after surgery, they chuckled and said absolutely not. Michael has a healthy bone density.
story_txt:
*NOTE: For those selecting a perk, please note that for some perks we are requesting a donation for shipping costs as well. Please add this additional amount to your total donation when you enter your contribution. Much love and many thanks! - Michael & Jessica
 
Who We Are
Jessica and I (Michael Sandler) met at a meditation center after I looked up and said, “Oh, there she is!” Though I’d never met or seen her before, I knew I’d marry her. Until recently, we've never been apart.
Since that time we’ve started our own company, written best-selling books, and even produced a how-to movie. We’ve traveled the world working to help others, sharing our love and experiences along the way. Everything we’ve done has been about helping others to heal, overcome life's challenges, and find greater peace, happiness and joy. 
 
We've been seen on: 
 
                                                     
 
What Happened?
On May 19th of this year, I was injured in an accident that nearly took my life. I slipped in leather moccasins in a mountain creek, falling and landing hard on a pyramid shaped rock. My femur exploded on impact, with bones cutting through muscles, veins, ligaments and tendons. Miraculously it missed my femoral artery, but stuck in a freezing cold creek, I couldn’t breath and began to blackout.
As everything faded out, I could have easily closed my eyes and died there on the trail. But I looked over at Jessica, saw the look of fear and terror on her face, felt her heartache and KNEW I couldn’t die.
And so I began FORCING myself to breathe. For two hours before being helicoptered out, I focused on my breath, bringing in sunlight, and breathing out love. These two things were the most powerful, soothing feelings and ideas I could think of, and they helped me get through.
Though it was an incredibly scary time for both of us, it was also magical and transformational. Sitting next to a spouse who might die was life changing for Jessica. And for myself, stuck in the creek and focusing on my breath, my intuition instantly expanded. I began to get downloads of information that came in instantaneous packets, or what felt like little sparkles or glitters of information. Now each time I sit at my desk to write, one of those sparkles opens up into an entirely new concept, idea, or teaching I'd never thought of before.  
 
Why the Accident was a Gift 

Even in the creek, we never said “poor me”, or “poor us”, or “why did this happen to me?” Instead, we accepted it as a gift, and a turning point in our lives. We knew we were shifting gears from teaching about the more physical side of life, to teaching the lessons we were now learning about the more spiritual side of life and how we can each overcome any challenges if only we believe.

Ultimately, I wouldn’t be here if it wasn’t for Jessica’s love and help to keep me alive and keep me going. This book is from both of our perspectives, mine, going through the physical pain and coming out the other side, and Jessica's, who's pain is more emotional, and more challenging in many ways. It’s a challenge for her to make the time to rest or step back, she always has to be there for me, a tireless job from the minute I slipped.
 
What’s in It for You?
This book will fill you with hope and inspiration, and help you to overcome any challenges you may have in life, whether that's physical, emotional, relational, financial, or spiritual. The lessons we’ve learned will lift your spirit and speak to your soul. For instance, we've learned that life's greatest challenges are opportunities for the miracles, miracles that are happening around us all of the time. In our case, getting injured was the best thing that ever happened to us. It helped us heal serious challenges and communication issues in our relationship, creating a new closeness and a much greater bond.
How precious and fragile and important life is, and how we must cherish each moment because we truly don't know how long we have here.

5.     Printing Hardcover (limited edition):  $5500 (200 books)

Total Book Production Cost and Goal: $54,000

story:
Mycology: The study of fungal biology

Radical Mycology: The theory and practice of using mushrooms and other fungi to create positive personal, societal, and ecological change.

Peter McCoy is a co-founder of the Radical Mycology project and co-organizer of the Radical Mycology Convergences. He has been studying mycology (the science of fungi) for over 12 years and is currently pursuing a dual degree in Media and Mycology at the Evergreen State College in Olympia, WA. He is a cultivation and remediation instructor, community organizer, illustrator, author, street medic, zinester, and lover of the great outdoors.

Peter has written and produced several publications and videos on mycology, mushroom cultivation and mycoremediation. When he is not teaching cultivation courses in Olympia and abroad, Peter spends much of his time writing, making art, and coordinating a volunteer mushroom cultivation group in Olympia, WA that provides free mushroom gardens and installations to the Olympia community to teach about the benefits of fungi as food, medicine, and remediators.


Radical Mycology is a movement and social philosophy based on accessibly teaching the importance of mushrooms and other fungi for personal, societal, and ecological health. Radical Mycology differs from classical mycology in that classical mycology generally focuses on taxonomy, identification, mycophagy (eating mushrooms), and the more personal benefits of working with fungi while Radical Mycology is about using fungi for the benefit of larger communities and the world.

As a concept, Radical Mycology is based on the belief that the lifecycles of fungi and their interactions in nature serve as powerful learning tools for how humans can better relate to each other and steward the world they live in.

As an organization, the Radical Mycology project organizes the Radical Mycology Convergences (see below) and disseminates free literature and other media on the uses of fungi for food sovereignty, medicine creation, ecological restoration, mycopermaculture, community building, and creating resilient/sustainable lifestyles. The Radical Mycology project started in 2006.

To learn more about the Radical Mycology, visit the project's website here.
To read the Radical Mycology project's mission statement and goals, click here.

The Radical Mycology project began as an idea between two friends (Maya and Peter) 7 years ago when they met while working on volunteer projects related to ecological and social justice. Weaving the seemingly unrelated fields of mycology, environmental justice, systems theory, and social organizing together, the concept of Radical Mycology was born. Realizing that the importance of fungal ecology was missing from many environmental justice dialogues, the two developed a novel perspective on applied science. On all levels, it seemed, the fungi exemplified many successful and sustainable models that human activity can actively learn from.

In time, Peter wrote a zine (or booklet/pamphlet) entitled Radical Mycology that encapsulated their ideas. The zine quickly became quite popular and the positive feedback it received eventually inspired Maya and Peter to organize the first, second, and upcoming third Radical Mycology Convergences (RMCs). Modeled after the networked and collaborative structure of mushroom mycelium, the RMCs are donation-based events that teach the skills of low-cost mushroom cultivation and bioremediation while building a supportive community of like-minded mushroom enthusiasts and environmental justice supporters.

The two also run the website radicalmycology.com, where free resources and literature are provided to both educate the world on the benefits of fungi but to also foster a community of passionate mycophiles around the globe. There you can also find the new free Radical Mycology publication, Mushroom Cultivation for Remediation, and its associated 3-part instructional video.


To download and read the Radical Mycology zine for free, click here.
To download and read Radical Mycology's Mushroom Cultivation for Remediation zine for free, click here.
To learn more about the Radical Mycology Convergences, click here.

This Indiegogo campaign will fund the next big step in the Radical Mycology project: funding the production of a book on the theory, practice, and applications of using mushrooms and other fungi to create positive personal, social, and ecological change. This book will be similar in design and flow to the Radical Mycology zine, but the toolbox of mycological skills and philosophical insights it will provide will be of much greater breadth and depth for those seeking to use fungi to make the world a better place.

The book will be visually compelling while serving as an educational resource guide at times and a philosophical call to embrace the fungi as allies at other times.

The Radical Mycology Book will not only include step-by-step instructions for mushrooms cultivation and applications in everyday life but will also be a resource for creating a paradigm shift in the western culture's understanding of the fungal kingdom. The book will provide an entertaining and educational view into the mysterious, dense, and uncommon world of mushrooms and mycology, all explained by using accessible language, photographs, illustrations, and vivid metaphors.

Highlighted sections in the book include:

  • Practical mushroom cultivation with ways to make your own tools and equipment, alternative & low-tech techniques, and using high tech methods on a small budget.
  • Applications of fungi for perpetual food systems, permaculture, and land stewardship.
  • The theory and practice of mycoremediation including step-by-step guides to training a mushroom to digest a given pollutant, disaster protocols, and an explanation of the chemistry involved in the process.
  • Mycomanifestos and essays on the necessity of a Radical Mycology global movement.
  • The relationship between mycology, community organizing, systems theory, mutual aid, and ecological and social justice work.
  • How to start and run a successful community mushroom growing lab or group.
  • The art of guerrilla mushrooming and the ethics of habitat rehabilitation.
  • The history of entheogenic or psychedelic fungi in the formation of ancient and modern cultures and their modern importance for nourishing and enlightening the spirits of people today.
  • Lichenology & the role of lichens as medicine, dyes, and indicators of air quality.
  • Perpetuating fermented food cultures such as tempeh, miso, and Roquefort cheese.
  • Cultivating mycorrhizal fungi to build soil, support plant life, and reduce fertilizer consumption.
  • Biochar production and integration into fungal cultivation.
  • Mycorrhizal cultivation and application for food and forest plant health.
  • Age appropriate mycology lessons and projects for children.
  • Medicinal mushroom processing.
  • Ethnomycology and the utilitarian uses of fungi.
  • Field guides to common and uncommon fungi.
  • Hunting endangered mushrooms & lichens for forest protection.
  • Using DIY biohacker tools for advanced mycological work.
  • Edible mushroom recipes
  • Insights into the modern subculture of mycogeeks and freaks.
  • Fungal biology & ecology.
  • Mushroomy jokes.
  • Two mushrooms inspired games: a field game and a tabletop role playing game, designed by Jackson Tegu.
  • Original art, charts, and diagrams.
  • Much more!
The book is estimated to be at least 400 pages once complete but may very well exceed that goal. It is projected to be finished and published by the summer of 2014. The book will be paperback and mainly black and white, with a color plate center section. Contributors will receive regular updates on the progress of the book as it develops.

The $18,000 goal set for this campaign will not only fund the book's printing & distribution, it will also fund a Radical Mycology tour in North America for late 2014 when the book comes out. Once the book is published, a percentage of the profits from the book will go toward a fund to support independent remediation research and installation projects around the world.

The $18,000 goal for this book is broken down into three main categories:

Overhead
  • Indiegogo's cut + IRS taxes: $4,000
  • Creating and shipping campaign non-book perks: estimated at $1,000
  • Stipend - Peter will be working full time on the book for 6-9 months. This stipend will help cover his modest living expenses during that time: $3,000
Publishing
  • Cooperative Publishing Company formation and legal organization: $1,000
  • Developmental and Copy editing: $1,000
  • Printing (depending on demand and ultimate book length): estimated at $2,500
  • ISBN Securement: $500
Marketing & Distribution
  • Online and Print promotion (pre and post campaign): $1,000
  • A 2-3 month road show of the US and Canada in the summer of 2014 to talk about the book, hold workshops (with RM contributors and affiliated colleagues), and build a Radical Mycology community. This will include gas and other transportation fees, food, promotion, and venue rental fees. We will be relying on friends, associates, and fellow mycophiles to host us along the way to help cut costs. This will likely take up the remaining money.
  • E-Book Conversion: $250
  • Warehousing and distribution: $1,000

If we surpass our $18,000 minimum goal we have the following stretch goals to make this project even more awesome and to extend the Radical Mycology values and build community around the world:

All of the Radical Mycology tour will be documented and will become part of a Radical Mycology documentary as a part of a future crowdfunding campaign.

Anything beyond these goals will fund the translation of the Radical Mycology Book into other languages.

All donors will receive regular updates on the progress of the book. These emails will include links to interesting articles and resources on the books topics, video updates and how-to's from the author, and sneak previews of the book's art and designs.

The perks listed on the side bar describe what the different donation tiers will receive. Of special note are the following items:

A mushroom cultivation beginner pack - This cultivation starter kit will include the following items to begin applying the cultivation skills found in the Radical Mycology book:

  • Blank petri dish (1)
  • 60mL syringe and 16ga needle (1 each)
  • Mushroom spawn grow bags (5)
  • Airport injection lids (2)
  • Falcon test tubes (5)
  • Parafilm strip (5)

Mushroom species uses and cultivation requirements reference chart - A cross reference poster listing over 30 fungal species, their cultivation requirements, cooking/preserving tips, medicinal value, uses in the garden, uses for rehabilitating damaged environments, and more.

Mushroom cultivation course - This course is the same that Peter has taught multiple times in the US and Canada, typically for $200 per person. Covering the theory, practice, and applications of mushroom cultivation this course covers many of the topics included in the Radical Mycology book in a hands-on approach. Donors will be able to invite up to 29 other people to join the course. However, if donors choose to charge for it, they will not be permitted to charge more than $200 per person (this is to keep this information relatively cheap and accessible for those that need it). Backers will be responsible for promotion of the course and venue rental. These courses will be scheduled to take place during the Radical Mycology road show during the summer of 2014. Subject matter and myco-installations done during the courses can be custom tailored to donor needs.

This book is also unique in its approach to mycology. This book emphasizes the simplest, cheapest, and more appropriate and practical applications of mycology to many aspects of daily life, both for individuals and larger communities.

This book will explore fungi of all types, from symbiotic mycorrhizal and endophtic species, to molds that ferment foods, to lichens, to the familiar 3-D fruitbodies we call mushrooms. As the topic list above shows, the book will also show the many practical and useful ways that fungi can be used in everyday life. This book will provide the means to make these skills accessible to all. The Radical Mycology book will be filled with illustrations and graphics to best depict abstract concepts and challenging skills thus providing a visual language for developing a grassroots mycological community.

We believe that this book will provide a one-stop resource for diving into the world of mycology and we think the Radical Mycology project is in a special place to produce such a book due to the resources we have available to us.

Over the years, the Radical Mycology project has built a rather large network of expert mycologists and advisers along with a supportive community of like-minded mushroom lovers and environmental justice advocates. In writing this book, we will not only provide our perspectives as the founders of the Radical Mycology project but also include the ideas and insights of those who have allied with us along the way. We do not see this idea as ours, but something that should and will inevitably grow of its own. Radical Mycology is not just about pushing one perspective, it is about creating a paradigm shift in the relationship most people (at least in the West) have with fungi from one of fear and misunderstanding to one of appreciation, respect, and allyship.

Beyond contributing to this campaign financially, there are several great ways you can help promote this project to your friends and networks:

Social (Mycelial) Networking:
Please link and share this project on any social networks you are on!

Here is a short link to this campaign for easy linking:
http://igg.me/at/radmyco

"Like" Radical Mycology on Facebook:

Share this campaign on Facebook:

Or Tweet about the campaign:


Blogs, Podcasts, & Newsletters:
Write about Radical Mycology, the Radical Mycology Convergence, or this Indiegogo campaign on your blog or in your newsletter. Peter would be happy to do an interview or contribute content to help make this happen. Please contact him through Indiegogo to set up an interview.

Several perks have additional shipping costs for backers outside the US. These rates were based on the average costs of shipping to several countries. Canadian rates are slightly less.


CAMPAIGN PRESS:

Vice's Motherboard

The Permaculture Podcast

Punk Rock Permaculture

Entheoradio

Two mushrooms inspired games: a field game and a tabletop role playing game, designed by Jackson Tegu.
Original art, charts, and diagrams.
Much more!

The

 book is estimated to be at least 400 pages once complete but may very 
well exceed that goal. It is projected to be finished and published by 
the summer of 2014. The book will be paperback and mainly 
black and white, with a color plate center section. Contributors will 
receive regular 
updates on the progress of the book as it develops.The $18,000 goal set for this 
campaign will not only fund the book's printing & distribution, it will also fund a Radical Mycology tour
 in North America for late 2014 when the book comes out. Once the book is published, a percentage of 
the profits from the book will go toward a fund to support independent
remediation research and installation projects around the world.The $18,000 goal for this book is broken down into three main categories:Overhead
Indiegogo's cut + IRS taxes: $4,000
Creating and shipping campaign non-book perks: estimated at $1,000
Stipend - Peter will be working full time on the book for 6-9 months. This stipend will help cover his modest living expenses during that time: $3,000


Publishing
Cooperative Publishing Company formation and legal organization: $1,000
Developmental and Copy editing: $1,000
Printing (depending on demand and ultimate book length): estimated at $2,500
ISBN Securement: $500


Marketing & Distribution
Online and Print promotion (pre and post campaign): $1,000

A
 2-3 month road show of the US and Canada in the summer of 2014 to talk about the book, hold workshops (with RM contributors and affiliated colleagues), and build a Radical Mycology community. This 
will include gas and other transportation fees, food, promotion, and 
venue rental fees. We will be relying on friends, associates, and fellow
 mycophiles to host us along the way to help cut costs. This will likely
 take up the remaining money. 
E-Book Conversion: $250

Warehousing and distribution: $1,000



If we surpass our $18,000 minimum goal we have the following stretch goals to make this project even more awesome and to extend the Radical Mycology values and build community around the world:
All
 of the Radical Mycology tour will be documented and will become part of
 a Radical Mycology documentary as a part of a future crowdfunding 
campaign.Anything beyond these goals will fund the translation of the Radical Mycology Book into other languages.
All donors will receive regular updates on the progress of the book. These emails will include links to interesting articles and resources on the books topics, video updates and how-to's from the author, and sneak previews of the book's art and designs.
The perks listed on the side bar describe what the different donation tiers will receive. Of special note are the following items:
A mushroom cultivation beginner pack - This cultivation starter kit will include the following items to begin applying the cultivation skills found in the Radical Mycology book:
Blank petri dish (1)

60mL syringe and 16ga needle (1 each)

Mushroom spawn grow bags (5)

Airport injection lids (2)

Falcon test tubes (5)

Parafilm strip (5)


 Mushroom species uses and cultivation requirements reference chart - A cross reference poster listing over 30 fungal species, their cultivation requirements, cooking/preserving tips, medicinal value, uses in the garden, uses for rehabilitating damaged environments, and more.
Mushroom cultivation course - This course is the same that Peter has taught multiple times in the US and Canada, typically for $200 per person. Covering the theory, practice, and applications of mushroom cultivation this course covers many of the topics included in the Radical Mycology book in a hands-on approach. Donors will be able to invite up to 29 other people to join the course. However, if donors choose to charge for it, they will not be permitted to charge more than $200 per person (this is to keep this information relatively cheap and accessible for those that need it). Backers will be responsible for promotion of the course and venue rental. These courses will be scheduled to take place during the Radical Mycology road show during the summer of 2014. Subject matter and myco-installations done during the courses can be custom tailored to donor needs.
This book is also unique in its approach
 to mycology. This book emphasizes the simplest, cheapest, and more 
appropriate and practical applications of mycology to many aspects of 
daily life, both for individuals and larger communities. This book will explore fungi of all types, from symbiotic mycorrhizal and endophtic species, to molds that ferment foods, to lichens, to the familiar 3-D fruitbodies we call mushrooms. As the topic list above shows, the book will also show the many practical and useful ways that fungi can be used in everyday life. This book will provide the means to make these skills accessible to all. The Radical Mycology book will be filled with illustrations and 
graphics to best depict abstract concepts and challenging skills thus 
providing a visual language for developing a grassroots mycological 
community.We believe that this book will provide a one-stop resource 
for diving into the world of mycology and we think the Radical Mycology
 project is in a 
special place to produce such a book due to the resources we have 
available to us. Over the years, the Radical Mycology project 
has built a rather large network of expert mycologists and advisers 
along with a supportive community of like-minded mushroom lovers and 
environmental justice advocates. In writing this book, we will not only 
provide our perspectives as the founders of the Radical Mycology project but also include 
the ideas and insights of those who have allied with us along the way. We do
 not see this idea as ours, but something that should and will 
inevitably grow of its own. Radical Mycology is not just about pushing one perspective, it is 
about creating a paradigm shift in the relationship most people (at 
least in the West) have with fungi from one of fear and misunderstanding to 
one of appreciation, respect, and allyship.
Beyond contributing to this campaign financially, there are several great
 ways you can help promote this project to your friends and networks:Social (Mycelial) Networking:Please link and share this project on any social networks you are on!Here is a short link to this campaign for easy linking:http://igg.me/at/radmyco"Like" Radical Mycology on Facebook:
Share this campaign on Facebook:Or Tweet about the campaign:Blogs, Podcasts, & Newsletters:Write
 about Radical Mycology, the Radical Mycology Convergence, or this 
Indiegogo campaign on your blog or in your newsletter. Peter would be happy to do 
an interview or contribute content to help make this happen. Please 
contact him through Indiegogo to set up an interview.

Several perks have additional shipping costs for backers outside the US. These rates were based on the average costs of shipping to several countries. Canadian rates are slightly less.
CAMPAIGN PRESS:
Vice's MotherboardThe Permaculture Podcast
Punk Rock PermacultureEntheoradio

story:
BONJOUR

Je m'appelle Laetitia, j'ai 29 ans et je suis passionnée par la psychologie et l'humain. J'ai pour but de créer des ateliers de développement personnel par le biais de la PNL : aider les gens à avoir un regard plus positif sur la vie, les aider à atteindre leurs objectifs et à trouver les clés qui les rendront heureux. Cela me tient très à coeur c'est un rêve pour moi de pouvoir organiser ces ateliers, je sens que je suis faite pour ça, il n'y a que ça qui me passionne.

Une fois ma formation terminée, je m'engage en échange de votre contribution à vous inviter à participer à mes ateliers et aux séances de coaching en toute gratuité pendant  6 mois, et par la suite à prendre gratuitement 2 personnes par mois en coaching ; et 5 places gratuites aux ateliers.

Mon objectif final serait de faire de cette activité mon unique métier, et donc de pouvoir en vivre. Mais aussi de faire bénéficier de mes compétences aux personnes qui ne pourront se permettre de se payer un coach ou un stage, c'est pour cela que je compte axer cette activité professionelle en 2 parties:  une partie avec stages et séances de coaching à mon compte, et une partie en bénévolat pour les personnes qui éprouvent des difficultés financières.

Je compte suivre ma formation à l'institut repère à Paris qui a une très bonne réputation pour les formations en  PNL.

Les différentes formations pour atteindre le statut de maître praticien sont divisées en plusieurs parties, si je n'obtiens pas la somme complète pour atteindre le niveau maître praticien, j'espère au moins obtenir assez pour atteindre les premiers niveaux ("fondamentaux, et technicien PNL") qui seront déjà un bon début pour se lancer dans une première aide aux autres.

Le but étant par la suite de permettre aux personnes de se sentir en phase avec elles mêmes, de leur donner les outils pour être heureux et atteindre leurs objectifs, cela me tient vraiment très à coeur. Le fait de faire des ateliers permettra aux personnes d'interagir entre elles, et pratiquer en groupe certains exercices en plus de suivis personnalisés. Même si j'ai une idée assez précise de ce que je veux faire, j'ai besoin de faire au préalable la formation ad hoc pour.

J'espère avoir votre soutien. Si vous avez des suggestions,questions,  ou même avis, je reste disponible et à votre écoute, n'hésitez pas à me contacter.

 

HELLO

My name is Laetitia, I am 29 years old and I am passionate about psychology and human. I aim to create workshops for personal development through NLP to: help people have a more positive outlook on life, help them achieve their goals and find the key that will make them happy. This is to me very heart it is a dream for me to organize these workshops, I feel like I'm meant to do, there is nothing else that excites me.

Once completed my training, I agree in exchange for your contribution to invite you to attend my workshops and coaching sessions in any free for 6 months, and then take two people a month free coaching, and 5 free workshops places.

My ultimate goal would be to make this activity my only job, and thus be able to live. But also to take advantage of my skills to people who can not afford to pay a coach or training, c is why I intend to focus this professional activity in two parts: one with training and coaching sessions to my account and part in volunteering for people who are experiencing financial difficulties.
I intend to follow my training institute landmark in Paris which in a very good reputation for NLP training.

Different formations to achieve the status of a master practitioner are divided into several parts, so I do not get the full amount to reach the practitioner maîctre level, I hope at least get enough to reach the first level ("Fundamental and NLP technician ") which will already be a good start to engage in a first aid to others.
The goal is eventually to allow people to feel in tune with them same, give them the tools to be happy and achieve their goals, it is really very heart. The making workshops will enable people to interact with each other, and group practice certain exercises and more personalized follow. Although I have a pretty precise about what I want to think, I need to make the first ad hoc training.
J hope to have your support. If you have suggestions, questions, or even notice, I am available and at your disposal, do not hesitate to contact me.

story:
Why this book:

For too long Churches have burned bridges with the LGBT community instead of extending love to them as our brothers and sisters. In this book, I want to introduce the reader to the controversial topic that is homosexuality. The book begins by sharing stories about the LGBT community hoping to humanize a demonized community, presents basic biblical scholarship pertaining to  homosexuality from both a traditional and progressive stance, and presents practical ways Christians can apologize for the wrongs done to the gay community and better show God’s love to the LGBT community. 

Why Me:

For most of high school, college, and working professionally as an actor in musical theatre, I have spent close to 15 years reading, researching, and studying the LGBT community. This has been through books, conferences, studying, and of course, befriending countless gay and lesbian individuals.

As an actor, I was immersed in the LGBT community and, even though I am heterosexual, was accepted into this community. It was here I learned not only about their community, but also about the incredible pain that many gay individuals have gone through by the hands of Christians.

Additionally, I spent two years on staff with The Marin Foundation who works to build bridges between the LGBT community and the church. I provided pastoral care for numerous individuals, counseled numerous individuals and families through the coming out process, and intentionally lived in a gay community with gay roommates for numerous years. Finally, I have written a 150-page thesis on the biblical scholarship pertaining to homosexuality and its relationship with the church community. 

I love my gay friends dearly. Not because they are gay, but simply because they are my friends. I desire nothing more than my gay friends whom I love to fall in love with Jesus, the God whom I love. 

PLEASE VISIT MY GALERY TO SEE PHOTOS!

"I Hugged a Man in His Underwear"

In 2010, I spent the day at Chicago’s Pride Parade. Some friends and I, with The Marin Foundation, wore shirts with “I’m Sorry” written on it. We had signs that said, “I’m sorry that Christians judge you,” “I’m sorry the way churches have treated you,” “I used to be a bible-banging homophobe, sorry.” We wanted to be an alternative Christian voice from the protestors that were there speaking hate into megaphones. This is the blog of my experience that day, the day I hugged a man in his underwear. 

http://naytinalbert.blogspot.com/2010/06/i-hugged-man-in-his-underwear-and-i-am.htm

Why You:

I am excited to say that I have signed with the Singleton Publishing Group. I am honored to be partnering with them on this project. To get this book published we need a minimum of $10,000 to cover the following expenses:

  • Cover Design
  • Book Printing 
  • First and Second Edits
  • Pagination
  • Marketing......and more marketing
  • ISBN and Copyright
  • Developmental Review
  • Indiegogo Fees

If we OVER raise:

SO much can happen! Such as, we can print more books and reach out through marketing to a broader scope of people.

If we under raise:

We will move forward with what funds we do have and look for ways to raise whatever else we need.

Other ways you can help:

I know each and every one of you works very hard for your money and I do not take your donations lightly. I also know that some people can't donate but you can STILL HELP!

  • Share my Campaign on Facebook, with your family, friends, etc
  • Pray! Your prayers for my book, campaign, and myself are tremendous!


More About Nathan:

Nathan is the Pastor of Student Ministries at Christ Church, in Rhode Island. Previously, he was the Collegelife Coordinator with University Ministries at North Park University in Chicago, IL and has also worked as the Director of Pastoral Care with The Marin Foundation. Nathan earned his Master of Divinity from North Park Theological Seminary where he focused his thesis on the Evangelical Covenant Church and the biblical scholarship pertaining to homosexuality. He is the author of the well-known post “I Hugged a Man in his Underwear,” which has been seen millions of times in over 24 different countries and has been seen on Buzzfeed, Huffington Post, and in the books Mere Churchianity and Post-Church Christian. Prior to his seminary education, Nathan earned a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Musical Theatre Performance from Rockford College and worked for years as a professional actor and singer performing for more than a quarter of a million people at numerous regional theatres across the U.S. Nathan has a passion to proclaim God’s word through the art of preaching and work for the re-humanization of the “other.” Nathan is recently married and has been loving the honeymoon stage with his wife, Kate. He might be addicted to "How I Met Your Mother" and/or Candy Crush and desires to be an avid thumb wrestler.  

Singleton Publishing Group:

MISSION STATEMENT: It is our mission to partner with authors, organizations, ministries, and other entities to produce, promote and distribute their message in its purest form; so as to inspire, educate, and empower the reader to affect change in their own spheres of influence.

OUR VISION is to develop a successful business model based on character, integrity, and power, by creating a community of partners working together to build sustainable relationships that revolutionize the publishing industry and levels the playing field for those with whom we are engaged, while growing the company and changing the world.

www.Singletonpublishing.com


Thank you all so very much for believing in me and this book!

story:
LAUNCHED!

The King of the Sun is a compelling psychological drama following the life of Cinder Slade, a genius solar-energy engineer and mastermind of a billion-dollar company, and his devoted, every-girl assistant, Colleen King.  As Colleen begins to understand her employer, she realizes that he is not the face that he presents to the public.  Cinder's facade is both his haven and his prison, and as colleagues, clients, friends and family break in, the foundations of his life and lies begin to crumble.  Colleen is desperate to protect her kind, inspiring friend from the cruel, careless attacks of his coworkers, family, the media and, most of all, himself.  

The King of the Sun is a finished, 398-pg novel soon to be self-published via Kindle, Nook and Lulu.com.  The crowdfunding campaign is to give it the best start possible, addressing the areas listed below.  Read the first chapter here (see the "Gallery" tag above) or find out more about Cinder and Colleen, the book and the cause on The King of the Sun website

The Cause


Though KotS is a work of fiction, the struggles it illustrates--depression, obsessive compulsive disorder, bipolar disorder, schizophrenia, abuse and others--are a reality for millions of people.  In this way, KotS is more than a self-published novel.  As a dedication to the real-life situations and, often, tragedies that parallel the book, all author's proceeds post-crowdfunding from sales on Amazon, Barnes and Nobel and Lulu.com will be donated to the National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI) "the nation's largest grassroots mental health organization dedicated to building better lives for the millions of Americans affected by mental illness." NAMI received top ratings by both CharityNavigator.org, CharityWatch.org and is accredited by the Better Business Bureau.  Through writing this book I've come to sympathize immensely with the issues NAMI addresses.  I am proud to put my creativity to work for such a laudable cause and I hope to inspire others in some small way.  Though the tribute is now small, its potential to reach larger audiences and pass on a positive message gets bigger with your support!

About the Author

The King of the Sun is my second self-published novel.  After the terrific reaction I received for my first, That Freak Kid, I had to do it again.  KotS was written over three years in college; furtively in boring business classes, obsessively in the wee hours of the night and endlessly over breaks.  It spent two years in the revising, editing and designing gauntlet and is finally finished and awaiting release.  

I write simply for the love of writing; it's the passion of my life.  Sometimes it's my job, sometimes it's my hobby, it's always my addiction.  Every praise, comment and critique on That Freak Kid has filled me with joy and I'm ecstatic to share my second novel with the world as well. 

Where the Money Goes

All funds contributed to The King of the Sun campaign will be re-invested directly back into the novel.  The areas these funds address include content refinement, marketing, advertising and production.  The novel has undergone rigorous editing and design by myself and multiple beta-readers to achieve a quality I am proud to put my name on.  Though any errors that are still present in no way interfere with the reading experience, so far all investments in KotS are from my own expertise, imagination and pocket.  So, a paid, professional edit to meet precise publishing specifications is a primary objective.  Specifically, the objectives are...

  • A final, professional edit for syntax and grammar
  • An artistic re-imagining of the cover by a professional artist
  • Building a library of copies for distribution to local bookstores
  • Website redesign; making a hub for info, questions, comments and fans
  • Advertising to achieve greater exposure
  • Representing The King of the Sun at a NY publishing conference to gain professional literary representation (flex goal; if funding expectations are exceeded)  

What You Get

Every contributor is buying a first-edition copy of The King of the Sun.  E-books will be emailed in a PDF file, which can be viewed on any device (including Nook, Kindle, Ipad etc.) equipped with Adobe Reader (a free downloadable program).  This comes via email thanking you for your support and authenticating your first "printing." Paperback copies will be signed by the author and mailed to you with a similar, personalized letter of authenticity.  Public shout-outs and thank yous will go out via Facebook, twitter, Google+ and be immortalized on the website, while upper-tier sponsors will also be thanked in the dedications page in the book, so every reader, for now and forever, will now your part in the story.  You can also receive insights into the unlikely origins, inspirations and questions about the book in the Author's Notes.  The King of the Sun is a complete text, but a universe of extra content was written that was never included.  You can read these in the exclusive "Deleted Scenes," which includes an Epilogue deleted for length, that will never be printed or distributed again.  Also, a select few can read the lurid extension, "Deleted Scenes: Red Edition," which contain elements excluded due to intense violent, sexual or offensive content not fitting with the theme.  Because of the delicate nature of this content distribution is limited to only 30 most loyal contributors.  Finally, 10 contributors receive an additional book entitled the Benefactor's Book, including all bonus content and the shocking, never before (and never again) seen original ending, with an explanation as to how, why and when it was changed, as well as the very first sneak-peek into the brand new first 10 chapters of the sequel, The King of the Sun: Gravastar.  See the rewards section for how to receive these exclusive prizes.

  • Everyone gets a book!
  • e-books
  • Signed paperbacks
  • bookmarks with cover art and thank you for support
  • Desktop Backgrounds (designs coming soon)
  • Public thank you: Twitter, Facebook, Google+, Website
  • In-book dedication to sponsors on first pages
  • *EXCLUSIVE CONTENT* never seen before (or again)--
  • Author's notes: insights into inspirations and common questions
  • Deleted scenes, including epilogue 
  • Scenes deleted due to unfitting violent, sexual or offensive content
  • Alternate ending
  • Original, sneak peek into the sequel

Other Ways You Can Help

The King of the Sun's ultimate goal is to build readership, so the biggest way you can help doesn't involve finances.  If you are as passionate as I am about this book and this cause, spread the word!  Tell your friends and family about The King of the Sun, link the website (below), video, this project or find me on Facebook, Twitter, or Google+.  Tell everyone you'll be getting the first copy of this book, or simply share--a few kind words about the book are worth more to me and it than you know! 

  • Re-post this, the video or website
  • Tell your friends about this must-read
  • Give Cinder and Colleen a shout-out on your blog
  • Subscribe on the website and get an e-book after publishing

Thanks for reading!  Enjoy!

Any questions? Comments? Drop a line here, on the website (www.thekingofthesun.webs.com), or on my twitter @samstemler or Facebook /S.Stemler
story_txt:
LAUNCHED!
The King of the Sun is a compelling psychological drama following the life of Cinder Slade, a genius solar-energy engineer and mastermind of a billion-dollar company, and his devoted, every-girl assistant, Colleen King.  As Colleen begins to understand her employer, she realizes that he is not the face that he presents to the public.  Cinder's facade is both his haven and his prison, and as colleagues, clients, friends and family break in, the foundations of his life and lies begin to crumble.  Colleen is desperate to protect her kind, inspiring friend from the cruel, careless attacks of his coworkers, family, the media and, most of all, himself.   
The King of the Sun is a finished, 398-pg novel soon to be self-published via Kindle, Nook and Lulu.com.  The crowdfunding campaign is to give it the best start possible, addressing the areas listed below.  Read the first chapter here (see the "Gallery" tag above) or find out more about Cinder and Colleen, the book and the cause on The King of the Sun website 
The Cause
Though KotS is a work of fiction, the struggles it illustrates--depression, obsessive compulsive disorder, bipolar disorder, schizophrenia, abuse and others--are a reality for millions of people.  In this way, KotS is more than a self-published novel.  As a dedication to the real-life situations and, often, tragedies that parallel the book, all author's proceeds post-crowdfunding from sales on Amazon, Barnes and Nobel and Lulu.com will be donated to the National Alliance on Mental Illness (NAMI) "the nation's largest grassroots mental health organization dedicated to building better lives for the millions of Americans affected by mental illness." NAMI received top ratings by both CharityNavigator.org, CharityWatch.org and is accredited by the Better Business Bureau.  Through writing this book I've come to sympathize immensely with the issues NAMI addresses.  I am proud to put my creativity to work for such a laudable cause and I hope to inspire others in some small way.  Though the tribute is now small, its potential to reach larger audiences and pass on a positive message gets bigger with your support! 
About the Author





The King of the Sun is my second self-published novel.  After the terrific reaction I received for my first, That Freak Kid, I had to do it again.  KotS was written over three years in college; furtively in boring business classes, obsessively in the wee hours of the night and endlessly over breaks.  It spent two years in the revising, editing and designing gauntlet and is finally finished and awaiting release.  



I write simply for the love of writing; it's the passion of my life.  Sometimes it's my job, sometimes it's my hobby, it's always my addiction.  Every praise, comment and critique on That Freak Kid has filled me with joy and I'm ecstatic to share my second novel with the world as well.  



Where the Money Goes

All funds contributed to The King of the Sun campaign will be re-invested directly back into the novel.  The areas these funds address include content refinement, marketing, advertising and production.  The novel has undergone rigorous editing and design by myself and multiple beta-readers to achieve a quality I am proud to put my name on.  Though any errors that are still present in no way interfere with the reading experience, so far all investments in KotS are from my own expertise, imagination and pocket.  So, a paid, professional edit to meet precise publishing specifications is a primary objective.  Specifically, the objectives are... 

A final, professional edit for syntax and grammar 

An artistic re-imagining of the cover by a professional artist

Building a library of copies for distribution to local bookstores
Website redesign; making a hub for info, questions, comments and fans
Advertising to achieve greater exposure 

Representing The King of the Sun at a NY publishing conference to gain professional literary representation (flex goal; if funding expectations are exceeded)  


What You Get
Every contributor is buying a first-edition copy of The King of the Sun.  E-books will be emailed in a PDF file, which can be viewed on any device (including Nook, Kindle, Ipad etc.) equipped with Adobe Reader (a free downloadable program).  This comes via email thanking you for your support and authenticating your first "printing." Paperback copies will be signed by the author and mailed to you with a similar, personalized letter of authenticity.  Public shout-outs and thank yous will go out via Facebook, twitter, Google+ and be immortalized on the website, while upper-tier sponsors will also be thanked in the dedications page in the book, so every reader, for now and forever, will now your part in the story.  You can also receive insights into the unlikely origins, inspirations and questions about the book in the Author's Notes.  The King of the Sun is a complete text, but a universe of extra content was written that was never included.  You can read these in the exclusive "Deleted Scenes," which includes an Epilogue deleted for length, that will never be printed or distributed again.  Also, a select few can read the lurid extension, "Deleted Scenes: Red Edition," which contain elements excluded due to intense violent, sexual or offensive content not fitting with the theme.  Because of the delicate nature of this content distribution is limited to only 30 most loyal contributors.  Finally, 10 contributors receive an additional book entitled the Benefactor's Book, including all bonus content and the shocking, never before (and never again) seen original ending, with an explanation as to how, why and when it was changed, as well as the very first sneak-peek into the brand new first 10 chapters of the sequel, The King of the Sun: Gravastar.  See the rewards section for how to receive these exclusive prizes.


Everyone gets a book!
e-books
Signed paperbacks

bookmarks with cover art and thank you for support 

Desktop Backgrounds (designs coming soon)
Public thank you: Twitter, Facebook, Google+, Website

In-book dedication to sponsors on first pages
*EXCLUSIVE CONTENT* never seen before (or again)--

Author's notes: insights into inspirations and common questions

Deleted scenes, including epilogue 
Scenes deleted due to unfitting violent, sexual or offensive content

Alternate ending 

Original, sneak peek into the sequel 






Other Ways You Can Help
The King of the Sun's ultimate goal is to build readership, so the biggest way you can help doesn't involve finances.  If you are as passionate as I am about this book and this cause, spread the word!  Tell your friends and family about The King of the Sun, link the website (below), video, this project or find me on Facebook, Twitter, or Google+.  Tell everyone you'll be getting the first copy of this book, or simply share--a few kind words about the book are worth more to me and it than you know!

Thanks for reading!  Enjoy!

story:
AMAZIGH, AN ANCIENT HERITAGE ON THE VERGE OF EXTINCTION.

The Amazigh people are the indigenous people of North Africa and live in countries like Algeria, Libya, Mali, Mauritania, Morocco, Niger, and Tunisia. The Amazigh race is comprised of a multitude of ethnic groups from the Berber, Tuaregs, Imuhagh, Zuwaras, Zenetas, Tlemcen Berbers, Siwi, Shawiya, Riffians, Nafusis, Mozabites, Matmata, Kabyles, Djerba, Chenoui, Chenini & Douiret, Chlouhs, Chaoui, Brabers, Blida and Gaunches.

Most of the Amazigh populations live in sheer poverty and some live in war-laden countries around the continent of Africa.

OUR INSPIRATION.

I'm Khedidja Ouheb, a scholar, a non-profit employee, a wife, a contributor, an author and a full-time Executive MBA student. I am currently employed by a non-profit organization in Northern Virginia as an Orphan Program Coordinator. This campaign and work is very important to me, being of Amazigh heritage myself, to raise awareness about the Amazigh people and keep our culture, traditions, and way of life alive for future generations to come.

OUR WORK.

We are raising funds to launch our non-profit the Amazigh Heritage Foundation and kick off the first of many programs. Amazigh Heritage Foundation will be a non-profit that educates and raises awareness on the indigenous culture of the Amazigh people, helping them to improve and thrive in a better environment. Our goals are to promote, protect, and share the cultural heritage of the indigenous Amazigh populations through ADVOCACY, CULTURAL PRESERVATION, CROSS-CULTURAL EXCHANGE, EDUCATIONAL EVENTS, and HUMANITARIAN RELIEF. 

We are asking for your support to keep the Amazigh Heritage and the Amazigh people alive and assist us in making this common dream of an indigenous people come to fruition.

"THE LEGEND OF ARKATAK" BOOK PROJECT.

The first project we are launching under the Amazigh Heritage Foundation is publishing the book "The Legend of Arkatak," a folktale rooted in Amazigh history and traditions. This tale was passed from generation to generation from mouth to ear amongst the Berbers of the desert, which are also known as the Tuareg or blue men of the desert and we would like to share it with YOU and a LARGER AUDIENCE.

The protagonist is Arkatak, a handicapped boy who goes through many obstacles of life as he grows up to become the strongest man in the world, eventually becoming immortal. Arkatak was born handicapped from a woman that was a beggar at day and a demon at night. His father was a king that eventually died too soon before Arkatak grew up.

Arkatak finds himself on the streets with his mother in a very desperate situation. They both go through many heartaches, problems and financial difficulties. Although Arkatak goes through the hardest moments in his life. It is within these hardest moments that he finds his true inner strength and eventually shines. Through multiple stages, trials, tribulations, one harder than the other one, he transforms himself to become one of the strongest force to ever exist in the universe.

The legend of Arkatak is a book that will give hope and strength to its readers, showing them that amid the worst scenarios life can bring, and out of utter chaos, can come out success and the potential for a better life. From that angle, this is what Amazigh Heritage Foundation will do to its best, to bring light on this obscure indigenous culture lost between, time, space and poverty on the continent of Africa.

This is a quick quote left by an Amazigh man after an epiphany "I am proud of you my ancestor "Massinissa" you glorious king of the Berbers. If only you knew what happened to your country. Where the majority of your progeny have forgotten their origins and their culture, and they have even insulted their origins. They have adopted a foreign language that originates from a land that is far, far away from our land "thousands of miles.""

YOUR SUPPORT. 

With your much needed help, this campaign will contribute to the launch of the Amazigh Heritage Foundation and our first program--publishing "The Legend of Arkatak."

The first $10,000 raised will cover the completion costs for "The Legend of Arkatak." The funds will go to support hiring a professional editing firm, creating the artwork design and layout for the front and back book covers, and, lastly, printing hard copies of the book.

Once we officially release the final copy of "The Legend of Arkatak" on the market, it will be sold in both eBook and hard copy format and funds raised from the sale of the book will be reinvested to sustain the Amazigh Heritage Foundation.

The remaining $20,000 of funds raised through this campaign will help us launch the non-profit by covering operational and programming costs. We will design and launch a website for Amazigh Heritage Foundation, which will be an educational resource for Amazigh Heritage, and launch additional programs.

WE THANK YOU FOR YOUR GENEROUS SUPPORT OF INDIGENOUS POPULATIONS AND THE AMAZIGH HERITAGE FOUNDATION.

story:
Shifting Lanes

 A wrong target resulting in a punishment transfer lands Detective Luke Parish in the narcotics wing. Battling his emotions, and trying to overcome his greatest fear, now Parish is in the most vulnerable state of mind when he meets Detective Collins. Detective Collins – a complete contrast to Parish. A go lucky young charmer who enjoys life as it comes. Collins has been entrusted with operation “Clear spot”, the drive to wipe out the drug mafia infecting the city and its young population. Together Collins and Parish lead this war against Orlando – The leader of the drug mafia. Do they succeed? Does Parish overcome his greatest fear? With unexpected twists and turns all way along, shifting lanes is sure to keep the reader engrossed and enthralled till the very end with the most unexpected climax. Intertwined pasts, unseen action – a complete entertainer in every sense.

Down the Farm

After spending grueling years in the army Sergeant Barnes returns to his hometown wishing to lead a peaceful life and spend his time working on his farm. But Barnes is unaware of the danger lurking in the darkness. A family feud and a sinister murder plan leave Barnes in a serious lurch. The plot thickens with every move but Barnes is not alone in this war against the feudal lords. He is helped by a group of youngsters. But is this help enough? Do they overpower the feudal lords? Does Barnes succeed in having a peaceful life at the farm? Read on to know more and partner Barnes in this action adventure.

Requirements & Deliverables:-

All contributions made by you will be towards the following production and promotion costs.

  • Writing
  • Editing
  • Proof Reading
  • Cover Design
  • Layout for the print book
  • Marketing
  • Printing Costs
  • Online Marketing Costs

The returns provided, based on your munificent contribution would be as follows:

  • Digital Posters of the Books
  • Poster (Printed) of the Books
  • E-Book version of the Shifting Lanes(Book 1) and Down the Farm(Book 2)
  • Listing and Special Mention in acknowledgement .(Varies according to contributions)

 

Author’s note:

Being a regular blogger and online marketing consultant never stopped me from writing short stories and novels. This will be my first work to be printed. Hope my readers enjoy every part of these books just as I enjoyed writing it.

 

Please help us by spreading the word about this project to your friends, family and in your social network circle.

story:
On April 4th, 2015, I will be marrying the love of my life. I am a writer, a starving artist. I am not a wealthy man, but I want to give her a wedding she will remember for the rest of her life. Because she deserves it.

So, I did what writers do. I wrote a book. Contribute to the wedding, and get a signed copy of the book and a very public "Thank You" from the author in acknowledgement of your gift.  It's that simple. But you will have also played a part in something beautiful that will change both our lives forever. I love this woman. She is the woman I never thought I would be lucky enough to find. And she has made me happier than I ever imagined I could be. Help me make her happy too while taking home a piece of horror and depravity.

This book will contain short stories of extreme erotic horror including:

"SEXY" A man spots a woman on a motorcycle he thinks he knows and begins to follow her. Everything he thinks he knows about life, sex, and death is turned upside down as he witnesses acts of depravity beyond his wildest imagination.
"RAZOR BLADE FUCK TOY" What happens when a masochist goes too far in search of the next endorphin rush and deliberately puts himself in the path of a sadistic serial killer.
"LARGER THAN GOD" Lord is the ultimate dominant male. Or could he be just a bit more. When he demands submission, he wants your heart... And soul.
"SWITCH" A couple's sadomasochism turns into a competition as they challenge each other to see who can give ... and take... the most pain. 
This book will also contains popular true erotic stories of domination and submission: "HARDER DADDY", "THE WHOLE DAMN BAG", and "STAY IN THE LINES" as well as several, never before seen stories and poetry.

story:
The White Review is a new arts and literature journal published in print on a quarterly basis. The review was conceived as a platform to promote the work of a new generation of writers and artists unconstrained by form, subject or genre. It takes its name and a degree of inspiration from La Revue Blanche, a Parisian magazine which ran from 1899 to 1903. Each issue of The White Review publishes new fiction, poetry, essays, reportage, artwork and photography, as well as lengthy transcribed interviews with writers, artists and thinkers. 

 

The first issue included interviews with Tom McCarthy, Paula Rego and Andre Schiffrin, previously unpublished Primo Levi letters and new writing by D.W. Wilsonand Desmond Hogan. To see the full table of contents click here. 

 

The second issue, launched in June 2011, features interviews with William Boyd, Richard Wentworth and Michael Hardt, fiction by Joshua Cohen and Diego Trelles Paz, reportage by Annabel Howard on the Neapolitan religious festival of Montervergine, essays on the politics of French literature and artistic collaboration and poetry by Lee Rourke, Ahren Warner, Graham Foust and Man Booker-longlisted author Patrick McGuinness. Cover art was provided by Lewis Irvine and accompanied by J.H. Engstrom’s photography and artwork by Noam Toran and Onkar Kular, and Sophie von Cundale. For the complete table of contents, click here.  


This campaign will help to cover production costs for the third issue, due out at the beginning of October, which will notably feature interviews with Will Self, Marina Warner and Elmgreen & Dragset.  Each issue – around 200 pages long – is printed on luxurious cream paper using a bespoke typeface and includes a dust jacket that unfolds as a limited edition print.

 

The journal’s appeal as a collectible object has been met with widespread enthusiasm. The Times Literary Supplement applauded The White Review for investing in ‘the attention to design and typefaces that makes the business of reading an intimate act, as much as a cerebral one’ and Dazed & Confused called The White Review ‘one of the most handsome and astutely edited periodicals that we’ve seen come out of this town in ages.’

 

In light of the recent public funding cuts to the arts world in the UK, we are seeking the help of generous philanthropists who share our conviction that emerging talents deserve greater exposure. Funding for our third issue, which goes to press at the beginning of September 2011, will come mostly from sales of No.2.  However, in order to meet our $12,000 budget, we are appealing to you to raise $2,000. Please help us prove there is an alternative model for publishing. 

 

Our various donation levels are named after prominent contributors to La Revue Blanche. Each level entitles the donor to a number of benefits, as detailed here =>

 

Any donations in excess of $2,000 will go towards remunerating contributors for their work. 

 

Thank you very much for your support and please spread the word!

 

@TheWhiteReview

 

http://www.facebook.com/pages/The-White-Review/210092942366874

story:
Oh, hi! You found me! I’m Becca. I’m a speculative fiction author, a poet, an editor, a grad student at CalArts, an artist, a costumer.

You can read more about me here.

And I’m super excited to tell you that I’ve been accepted to attend the 2015 Clarion Science Fiction & Fantasy Writers’ Workshop at UCSD!

[cue squealing with delight]

What is Clarion?

Clarion one of the best six-week-long workshop during the summer for writers of short science fiction and fantasy. Every year, they invite six superfamous, superpublished, superawesome instructors and about 18 students of up-and-coming-ness to learn from the best. You can read more about them here.

My Work

For the past three years, I’ve dedicated myself completely to the study of fiction. Yes, often sci-fi and fantasy. Ghost stories and monsters. Doomed love and voices from another realm. I love talking with authors about their work, workshopping, critiquing and editing. Seriously, I don’t have a life.

I’ve sold fifteen short stories, flash fictions, and poems. You can read some of them here for free.

I firmly believe that science fiction and fantasy is not only fun to read, but is crucial to understanding our world. It helps us gain distance and insight on our fantasies, fears, and frustrations in order to deal with them in in RL (what we cave-dwelling writers call Real Life).

I personally love exploring the dark “what ifs?” that speculative fiction makes possible. What if you swallow a pit and it really does grow a tree in your belly? What if people continued to speak even after they died? What if there’s a thing called bugshot and you can use it as a biological weapon against your enemies?!?! Wouldn’t that be awesome?!

Ahem. Anyway.

What I’ll Do at Clarion

I applied to Clarion UCSD with the explicit intention of working on a book of related short stories. For this book, I began with a long short story set in an old world almost like ours, but with one huge difference: there is no distinction between what is animal, what is plant, and what is human. I plan to continue writing stories in this world, the book to be finished, with any luck, by mid-2016.

I’m also so excited to draft new stories, putting form to new ideas and just generally feeding off of the lifeforce out of my classmates and instructors. Less of a vampire thing, more of a symbiotic-birds-feeding-off-the-detritus-of-a-rhinoceros-back thing. That's a metaphor that people use, right?

I Need Your Help

Here’s the part where I ask you for money.

I need your help to get to Clarion. The tuition cost is about $5,000 for six weeks of intensive, high-level work in the field that I love. That includes housing and some meals.

Today I’m just asking for $2,600 to cover anything I’m not able to.

The good souls at The Clarion Foundation were very generous awarding me a scholarship. However, I’m currently pursuing my Master in Fine Arts from California Institute of the Arts, and am doing most of that on loans. I hold two part-time jobs, and I will be paying out of my savings (from that short-lived bout with a full-time job), but I simply don’t have enough to cover the cost on my own.

That’s where you come in.

Perks

If you help me out, I’ll make it worth your while. *eyebrow waggle*

There are some supercool perks I’m offering to the right:

  • You can get ebooks, signed print books, or a White Elephant gift.
  • I love editing and have been editing part-time for about four years. I’m offering short story critiques and manuscript critiques for those writerly types out there.
  • There’s some awesome handmade items I’d love to customize for you--cloaks, for example.
  • Art prints!
  • You can even get me to write you a customized story all your very own!

May the odds be ever in your favor!

Last but not least, you’ll get my eternal gratitude and a big I-O-U.

If you want books or any handmade item, be sure to let me know on checkout which book, which color, etc. If you leave it blank, I’ll pick out something cool for you :)

Thank You!

If you can’t donate right now, I totally understand. Please share with your friends, especially those who love reading science fiction and fantasy!

Thanks so much for sticking around (and putting up with that video). This is a huge step in my career and I'm so glad you're taking this journey with me. I’m feeling warmly toward you all at the moment.

And so does the entire Writing Muse Team.
